description:
Enjoyed a beautiful meal and experience here with my parents while they were in town for a visit. The owner, Lorenzo, was our host as well as continued service and entertainment along with one other man for the whole restaurant. We enjoyed the chefs menu and were pleased, stuffed, and all left saying it was the best meal we had ever had, as well as 2 roses for all of the ladies. Treat yourself. Eat here. You will return. 

Our meal: 
Appetizers- burrata with prosciutto and cheese, beet and mozzarella caprese, bruschetta, asparagus with parmesan crust, and a carpaccio 
Second Course- Truffle Risotto (hand shaved truffle table-side) best of the night 
Third Course- Pasta Carbonara with more fresh shaved truffle (also amazing!!!) 
Fourth Course- White fish (can't remember the type) with spinach and asparagus and a pesto and lemon 
Dessert- Chocolate cake, cheesecake, tiramisu, biscotti, and melon as well as port 

Highly recommend chefs menu for both food and overall experience
author: Emily L.

description:
Lorenzo, we hope you'll never be treated in the same condescending and bitter way you treated us when you dine out with your loved ones. You made it obvious to showed favoritism and charismatic side to other tables all around us.

How do we know this? You spent time patiently at other tables to tell them the special of the day, you smiled & joked, and you asked them how things tasted. People can    pick up on your coldness and blunt attitude even when you say "it's whatever you want" in a poor attempt to bury your sarcasm because we didn't follow your tasting recommendation. 

My husband and I ordered, ate and left within 40 minutes of our 7 o'clock reservation. I know because I checked the time we walked out at 7:45pm and also because you reminded me multiple times that there was an 8 oclock reservation. 

There's confetti and rose petals on the table, but when the owner whips around huffing & puffing to show his frustration, no amount of decor will help suck out the negative energy. We called to check if there was an opening tonight and if you felt stressed about the timing, pls DON'T accept the reservation.

Our waiter was kind and treated us like guests, thank you Ernesto, you showed us true grace! Should have read fellow yelper Stella K's spot on review of this place.
author: Kris L.

description:
My wife and I made reservations on OpenTable a couple weeks in advance hoping to have a nice romantic dinner date night. We live nearby and had been looking forward to trying it.

Well, on the day of the reservation we were notified that our reservation was canceled. We were disappointed, but we figured that some unexpected mishap had happened to the restaurant, even though we were offered no explanation for the cancellation. (I imagined that there must have been some sort of plumbing problem, or maybe a family emergency, or something of that nature, and we figured that we'd just try again some other time)

Since it was still date night, we ended up having an excellent dinner at Cocotte a few blocks away. Just out of curiosity, we decided to walk past Allegro Romano after dinner to see what kind of unexpected mishap had befallen them to cause them to cancel our reservation.  Well, the restaurant was open for business and there were plenty of people eating there!  WTF?

Just to be sure, we checked our email and voice mails to make sure that they didn't request that we confirm our reservation, and nada. They just straight up canceled our reservation that we had made 3+ weeks in advance just because they wanted to bump us for someone else. 

Based on other reviews, canceling reservations without notice or explanation is standard practice for Allegro Romano.
author: Allen T.

description:
Food 3/5 and Service 1/5. Really disappointed about this place.

I came to this place about two years ago and had a really good impression on it. Today, I revisited again with my friends and we had a TERRIBLE time here. I will never come back again and I don't recommend you to come to this place if you are craving for Italian food. There are so many better Italian restaurants in the Bay Area.

The service at this place was HORRIBLE. There were only two servers: the owner of the restaurant and one staff member. When my boyfriend and I arrived at the restaurant, the owner was chatting with some guests and did not come to seat us immediately. After we were seated, besides asking what water we needed, the staff/owner did not even bother to come to our table. Maybe coz our two other friends hadn't arrived yet? Well, after everyone arrived at our table, no one came to us to tell us the daily special or take the order. We had to call the staff/owner several times before they finally unfriendly came. EXCUSE ME? When the owner was telling us the daily special, he was really fast and did not explain each daily special dish at all: "risotto today is with truffles and the day of the fish is halibut." When I tried to ask him what were the sides for the fish, he said "spinach" indifferently. 

The food came decently fast. Overall, the starters (meatballs (4.5/5), arugula salad (4/5)) and the pasta dishes (ravioli with lobster (4/5) and carbonara (4/5) were good. But the secondi, which were meat & fish were NOT GOOD AT ALL. We ordered the filet mignon. Well, when the owner was taking our order, he did not bother to how well we wanted the steak to be cooked. When the mignon showed up, it was OVER COOKED. It was so dry that I had trouble chewing. Also, the steak had a stale smell. We did not know a restaurant could make such TERRIBLE steak. It was the WORST steak I have ever had so far. 

Terrible terrible experience at this place.
author: Clare L.

description: Made a reservation on OpenTable for 8 p.m.  on a Saturday night. Showed up and the place was... closed. What?! No call, no email, no message from the restaurant to say they were not open for business. And we weren't the only ones...there with us at the top of the hill was another couple who also made a reservation and also could not eat because the damn place was... closed. I've never come across a situation like this in my life, but I have to say it's incredibly unprofessional.
author: Anthony D.

description:
I almost never write reviews, but I have to call out this place for both its mediocre food and service. The main points were:

1) Bad service -- the waiter and owner were both very curt, borderline rude. For example, we asked for bread, and the waiter snapped back "I'll get it when I'm ready!"

2) Terrible food -- Bread was a Safeway-esque baguette, served cold obviously.... The beef was cooked well-done! What a shame, I feel bad for the cow. The meat also had a weird taste to it, almost rancid. 

The only reason this isn't a 1 star review is that the restaurant is cute, and the pasta was OK (but served cold).
author: Victor Z.

description:
What an experience!! First of all this small neighborhood spot, nestled into a Russian Hill enclave, is easy to miss. It's marked by a beastly array of Ducati or a beautifully ( belonging to the eccentric owner Lorenzo... more on him later) antique moto from Italy. On to the food. My mother and her side of the family were Italian, so I am a tough critic when it comes to Italian food. If I had to describe it in one word it would be authentic. Our first visit... yes there have been several now... was our wedding anniversary weekend spent in the city. We were joined by great friends and it was recommended by the concierge at the Ritz-Carlton SF. Can't go wrong there.. when Uber pulled up, it's a tiny little place atop a hill in the Russian Hill neighborhood with a view of the bay bridge that is spectacular at night. Romantic and great photo op. 
I could make suggestions, but it really doesn't matter what you order, it will be lovingly prepared to perfection. You will want to moan with each bite, not kidding, because the flavor profiles with each course are thoughtfully planned and executed. 
What makes this place even more special is Lorenzo himself. His reputation is a hot headed bad boy, however, it's his passion that makes this place so magical. Without passion with food, it would just be sustenance. When you are this passionate about something and your heart is all in like Lorenzo's, if your toes are stepped on, or if you feel insulted, then stand back. We love him. His spirit is Allegro Romano. 
This place has a cult following for a reason. Stern warning, you better book in advance... it's always full!
author: victoria b.

description:
I've been to 15/20 regions of Italy and had hundreds of delicious meals from simple trattorias in Campania up to Michelin starred osterias in Modena.

After nine years as a resident in Pac Heights I've come to enjoy a handful of neighborhood Italian restaurants (Venticello, Seven Hills, Frascati, Jackson Fillmore Trattoria, Milano) and have had Allegro on my short list to try for years.

I made a reservation for 8pm on a Sunday via opentable (the restaurant closes at 9:30).  My companion arrived at 8:02pm and was told that they didn't want to honor our reservation because the kitchen staff is cooking a wedding tomorrow and needs to go home early.  I arrived at 8:06pm and spoke with the owner who was hardly apologetic.  

Based upon other reviews it's not uncommon for them to cancel confirmed reservations.
author: JP C.

description: This place was a genuine, quaint, and amazing. The staff was unbelievably attentive and the food was delicious. The owner is straight from Italy and has several restaurants. It's apparent that he knows what he is doing in this business. The only knock  I could have on this place where the portions. I'm not large eater but I thought they were a bit small. Beyond this though the place was spectacular. Great place for a nice romantic evening for two even though we came as a group.
author: Robert C.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant, hands down. Lorenzo really goes above and beyond and it shows! It's authentic, delicious, and honestly it doesn't even feel like a restaurant - it's like going to your favorite Italian friend's family's house for dinner. The food is incredible (like Omg-I-just-died-and-went-to heaven delicious) and the service is unparalleled. There's simply no comparison. Thank you so much Lorenzo, we can't wait to come back!!
author: Sarah T.

description:
We have been coming here for YEARS...had osso bucco tonight tender great polenta and gravy accompaniment. Bruschetta to start with pesto tortellini to start. We dine here. Great mello chianti accompaniment. Desert sampler ohhhh!
Come to Lorenzo's if you can!

Update!!!  Still our favorite SF Italian. We even took two orders of the wild boar ragu to go home with us. THE BEST!!!!
author: David A.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite to go spots! 
Very authentic and unique. 
Such lovely owner and such amazing food. 
I am very picky when it comes to Italian food and this place has exceeded expectations.
author: Taraneh G.

description:
Some things are best unexpected.  This one was it.  I left it up to someone else to decide where to dine and that doesn't happen too often.  (However, I was secretly testing the waters to see where I will be taken.)

Located on top of Russian Hill and at a corner spot surrounded by residential homes, this restaurant may be quite modestly hidden.  Let's keep it that way because it leaves it so charming to be dining here. 

Entering inside from a fairly long week, the tables are topped with rose petals, which exudes the romantic ambiance of a wine and dine affair that awaits. 

Service was splendid.  Wine was recommended by our lovely, red lipstick waitress and it complimented well with the entrees.  I insisted on ordering up a bottle to indulge for a Fri-date.  Why not?  It calms the nerves and lessens my anxious mind, which puts me at ease for a suave conversation to take place.  

They offer a tasting family menu that included 4 courses with dessert.  I'd wish I have known that so I could have tried a varietal of dishes from this intimate restaurant.  (Probably, it was a sign to return.)

Our waitress informed the chef to divvy up the plates and it was nice.  They sure know how to cook up their creamy risotto.  I adored the scallops with squid ink risotto in aged balsamic bell pepper bisque as a starter.  Their dover sole fish in caper sauce with black olive risotto was solid and on point.  I loved the lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce.  It was superbly fresh and every bite of that was accounted for.  

It was about sunset when the dining was over and there was still daylight.  If you step right outside, the view of the city with the Transamerica building at the central point, is at a bird's eye.  

There's nothing like an admirable city view in sunset colors with pleasant dining to end a healthy day.  

I had a lovely time here and this restaurant surely caught me off guard on how pleasant it was to be!  

The best things are unexpected because there were no expectations.  Contemplated and saw that begin again.  Yours truly, Tiffany D.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Really enjoyed this restaurant. Elegant and simplistic. Food was outstanding. Great for a date, business dinner, easy entertaining with in-laws. Each course was impressive. Wine menu was very impressive. Staff treated us to port and biscotti which is a nice finishing touch. Cant wait to bring friends and family here.
author: Derrick J.

description:
Was recommended to us by a friend and it did not disappoint! 

Three of us had dinner here around 9:00pm on a Friday night. We were promptly seated even though we did not have a reservation. We split a bottle wine (Chianti). A friend of mine and I each got the "Sea Urchin Pasta ala Carbonara" and both plates were clean when the picked them up. After eating all of our meals both reached for the bread to finish the sauces left. Absolutely amazing! My girlfriend had the "Tortelloni filled with White Truffle Burrata- Taleggio cheese al Pesto". She also loved her meal and my little taste, I'd have to agree. 

The service was great as we had Lorenzo as our host and server. Lorenzo has pictures of himself with spots stars and celebrities that have eaten there on one of the walls. He had a very unique outfit on in every picture but that just added to the ambience of Allegro Romano. He even dropped off a rose for the women at tables when the check was brought out. He was great and I have already started recommending to Bay Area friends to go for a nice little Nob Hill Italian experience.  

Lorenzo mentioned that they were catering a wedding the following day and I think I can speak for all of us in that we wish we had been invited to said wedding just for the food. 

Would 100% recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice Italian date spot in the Nob Hill area of San Francisco.
author: Rob P.

description: Everything is perfect about this place. Incredible food and an amazing staff. This place is not pretentious and as real as it's gets.
author: Matthew S.

description: Made a reservation on open table here for a party of 6 for Monday April 30th.  At the time I made the reservation I was asked to guarantee the reservation with a credit card.  I had to agree that if I cancelled with less than 48 hour notice, I would be charged $40pp.   Monday morning, I received an email stating that the restaurant had canceled my reservation.  I called the restaurant and left a voice mail but no one returned my call.  This is not right!  I want $240 from the restaurant because they canceled me, they would have done the same if I had canceled.
author: lenny A.

description: Had probably one of the best Italian dinners ever here.  Not only was the food insane and the wine spectacular, the service was over the top. Lorenzo and his team were incredible hosts.  He has a huge gregarious personality that makes you feel as if you are part of the family.  Could not recommend this restaurant enough. Will go there every time I am I SF.
author: Bob P.

description:
This place has really changed over the years. My husband and I have been going to Allegro Ramano for over thirteen years. We would take friends and family for dinner, celebrate special occasions, and highly recommend it to everyone. We didn't go here because of the food, because to be honest it was just OK. We dined here because of the AMAZING wait staff and ambiance of the restaurant. When the servers, Eric and Oscar, left a few years ago to work at other restaurants things started to change. However, we still would come for the tradition of always celebrating our anniversary.
My husband and I arrived in good spirits and excited to celebrate our anniversary. We were seated at the table near the door, which was a frequent stop for diners who wanted to admire the photos of celebrities from years ago. In fact, a couple stopped and asked us to move so she take a picture of Bono because she was from Ireland. Not a big deal, we enjoyed chatting with her and she inquired what she should order and do we like the restaurant. As always, we were very complimentary.
A older man was seated next to us and was waiting for his son to arrive. When his son arrived, he got up to welcome him, but bumped the table to the left of him and ended up knocking over the carafe of wine. Some wine spilled, but it wasn't much.
Lorenzo, the owner, came over and quickly moved the patron from the table that the wine had spilled. Lorenzo seemed very annoyed and the older man felt really bad. In the older man's defense, there wasn't much room between the tables making it difficult for anyone to squeeze by. A few minutes later, the older gentleman and son were moved to the corner to make room for a party of four. 
The party of four were seated next to us and within three minutes, they all got up and left. On their way out, I said to the younger woman, "This place is amazing." She informed me that they were leaving because her in laws were NOT happy there wasn't hard liquor. The waitress, Adrianna, came rushing towards the door and looked at me with a puzzled look of why they would be leaving. I told her they wanted liquor. Seconds later, Lorenzo still looking pissed from the wine spill quickly ran out the door to catch them. When they both came back in Lorenzo was beyond furious and Adrianna looked beside herself.
Right after this is when our experience went quickly down hill.
Our food came and we weren't offered any cheese like in all past experiences. Not once did anyone stop by to see if we wanted anything else. Adrianna and Lorenzo didn't make eye contact with us and quickly whizzed by our table. 
Since my order was missing the protein I ordered, I was still hungry so I decided to order another plate of pasta. We had to flag her down as she was running by our table. In passing, we asked to get another order of pasta. When they finally dropped off the pasta, we had to ask for another glass of wine. 
As mentioned earlier, the one reason we continued to go to this place was for the service. The service we were receiving was not normal. We realized that Lorenzo and the staff were taking out their anger and frustration on us for the wine spill and the four top leaving... EVEN THOUGH IT HAD NOTHING TO DO WITH US.
The pesto pasta was bland and one of the plates had a hard stub of asparagus in it. The snapper was over cooked and lacked flavor. When we finished our less than par meal, Adrianna slammed down the bill and began to walk off.  I commented we we're going to get dessert. She rolled her eyes and huffed and proceeded to rattle off the desserts. I was shocked by her blunt rudeness. I told her nevermind, we will go somewhere else. 

I tried to catch Lorenzo several times to apologize for saying his restaurant was amazing to the people who left and inform him that we wouldn't be back, but he ignored me and proceeded to stop at all of the other tables, but ours. 
At one point, I tried to catch him by the restroom, but he was too busy yelling at his staff for something.
Shortly after leaving, my husband didn't feel well and hurried home to the toilet.
After looking at the reviews on Yelp it appears many people have been treated this way by Lorenzo and his staff on multiple occasions. It is quite disappointing. The good news is that there are thousands of OUTSTANDING restaurants in the city that are better than Allegro and would love to provide top notch service to patrons. We will not be back, but will definitely have a story to tell about getting food poisoning and the lack of customer service that we received on our anniversary. Thanks Lorenzo for showing us your true colors after all these years.
Ciao!
author: Stella K.

description:
Molto bene!

Allegro has the makings of the perfect dinner date: romantic environs, cozy feel and scrumptious food. Add a glass of prosecco or vino and voila! instant 5 stars date night.

Even more fun is when you're on a double date night. Cat and Ryan have been here numerous times and swear by the foie gras pasta made with al dente rigatoni, tender aspargus spears in an undeniably rich foie gras sauce. LIP. SMACKING. GOOD. Lighten up your meal with a caprese salad and a creamy tomato soup. Finish off with the sinful chocolate tartufo (skip the cappucino cake!)

Service is easy and caring, especially when the owner hands you complimentary port, biscotti and fruit before he sends you off for part two of your date. 

Where's that? sorry, you're not invited ;-)
author: Janice C.

description: Atmosphere is great. Owner is very nice and goes out of his way to make sure you enjoy everything. My wife and I had a wonderful experience. Food is fantastic. Highly recommend this place and will definitely be back
author: Jason R.

description:
What a gem! It's a small restaurant with a very neighborhood feeling and just quintessential San Francisco. The waiters are so friendly and attentive. The place is just so old school, with white table clothes and rose pedals, yes rose pedals, on the table!! And every table gets complimentary biscotti with whipped cream and the ladies get a long stem rose. All the wines are poured into glass decanters to help it air. I mean, this type of service and attention to detail just doesn't really exist in the city anymore.

The food was amazing, too. We shared an app, a pasta and a main. The waitress split the plates for us, free of charge. She offered it, we didn't even have to ask. We had the beef carpaccio, gnocchi and the scallopini. The gnocchi was pillowy light. It's the top three gnocchi that I've had in San Francisco. We also had the cheesecake for dessert. It was OK, nothing outstanding, but definitely hit the spot.

With a bottle of wine, our total was around $120. Compared to 90% of middle price range restaurants in the city, I would say it's top 8. Just fantastic.
author: Alice W.

description:
best night in quite some time! wow over the top special treatment and i haven't even mentioned the to die for food!!! the beet caprese, the bruschetta and the thinly sliced beef .... so good!
Then we had dinner and every entree was shared and enjoyed! the sea bass for the light and healthy and the risotto meant
or be shared! the oso bucco delicious as we're the pasta dishes ...: then they break out in song.... and hugs and conversations .... it is a truly
special place one i hope to return to more than once! i'm still smiling
author: Laurie H.

description: Disappointed. Had wanted to try for a long time and was nothing to write home about. Food was passable. Wine was so so, meatballs tastes processed. Lobster ravioli was meh. Ambiance and location were nice and old school.
author: Andrew K.

description: This is where I go when I want to have a great time. The host, Lorenzo, is welcoming and full of life. The food is great especially the white truffle sauce over fresh linguine with tons of fresh shaved truffle.
author: Paul N.

description: Need a new experience for your palate, Allegro is the place. A continued mixture of fresh healthy ingredients and the awesome flavors of Italian and European style dishes served in multiple courses will both entertain and fulfill the most deepest appetite along with your thirst for good wine.
author: Ernest M.

description:
To truly experience Allegro Romano, you have to be open to it. This is our 2nd time here and it was just as fun and unique as the 1st. 

If you can, sit at the front table by the window. And be prepared to spend a couple hours here, because, in true Italian fashion, you are invited to stay all night if you really want.

Despite the elegant ambiance, the Italian-born owner, Lorenzo, can be seen walking around in his tie-dye shirt amongst his dress-shirt-and-slacks-wearing staff. At any other restaurant, he would be considered crazy, but his eccentricity helps make this place memorable.

It's hard to find parking on the street, so Lorenzo helped my dad find a spot in his own personal driveway. Later on, when my dad ordered a glass of tawny port, Lorenzo came over and took a sip out of my dad's glass, saying that, he too, wanted a glass. He came back with a bottle, opened it, poured himself a glass and then topped off my dad's. If a waiter at Applebee's started drinking out of your soda cup, you'd probably be concerned, but not with Lorenzo. 

As for the food, it's the best Italian I've ever had. We ordered three appetizers: the Roasted Beets Caprese ($12), the San Daniele Prosciutto ($17), and Tortelloni ($22). The latter two were my absolute favorites. I couldn't stop dipping my bread in the arugula pesto sauce that tops the Tortelloni.

For my meal, I got the Petto di Pollo ($22), which was fantastic. Every bite of chicken was superb with the orange-marsala sauce.

My fiancee got the Gnocchi ($22), which featured part 2 of my bread-dipping fiesta. This was probably my favorite dish. The garlic was perfectly proportioned in the old Madeira sauce. 

For dessert, we got organic strawberries with chocolate sauce, along with the Tiramisu--which was terrific. They also gave us complimentary biscotti and watermelon. Oh, and I can't forget the endless dessert Ruby Port on the house!! They literally just keep pouring it if you want.

Upon leaving, the three servers who were assigned to our table, plus Lorenzo, came out to hug us all goodbye.

If you want to go out for a REALLY nice meal without breaking the bank, I suggest heading here. While it's not cheap, you and your date could probably leave here under $80 (more if you drink alcohol). 

The funny thing is, as amazing as the food tastes, it's not even what you remember here. It's the experience as a whole. Allegro Romano is definitely one of my favorite restaurants ever!
author: Ashley F.

description: We were at this restaurant few years ago, and food were superb with shaved truffle (all you want truffle on your dish). We haven't been back coz I couldn't remember the name of restaurant nor the location. After searching & searching on Yelp, I finally found the restaurant. We came tonight for dinner, and my husband and I were disappointed that truffle was not available to serve customers. What a big disappointment
author: Vinh D.

description: Environment was really great- view of Bay Bridge and cute cozy little restaurant. Lots of pictures on the wall of famous people that have visited the restaurant before. Unfortunately the food wasn't that great. I had a pasta bolognese dish, but the sauce was lacking complexity. Tasted exactly like something I would have cooked at home. For the price ($25+) i would have expected something a little bit higher quality.
author: Aldy K.

description: The ambiance is sophisticated. Food is good- sometimes quality varies not consistent. Service could be improved. Pastas are great-and the meatballs. Salads are okay- nothing spectacular.
author: Jessca G.

description: I can't say how great this restaurant is and it's owner. My kids and I drove from Sacramento and my truck broke down in front of his restaurant. I sent my kids in an Uber to the ice cream museum while I sat in truck waiting for a tow truck. He came outside and told me to please come in. He was just so nice and awesome that it almost brought me to tears and he told me not to cry. We don't have many people left in the word that are as amazing as this man. He made sure my kids and I all were save and okay and would be able to make it home safe.
author: Shauntee W.

description: My friends and I came here before a show a couple weeks ago. We made a reservation since we didn't know how busy it would be but wouldn't have needed one. We got there when I opened and got seated right away. Service was great and fast. I had the risotto with truffle which they're known for. Definitely recommend. Was quite filling of course but oh so good. I definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area!
author: Emily F.

description: Excellent steak & Parmesan asparagus! My new favorite in San Francisco! The staff are very attentive and the food was excellent. The owner is there watching every move & making sure the customers are happy. He gave us a complimentary port wine with our desert. My boyfriend's halibut was delicious as well. We are from Reno and will definitely eat here again. It's a very small, quaint restaurant but the atmosphere is ideal. I'm in love with the steak peppercorn sauce & the asparagus appetizer is amazing!
author: Teresa F.

description:
I had dinner here a few nights ago.  Between the three of us, we shared the heirloom tomato salad, asparagus, rigatoni with oxtail, fettucini with Bolognese sauce, and the sole.  I thought everything tasted decent but nothing was very memorable that would set them apart from any other Italian restaurant in the city.  Then we ended with a chocolate gelato which was my favorite part of the meal, it was encased in a chocolate crust with chocolate power on top.  
I did think the service was great with our bread basket being refilled without us asking, water and wine glasses always being refilled, and a free biscotti dessert and port at the end.  
I'd recommend the restaurant for someone who lives or is staying in the area that is looking for something very nearby.
author: Gloria N.

description:
Nice Italian restaurant located on the border of russian and nob hill. We came here on a Saturday and it was not overly crowded. The owner let us pick our table and we chose the table with the most roses, which was nice. The menu was a little bit more expensive than I saw on their website and also had a few fewer options. Also, I wasn't a huge fan of the iPad wine list, seemed a little bit unauthentic for an Italian restaurant. 

The food was very tasty and I liked the brought us a small dessert and glass of dessert wine on the house. Definitely not quite as good as an Italian restaurant in Italy, but one of the better Italian spots in the russian hill neighborhood.
author: Scoot S.

description: Absolute worst restaurant customer experience of my life! I was not seated since I had a reservation with Open Table for 2 people and it ended up being a reservation for only 1. I was told they do not take reservations for parties of 1....so anyone that travels alone can't eat there??? I was baffled that "a manager was not in" on a Saturday night to answer my questions. The host was rude and not accommodating. The restaurant was not even full, I could have easily been sat. Do not eat here, instead go to Seven Hills. Great customer service and food.
author: Meredith K.

description:
What a fabulous and fun experience. We parked at a parking garage outside of North Beach and hiked up the stairs en route to this place. Took photos along the way. When we arrived to the cozy and quaint neighborhood restaurant, Lorenzo and staff treated us to a dining experience born from love. The best food is all about the love that goes into it. No shortage of love here. The bruschetta was delectable, as were the asparagus and thinly sliced angus beef appetizer. 

The basil arugula pesto tortellini was so tasty, and I sampled my son's sea bass and that too was excellent. What I also loved was the Lorenzo's wine pairing recommendation. It was nice for a change to not have to decide- we just let Lorenzo decide for us. The chosen Chianti with my pesto was fantastic, and my wife thoroughly enjoyed the Sangiovese with her Lobster Ravioli.  Wrapped up with cheesecake, tiramisu, biscotti, and some port wine. Great experience and would highly recommend. We will be coming back here sooner than later.
author: Don H.

description: This place was absolutely fantastic. A bit out of my normal price range, but I came here with a group from work to celebrate the holidays. They had some excellent red wine and the appetizers were just fantastic. I ordered the filet mignon and it was just perfect. Nice and tender and paired superbly with the red wine (as a side note I'm not even a big drinker and it was that good). I tried the asparagus soup as well and it was rich and creamy. I immediately wished I had ordered more! The place was fantastic and I would gladly come back here again!
author: James R.

description:
A delightful experience that must be enjoyed. 
Take an Uber or walk there and you will not be disappointed.
author: Matt W.

description: We had table for 7. Excellent food, wine and service. We sat in the back near the kitchen but it wasn't too cramped or loud. Nice little neighborhood family style restaurant. We had the rose petals in our table but no Rose when we left but we didn't miss it either. The food was very tasty and authentic. Glad we ventured here.
author: Tim W.

description: We live in the neighborhood and have been coming for over 10 years but I think last night was our last visit. The food and service have both deteriorated and Lorenzo seemed unhappy, angry, and stressed. Not a pleasant experience...
author: Maureen M.

description:
This is the place to enjoy fine authentic and elegant Italian cuisine.  Reservations are a must for this small and upscale restaurant. We were introduced by friends who are close to the owner, and we go every chance we can.   

The wine choices are exceptional, the pastas are TO DIE FOR! (my fave is the Lobster Ravioli) and the service is impeccable.  My hubby often chooses Allegro Romano for work dinners.  

The only issue is the parking.  Trust me and just take a cab.  Parking is atrocious and not worth sharking the neighborhood because you will end up walking further than intended.  Do not start your evening off on the wrong foot.  Besides, you may end up taking their suggestions for alcohol and need that cab anyway!
author: Melissa T H.

description: Hands down the best Italian food I've eaten in San Francisco, CA and the best risotto I've ever eaten period!  The service, ambience, meal presentation, and 1st class experience was truly top notch.  We are definitely making Allegro Romano the top selection for dinner choices in SF.  Lorenzo and his staff are hilarious, professional, and made us feel right at home.
author: Chris G.

description: Food is amazing! I ordered lamb and the tortellini pasta. The restaurant/room is extremely small though, but it's a romantic dim-lit dining experience!
author: Sandy C.

description: Tried to go there tonight for my last dinner in San Francisco since they had great reviews. We tried to call ahead but got the answering machine. My friend looked up the hours and it said they were open until 9:30. We took an Uber there around 8pm in spite of the rain and was rudely turned away. The kitchen was closed since a big party had been there. No recommendations as to where to go. He didn't even offer us to wait inside for our Uber since it was pouring rain. Very rude and poor customer service!
author: Mandy P.

description:
An orgasmic experience with every bite ...this is truly a gem. Hidden in Russian Hill with a view of the beautifully lit bay bridge. The chef ... Let's talk about the Chef Lorenzo ... Wow... An explosion of personality. Service... Hospitality. Excellence. I could go ad infinitum to extol Chef Lorenzo's magic in the kitchen but his food speaks for itself! Beto's spectacular service and hospitality are bar none. Words cannot describe how I strongly recommend this wonderful establishment. 
Ed De Andrade
author: Ed D.

description:
Love Allegro! I recently took my brother for his birthday and we had a great time. We are from New York, Italian and love Italian food and honestly Allegro Romano has some of the best Italian food in San Francisco.
They always have some great specials and go the extra mile with their service. It always feels cozy and the staff is so friendly. 
I'll be a customer for life.

Tip: Bring your friends visiting from out of town. It's tucked away in a residential neighborhood and is the epitome of San Francisco dining. There is also a great view of the bay bridge just half s block from the front door.
author: Joshua M.

description:
Exceptional in every way. The passion, energy and enthusiasm from Lorenzo and his team come across in many ways. First, this place is located in a gorgeous neighborhood. A true gem of a destination. Second, unpretentious...small yet varied menu focusing on what he does best, great food, authentic and beautifully presented. 

The attention to service is remarkable.  Never feeling rushed, always feeling relaxed and attention to small things like filled water glass, wine topped off and dishes cleared as they are emptied. Lorenzo knows virtually every guest who enters his cozy little restaurant. Even if it's your first visit, you are family!  

Fresh rose petals on the table, a rose for every lady departing are just a few of the special touches. 

Appetizers, meatballs...exceptional. Entrees, piping hot, perfectly portioned and delicious...fresh. No corners cut here. Dessert, we wanted to but we were stuffed.  Even so, we were presented with a tasting portion to satisfy a little sweet tooth. 

Thank you Lorenzo!
author: Mike G.

description: Man, I'm bummed this place seems to have gone down hill. Ordered some mainstays on my last visit and each of them was pretty off.
author: Mark M.

description: It is 6am the following day and I can't begin to tell you how much I loveeeeee the food I can't stop giggling about it!!!! We had the asparagus with a buttery/parmigiana garlic sea salt flavor that I kept mopping what was left with the bread they provided, the meatballs were little jewels of porky deliciousness and that red sauce to die for soooooo classic! We had the lobster ravioli that just stopped me in my tracks it was so good with that creamy pink/orange decadent sauce, and omg the fettuccine was piled high with shavings of truffle (need I say more)ughhhhhhhhhh I had to slow down cause I almost ate the actual plate!!!! I felt like the world could have fallen right outside that scenic window and I would have stayed with this  overwhelming euphoric joy that flooded my mind body and soul as heaven filled my stomach. We could and maybe should have stopped there but nooooo we then had the filet mignon in a peppercorn sauce that melted away in my mouth and lastly the 4 different desserts oh lord that I didn't have room for and yet I managed to shove down my throat! It was soooooo worth the comatose I could not move!!!! Thank you Lorenzo you are amazing!!!! We will be back!!!!!
author: Anthony R.

description:
This used to be my favorite neighborhood spot when I lived in Nob hill. when I came to visit from NYC I decided to stop by here with a couple of my friends for dinner. The service was beyond disappointing and the food quality has gone down as well. It took us 30 minutes to just flag down the busser to ask for some bread. I would say an additional 20 minutes to order our wine (which again we had to flag down the busser for it  since they paid zero attention to us). After an hour we finally put in our food order. One of the dishes were the fettuccini with lobster and I'm not sure why but 10 minutes after putting in our food order the food came out. 10 minutes to cook all that food? The lobster was incredibly chewy and disgusting. The pasta was hard. 

Wouldn't go here again. If you're in your 20s and 30s the waiter won't give you any service. I've noticed that only older people were getting good service which is very unfortunate. Will never come back. 

Oh and he picks and chooses who gets a rose (bachelor episode much?) I guess us three ladies didn't get the rose at the end of the night.
author: Maria G.

description:
Confirmed reservation made through Yelp and reconfirmed with another e-mail reminder on the day of reservation was not honored.
Be wary of this unprofessional establishment!
author: Theodore S.

description:
Endorsed by two five-star reviews from a couple of Elite friends Manabu and Cherylynn, this low-key dining establishment was bookmarked in BOLD letters.  With the closing of the old-time Italian institutions (Little Joe's and recently Caesar's), my search for a new go-to spot ended when I dined here.  Arriving early for a 6 pm reservation, we scored a parking spot a half block away and witnessed the craziness of the parking situation in this neighborhood.  As we were seated, the staff told us about their nightly pre-dinner entertainment on the Nob Hill streets.  We chose a table near the hallway as the tables are packed pretty tightly here.  After reading the specials, our waiter promptly took our orders and gave us recommendations.  Here is what we ate:

Appetizer (shared)
1) Mushroom Trifolati (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=zNY6fHDD8P8oaepeUJAHjA#Q5uNwbshlJ72NaBMrt7zXg) - Sauteed Chanterelle mushrooms over sauteed baby spinach with garlic chips. Great starter and be sure so use your bread to soak the remaining sauce.  $10.50

Pasta (shared)
2) Homemade lobster ravioli in Vodka sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=zNY6fHDD8P8oaepeUJAHjA#SYnatufO_KVHyhIYyFUSew) - The kitchen kindly plated two raviolis with a generous portion of sauce for us.  Used my bread to wipe the sauce clean from my plate.  $18.50
Entree 
3) Filetto ai Porcini and Barolo sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=zNY6fHDD8P8oaepeUJAHjA#sQHwFh9aFVthjS7nKumNOQ) - Cooked perfectly medium rare, my filet mignon was tender and the clean flavor was a nice contrast to the bold flavored apps.  $25.50

Dessert (shared)
4) Waiter's choice (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=zNY6fHDD8P8oaepeUJAHjA#zNY6fHDD8P8oaepeUJAHjA) - Sigh... dark chocolate and ice cream.  What more can I say?!  How about biscottis flanking this to boot.  ** will update name if and when they call me back.

Dover sole (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=zNY6fHDD8P8oaepeUJAHjA#1J7ZhOrUMxU9FHd6imDNMg) - My kind dining companion gave me a half filet slice and, like my steak, the fish, garnished with capers and lemon, had a crisp clean flavor.

The dining room filled as we finished our entrees as, it seems, most restaurants in the City don't fill up until after dark.  It was a good mix of young couples and family/friends groups, many obviously local regulars.  The food was excellent, service efficient, comforting, and playful, and ambiance very relaxed.  And bonus for my gracious friend was a nice surprise.  For me, this place defines "Neighborhood Gem" and no need to ask whether I'll be back.
author: Mike C.

description:
Excellente'!  From beginning to end, great experience in all respects -- diverse menu, great service, nice wine selection, great dessert options  and cappuccino too!   Yahoo!!!

PS -- No bar though.
author: Greg K.

description: Sono molto felice!  Visited tonight with a party of seven.   Exemplary service.   Pasta with lobster and ink was excellent.  Very nice wine list - particularly brunello.  Thank you.
author: Steve R.

description: My husband and I just returned from Rome where we had a truffle tasting menu. We missed Rome so much that we've been "chasing the dragon" since returning from our trip. Allegro Romano is on point with the fresh pasta and truffles! The owner is also so friendly and makes you feel right at home. I highly suggest the foie-gras and black truffle sauce over fettuccine (instead of gnocchi) topped with fresh truffles!
author: Wendy C.

description: Lorenzo and Allegro Romano are the best - quintessential San Francisco Italian food done correctly. You can't really beat the intimate atmosphere, the hilltop views of Coit tower, and the generous food and drink served here. The flavors are rustic, familiar, yet exciting all at the same time. Couldn't ask for better. Would come back anyt
author: Andy A.

description:
Good luck with parking, customer services is extremely rude that makes us feels like that we are unwelcome to dine in their restaurant! First off, I look at the server for service because I saw a sign says valet parking outside due to our friend wasn't able to find a parking and decided to do valet but the owner pull the server away, like WTF?! I literally saw him put his hand on my server and pull her back... Great! Then we have to ask couple more times to get our attention... How cute? Whatever we here to eat... Overall the food is ok nth super amazing... So as we were eating we were using the red pepper flakes the owner just came out over without asking and took our red pepper flakes away and gave to another table... Like umm we are using it? And you don't have more red pepper flakes in your restaurant that you need to grab ours? And without asking? Whatever we are already not having the best dinner experiences already so we ask for to go box, so we put the food in the box to go and the server ask us if we want dessert so we ask for dessert manual as we wait for the dessert our server put our food on the table next to us which no one is on it so we have more room for dessert but the owner is being extremely rude and shoved our food down to the chair... Like WTF?!!! As the end of dinner every table gets a red rose on their table except for ours! This restaurant with out the extremely rude customer service, I would give it a 3 or 4 maybe because the food isn't bad. 

Oh I almost forgot to mention is that, I would prefer restaurant that is more diverse maybe because we all Asian in our hoodie in their restaurant that so happen in their restaurant after Bloomingdales... Giving us the worst experience ever...
author: Scott Z.

description: Decided to celebrate my wife's birthday in San Francisco and chose Allegro Romano for dinner. Awesome choice!! Never disappoints. The service is always exceptional and the lobster ravioli and Bronzino were delicious!! Thx for making this another great evening!
author: gerald s.

description: The place is good overall. Small intimate space. Very friendly staff. Very uncomfortable chairs.
author: Monica R B.

description:
Came a few months back with a party of four for dinner. Located at a nice cozy place in SF, it took a while for us to find parking, but we did make it in time for our reservation. The server was nice and seated us. I loved how there were real rose petals on the tables and the atmosphere around us was very romantic. Later when we were ready to order, I believe the owner came and took our orders. Afraid to mispronounce some of the names of the dishes, we simply pointed to them, but while taking our orders, he would simply frown and raise his voice to repeat them. This didn't seem to be an issue because maybe we were too quiet. However, this did become a problem later on. 
As the dishes came, we were excited about the food and most of us liked what we ordered. We finished in about half an hour and was ready to pay to go back to our hotel. When we asked for the checks, we wanted it split, which is apparently abnormal for a party of friends. The owner rushed out and loudly (rudely) asked what we wanted! After replying we wanted it split, he rushed back in and didn't respond to our request. Ok... was it that difficult to split the check or was that not a thing that parties may ask for? 
When we left, no one say goodbye or anything. I also did note that the tables before us that left, the owner walked them to the door and gave the ladies flowers. I guess its went wrong from not being able to pronounce food dishes in the beginning. 
After this experience, I felt reluctant to give Italian seafood restaurants a try, but hopefully I will have a pleasant experience elsewhere in the future.
author: Winter W.

description: Great food. Good service. Comfortable ambience. But OUTRAGEOUSLY NOISY. We couldn't hear any talking among our group so we ate quickly and left to find dessert elsewhere. We wouldn't return.
author: K. S.

description:
I came here on a Monday night with my BF and his mom. When we arrived, it seemed like they weren't quite ready to open yet. However, the (what seemed like) owner still managed to settle us down and make us feel comfortable. 

We started off with: 
Seared sea scallops over black squid ink risotto - 5/5 stars!!!! All 3 of us agreed that this was the star of the whole dinner. The dish as a whole had so much depth of flavor. I'd definitely come back just for that. 

As for entrees:
Homemade lobster ravioli with tomato vodka pink sauce - 3.5/5 stars

Sea urchin pasta ala carbonara: 3.5/5 stars

Gnocchi with foie gras & black truffles: 3.5/5 stars 

All of our pastas were creamy, relatively on the heavier side. We all thought that the pastas were ok. Not sure how to describe it, but I think it was because we were so blown away by the scallops/risotto appetizer, our standards were probably a little too high after that. 

What makes Allegro Romano 5 stars is their attentiveness and how kind/giving they are! At the end of our meal, we were offered biscottis and dessert wine. After we finished them, we were still lounging around, and we got another plate of biscottis! How sweet! They also offered more dessert wine but we were a-ok. Also, whenever one of us has gone to the bathroom, they always re-folded our napkins. We were just very surprised on how awesome the service was, and the attentiveness. It was crazy!! 

Although the pasta was not as memorable as we had hoped, we all agreed that we would come back for the service alone. It was the experience that we enjoyed more so than the food.
author: Jackie N.

description:
Ti Piaci (I like)...Ti Adoro (I adore)...Ti Amo (I love)?

The feeling of being at a loss for words...it always happens when you're least expecting it; the indescribable feeling that leaves you awestruck and completely speechless. Allegro Romano epitomizes this feeling.     

Born and raised in the city, it never ceases to amaze me the amount of undiscovered gems there are. Words cannot even begin to describe how I feel about Allegro Romano, a neighborhood gem that's tucked away in one of San Francisco's seven hills. 

With 75-80% of its customers from neighboring hotels like the Fairmont, InterContinental, and the Ritz, Allegro Romano is where numerous celebrities including Conan O'Brien, Brad Pitt, Demi Moore (when carbs was still her BFF), and my favorite president Bill Clinton have seek refuge for a quaint dinner away from the paparazzi and the nosy public. It's also frequented by Willie Brown, Gavin Newsom, and Gary Danko whose favorite dishes are the Fettuccine with White Truffle Sauce and the New York Strip Steak.

Coming from a bloodline of a Roman restaurateur, chef/owner Lorenzo Logoreci creates and flawlessly executes rustic Italian dishes full of deep complex flavors and with finesse at affordable prices. Think Acquerello but for the fraction of the cost. http://www.yelp.com/biz/acquerello-san-francisco#hrid:4Yzj_HI1VHRDtu1GR5STmg

F O O D
*AMUSE BOUCHE: Bruschetta
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=JluQXJHqyRUBTYpwr923Aw
Toasted to a delicious crunchiness, the bread was rubbed with garlic before being topped with ripen tomatoes, basil, and olive oil. Fresh. Simple. Satisfying. 

*RIGATONI w/ Foie Gras, Black Truffles & Old Madera Wine (half order - $9) 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=EVUNsI38bJROQj4OomQDug
Suggested by our waiter, I got a half order of this dish which was a perfect precursor to my entree. 

The deliciously creamy foie gras, black truffle, and sweet Mandera wine sauce caressed every single ridge of the al-dente rigatoni making each morsel insanely decadent. Though there was no visible foie gras, the familiar luxurious richness was prominent with the earthiness of the black truffles taking it to the top. 

*FILETTO ai Porcini & Barolo Sauce ($25.50) 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=f8LhvSY7xOPIwbvmCCnTGQ
The filet mignon was seared to a rare as requested with a vibrant red center. Unlike most filets I've had, Allegro Romano's filet was so soft that it cut like butter; it was even softer than some wagyu steaks I've had.

The porcini and Barolo wine sauce was ridiculously good, robust, and packed with an intense earthiness that gave a sinfully savoryness with a tinge of sweetness to the filet. 

*COMPLIMENTARY DESSERT: House-made Almond Biscotti 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5yY41syV-6KwSi-sfmv7CA?select=TpDbovCx3sqhU6wWcTR8_Q
Thoroughly stuffed (I could only eat half my filet), we opted out of dessert but we're still given a small bite to appease our sweet tooth. The biscotto was unlike others I've had; it was like eating a nutty cookie with a rich crumbly texture. 

S E R V I C E
Charming, attentive, and down-to-earth. If you don't like attention or being waited on hand and foot (*raises hand*)...honey, you better learn to like it before coming to Allegro Romano. Our waiters were constantly checking up on us trying to ensure we were enjoying our meal. I felt uneasy at first but soon realized as other diners started coming in that making you feel like you're the "guest of honor" is the Allegro Romano's way of customer service. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Allegro Romano screams ROMANTIC DATE NIGHT! Are you listening fellas? When a woman says she doesn't like the cliché dozen roses and a nice, fancy dinner. LIES. ALL LIES. Women say one thing but it REALLY means another; for example, when a woman says, "No, pizza is fine honey", what she really means is "F*cking, cheap bastard". GET IT?

If you want to WOOOOO that special lady in your life, Allegro Romano is the perfect place to enjoy an intimate, romantic dinner complete with dim lighting, candles, red rose petals scattered atop crisp white linen tables and views of the illuminated bay bridge. 

P A R K I N G
Very difficult street parking. Cab it. 

Ohhhh, don't forget to order a svelte bottle of red wine and watch the magic happen... ( ^_~)

CARPE DIEM.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I found this restaurant for our last night in San Francisco and it did not disappoint! We had called earlier (30 minutes) to make sure that they had a table available because there were five of us and when we got there we were seating right away! It is a very small restaurant with maybe 12 tables but it was decorated very nicely and would be perfect for a date night with red roses (tastefully) decoration the table. 

Our waiter was a young man who was trained very well and was extremely helpful! The owner was around the restaurant greeting guest, saying hello, and at the end of the night offering to call à cab. It was very nice except he was dressed in a t-shirt and yellow skinny jeans... I didn't expect 5 piece suit but something a little nice or age appropriate might have been nice. He was very proud of his restaurant and knew that it was a popular place to dine, if you know what I'm saying. 

Now to the important part; the food. There was a bread basket and butter which was expected. We ordered bruschetta which you order in pairs but our waiter brought us 5 pieces without us asking. The dinner was excellent and rich. The menu was limited but overall a good selection. The desert was odd because there was a delicious sounding cake but it turned out it was only moose, which was still good but misleading. On the desert list there was strawberries. Just strawberries. There was whipped cream and sauces but no ice cream which was disappointing because of the high price. 

I would recommend this restaurant to really anyone but would STRONGLY suggest calling a few minutes before hand and making sure they have a table because they do not have a proper reservation system!
author: Sam M.

description: This is my favorite quaint restaurant in the city. Lorenzo doesn't amazing job with the menu and it feels like you're in Italy. The ambience is classic Italian, white tablecloths and understated decor.  But the food is absolutely incredible. The veal, fish, asparagus, bruschetta and more always keep me coming back!
author: David H.

description: Terrible service!!! The waiter (who claimed to be the owner) was rude, forgot dishes and blamed it on us, and then overcharged us - the prices on the check had no correlation to the menu. Check your bill!
author: Alexey R.

description: Combine a legacy of having a truly authentic family restaurant in Rome with the swanky cool vibe of a quaint but elegant bistro and fresh pastas of the adjacent Italian neighborhood of North Beach in SF...and you get Allegro Romano.  Often a hangout by locals (even though it's close to the touristy North Beach), this quaint bistro on the corner of a residential tree-lined street on the top of the hill is a gem.  Proprietor Lorenzo is a charming and funny host.  The staff is impeccable and always trying to foresee what you may want before you ask for it.  And, like a true Italian restaurant, you aren't rushed but are allowed to enjoy your dinner at leisure...but without having to trade prompt service.  You can order off the menu or do what we sometimes do, which is ask Lorenzo to "Feed Me!" and he will bring out approximately 7-10 of the best items on the menu.  If you are there when Lorenzo cranks up the volume on "That's Amore!" and gets the entire restaurant to sing it, then you are in for a treat.  Speaking of treats...there are rose petals on each table and often ladies will get a beautiful rose bud to take home with them at the end of the evening.  Parking is difficult here as there are no nearby garages and street parking is at a premium (as this is a well established residential neighborhood), but take ground transport or catch a cab...this is well worth trekking to.
author: Mitzi A.

description:
The place is TINY.
Crammed beyond belief.
They "lost" our reservation.
We got seated at the back table next to the kitchen.
The table was basically in our laps, that's how low it was. 
The most uncomfortable eating experience we've ever had.
The bread was terrible. It came with a beef broth...?????!!! What ever happened to olive oil and butter? That was just nasty.
The wine was terrible and over priced. Most of the brands on the list were from Safeway for 5 times the price.
The only good thing about our experience was my dish--the fettuccine with a white truffle sauce. That was amazing!
My bf ordered the filet mignon and it was disappointing for $30. Tiny piece that was not seasoned and also dry that was accompanied by mash potatoes and over cooked greens.
author: T H.

description: Beautiful view, amazing pasta and a great host. The owner is very friendly, lively, and entertaining. The other staff were very friendly and on the ball to fill up wine and water. Also heard them deal with a rude customer in the best way possible. Just want to say that a lot of us can be real jerks so you have to respect anyone who know how to deal with it. Had the best pasta of my life. Gnocchi with a foie gras and black truffle sauce....how can anything else compare. Wine was great with a low price tag. Also can't beat how its tucked away in the neighborhood which gives it a great romantic feel. Highly recommend.
author: Daniel P.

description: I love the food here. Quality is excellent and it has a great intimate romantic atmosphere. I would have given it a 5* had the service been better. Unfortunately we had a male waiter with a very bad attitude. We ordered a 2nd bottle of wine and I asked him not to open the bottle or pour until everyone finished the first bottle but he did and the way he poured it was like he was pouring water into a water glass according to my guests at the table as I was in a conversation with my friend and wasn't paying attn. When I gently reminded him he said "what do you want me to do about it now? I've already poured it!" Although they comped us the bottle it's not about getting a free bottle of wine as I would have been more than happy to pay for it but it's about the experience.
author: Sheila S.

description:
I have been using Yelp for a number of years now, without posting any reviews. Today I break the dry spell for Allegro Romano:

I'd first seen this spot while driving by one day and immediately added it to one of my must try spots as I'm always looking for authentic Italian in San Francisco. On a whim last night, I visited their website around 2PM looking for a reservation that evening and was booked for a table for two at 8PM. Note: I attempted to call three times around 7 to try and bump the reservation up half an hour, but my calls were not answered. Stick to online reservations for this spot. 

When we arrived we were immediately seated at a nice table. While the dining room is small, it was relatively full for a Wednesday night, a good sign to me. The waiters immediately brought out bread and water and menus. We started with the Bruschetta and Prosciutto & Fresh Burrata, served with honey and oil. The Bruschetta was fresh and had a strong basil flavor, and the toast it was served on was the perfect texture for cutting (not rock hard!). The second starter was nice as well, even I enjoyed the combination of the four ingredients and I typically do not like Burrata cheese. 

Our primi course included the Risotto with shaved Truffles and the Rigatoni al' Arbëria. The Risotto was creamy, cheesy, and sitting in a savory broth that I have never experienced before with Risotto. The cherry on top was the heaping dose of freshly shaved truffle on top, which they perform at the table. If you are a truffle lover this is the dish for you. Next the Rigatoni came out, which they kindly plated on two clean, warmed plates for my Dad and I. This dish included braised oxtail in a cream sauce. The menu advertised it with porchini mushrooms but all we found were carrots. The oxtail was cooked perfectly though and I think this dish was perfect for those looking for a hearty dish.

Lastly, we ordered the Scaloppini with Porcini Mushrooms. By now, I was pretty full, so I'd like to give this one another try when I'm not so completely stuffed. Again, the waiter brought out two plates for us, already split in the kitchen. The Scaloppini was tender and came with a rich sauce that was perfect when mixed with the mashed potatoes and greens that also came with the dish. 

Overall the food was very nice, but the service is what will make me recommend this to others and return myself. During the course of our meal I believe we had four different waiters and servers doting on us. Lorenzo, the host was also in on the action engaging in our questions about the ingredients and their origin throughout Italy. They pay great attention to requests in delivery of the courses, making sure to leave time between each course so all your plates don't end up on the table at once. Even after declining desert, they still delivered a plate of fresh watermelon and biscotti to the table for us to enjoy on the house. 

Come to Allegro Romano for good food, great service, and an authentic Italian experience.
author: Alex R.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in SF so far!! The food is amazing!!!

The treatment of the owner and waiters is very special. Their wine is quality! And the place is super cozy in a very romantic place in nob hill with a bay view and financial district. 

Recommended for a romantic dinner!
author: Adriana P.

description: I ordered their - SEARED SEA SCALLOPS  INK SQUID RISOTTO BALSAMIC & BELL PEPPER BISQUE.16 - as an appetizer shared w/ a couple other people and I ordered their Fettuccine with so much shaved Truffles that it covered your entire dish. It was phenomenal! And, the owner gave each of us a glass of free port for dessert and a stem or red rose to go. I will go back again.
author: Rebs W.

description:
It saddens me to give this restaurant a poor rating but unfortunately it never lived up to the expectations (specially after reading all the positive reviews )

I have to agree with the small group of other patrons who felt the lacking service and sub par food didn't justify the hype.

My husband and I dined here on a Saturday night at the peak of dinner time. The reservation process itself was a nightmare- we called the restaurant where  the owner answered and after perfunctory responses actually hung up on us once saying something like "we have a party that evening so no reservations". We just thought to check on open-table in any case and lo-and-behold our requested time and date was very much available. We booked anyway thinking maybe there as some miscommunication over the phone.

We noticed that there were indeed 3 tables booked with larger groups of 4-6 people for celebration dinners of different occasions, but there were also 3 other tables including ours where couples were seated just regularly there to enjoy a meal.

My main gripes with this establishment:

- We received little or no attention throughout the evening. In fact our server was more interested in serving the other "big ticket" tables. We had to remind our server to give us some bread after 20 mins of waiting for anything to eat. This is basic courtesy.

- We were seated in the back corner and it was as if we were NOT THERE. Seriously. The owner actually went and checked with all other people on all the tables except ours (especially those with larger business)! 
- the FOOD was just ok. Anyone who's dined at high quality Italian restaurants should not be simply floored with truffles being served on a pasta. I can only venture a guess that the quality of the truffles used in this case was quite poor, as it didn't really add any aroma to the dish. Honestly, I was really disappointed as I am crazy about truffles and was looking forward to this dish all week. We drove all the way from east Bay for this - so you can imagine how we felt. And at $40 a plate I certainly expected more. My husbands sea urchin pasta was in great sauce but the pasta itself was way to al dente (as was mine).

It was a memorable meal for the wrong reasons. The reluctant service along with the average food and unworthy prices made this a flop in my books.
author: Yelper 2.

description: Delicious food. Nice waiters. Lovely atmosphere, but, not sure who the guy in charge was, but he was a little snotty and not dressed very nice for such a nice restaurant.
author: Kathie S.

description: Small but charming neighborhood spot. This restaurant reminded me of the local Tavernas in Greece or Neighborhood restaurants in Italy. The food was great but, more importantly the staff was welcoming and gracious. I felt like I was at the home of friends, not just out at a restaurant.
author: Carol T.

description:
Went to this restaurant last night with my son, his friend and my husband.  It is small , but nice and I like the flower petals on the tables!!
Our waitress and other servers were very attentive and our food was quite good. We felt well taken care of.
The tiramisu was absolutely perfect!!
The owner was at every other table talking to the diners, but ours. We only spoke on the way out and told him how wonderful it was!
A nice neighborhood gem!
author: Kris G.

description:
I live literally a 3-minute walk from Allegro Romano, so the first time I went there, I was excited and pleased at our experience.  The restaurant was intimate and the food was good.  Not great, but good.  I thought I had found a solid restaurant, located conveniently near us, that my wife and I could visit on a weekly basis.

Unfortunately, the following 3 times I tried to go to the restaurant, the experience was miserable.  I found that the common theme for each negative experience was due to the fact that Lorenzo, the owner that so many of these reviews talk about, was greeting us at the door.  I'm not sure how to describe the experience.... but heck, let's give it a shot.  The owner was pretentious, pompous, arrogant, rude, unfriendly, unwelcoming, disrespectful, irresponsible, inflexible, and is 100% responsible for turning off what could have been a weekly, regular customer.

The other reviews here state it pretty clearly, but don't even attempt to make a reservation over the phone.  The owner does not honor reservations and you will have a very high probability of being screwed, or being deflected to their sister restaurant.  Couple that with the rudeness coming from the top-down, it's an establishment where I will never spend another penny.
author: D. L.

description:
I love the ambiance and intimacy of this restaurant.  The food isn't necessarily spectacular 5*, but my husband and I were quickly becoming fans based on the former.  Unfortunately, based on our most recent experience, we won't be spending another penny here.

We had reservations for New Years.  I called to change the number of people in our party.  There seemed to be a bit of a language barrier (or too much noise in the background) as the person could not understand if I was trying to increase or decrease the number of people in my party  After repeating it a few times, he finally ended up saying:  "i have a lot of people here." and proceeded to HANG UP ON ME!  

For anyone interested in maintaining their clientele, the correct response should have been to have taken my number and called me the next day.

I still think it's worth a visit if you've never been and can appreciate a small eclectic atmosphere, but it's doubtful my husband and I will ever return.
author: Cheryl S.

description:
This place is fantastic!  My husband and I live 3 blocks away, and we finally got around to going here last week.  We didn't even tell them that we were celebrating our anniversary until after dessert, so our service was above and beyond for no reason at all.  I have no idea what took us so long to go here, but we'll definitely be back.  

I enjoyed everything about this place.  I wasn't disappointed in anything.  The food, the wine and port, the service, the atmosphere, and the gorgeous views of the East Bay from the street all made for a great experience.

I ordered the lobster ravioli, and it was delicious.  There were some good chunks of lobster in it. My husband ordered the filet and loved it.  It was cooked exactly as he ordered it, and it was very tender and juicy.  The potatoes on the side were very tasty, too.  Another thing I really liked was that they brought out a decanter for the bottle of wine we ordered.  There's not many restaurants that do that, and it's a nice touch.

Something that we really liked, which some other people might not, is that they really took their time and let us enjoy every course of our meal.  Nothing was rushed.  I'm not exaggerating when I say that we were there for almost 2 hours.  The waitstaff was very attentive the entire time, so we never felt that we were being neglected.  I've read some of the other reviews that said they were being ignored, but we never felt that way.  They were letting us take our time and enjoy everything.  Now granted, we went on a Wednesday night and it was not crowded, so the slower pace might not happen every time.  We'll just have to go back and see. 

Thank you, Lorenzo, for a truly great experience, and for the beautiful red rose I was given on the way out.  We'll be back soon!

PS  This place is very small.  Make a reservation on Open Table.  And parking is scarce.  Plus the wine and port are great.  Take a cab.
author: Shawna P.

description: The food, service, ambiance and location were all terrific! From our table in the front window, we could see the bay bridge lights and the top of the Transamerica building. Our server was fun, knowledgeable and attentive. We shared wine, appetizers, entrées and desserts and everything was delicious! Lorenzo, the chef/owner, checked on us repeatedly and even called taxis for us. We were the last table to depart the restaurant and he chatted with us on the street corner until the taxis arrived. Perfect night!
author: Eric H.

description:
Came here for a nice and fancy date, and I was not disappointed :) and that was with BIG expectations too! The parking was monstrous. We drove like 20 minutes around the place trying to find parking, having no luck whatsoever. We had to drive like 5 miles down in a parking garage where it was like 15 all night.  Then we had to walk 10-15 minutes to the restaurant, with huge hills because there was no taxi around! By the time we got to the restaurant, we were tired and said "this better be worth it." 

But the atmosphere of the restaurant was romantic.  Servers in uniform and were all very hospitable, dimly lit place, candle light dinners with rose pedals on each table.  It was a small, but charming.  We were also impressed by all the celebrities that have been to Allegro before, such as Bob Saget, Brat Pitt, Ashton Kutcher and Demi Moore, and much more. Thought, "hey, this place has to be good. But they probably didn't hike up the hill like we did." 

We were served with bread as appetizers that's always nice to have as a free appetizer.  The server recommended a "Lobster Base Soup", which I got and actually tasted really good. [http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/C6XlbtMFHdnf36YljFTAvA/l.jpg] It was from this soup that I liked the place and forgot about the adventure we had to go through to get here.  My date got the "Asparagus alla Parmigiana" which was also delicious. [http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/XvIuKoKJOaHn9oJ8tj1Vjw/l.jpg]

We both got pastas that pretty much WOW'ed us.  I got the pasta with "white truffle sauce" since that's what was most talked about on yelp [http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yWDJeL2g-9Gk9GjcTb4Y2A/l.jpg], and my date got the "Rigatoni alla Amatriciana" which was amazinggg. [http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fs5TIVpn5nKd9AbQr3gVQg/l.jpg] It was tasty, zesty, and just had a really good kick to it that I haven't had in any other type of pasta before. 

For a place to be in the corner of no where, having high expectations due to an adventure having to get there, and still thinking it deserves 5 stars, I think that pretty much says this is a perfect place to dine if you're looking for a nice and romantic meal in the city of San Francisco.
author: Raquel Y.

description: Normally. I would give this restaurant a high score, but after many delicious dinners there, we hit an OFF night. The restaurant has lots of charm and warmth. A true neighborhood gem. They always make you feel welcomed and happy to be there  But tonight the food missed the mark. Asparagus starter was tasty, but over cooked and looked as though it had been sitting under a warming lamp for a while. I had the filet for an entire. It was rather tasteless and may have been frozen for too long. The 3 other guests also were disappointed with their meals. Service was very good, as usual. Nice wine list.Hopefully, just a place feeling exhausted from the busy holiday season. I'm sure I will try it again.
author: Joanne E.

description:
Wonderful food and beautiful service.

I'd have to first mention the impeccable service.  it is the best next to Ruth Chris. Water refills with every sip, clean plates given after every part of the meal, the napkin was laid on my lap and they even attempted to help me put on my jacket as i left.  

Bruschetta was super flavorful and you could taste the pureness of the olive oil.

Lobster ravioli with legit lobster meat super good. the creamy tomato sauce flavored just right, and it leaves you craving this dish for days

White truffle Basil pesto tortellini was super fragrant and delicious.  Even after it got cold, the truffle oil really stood out and was delicious still.  I took the liberty to soak it up with the provided bread.

Tiramisu was second only to Stella bakery in north beach and that's saying something.  strong expresso flavor with fluffy marscapone cheese, and NOT SOGGY

Key lime pie had so many textures and flavors. Fresh tart lime juice. Creamy condensed milk tasing base.  crunchy raw textured sugar in the mix.  buttery crust that held together with the pie.

this was almost a perfect meal. if only the free bread was steaming hot/fresh/fluffy.

overall i think this is a great place to have a mildly fancy dinner
author: Tina A.

description:
I had every intention of cooking tonight, but then after I got home from a particularly tough pilates class, I said, "screw it!" & decided to eat at a nearby restaurant.  

Instead of going to any of our usual spots or anything on Polk St., we decided to find something in our neighborhood.  I remembered seeing a few Italian spots in the neighborhood, so I got out my trusty Yelp app, searched & found Allegro Romano.  I chose it, because it's only a few blocks away from my apartment :D

We arrived at the restaurant without reservations (apparently, most people make reservations, so note to self: make reservations next time), but they managed to squeeze us in within a few minutes.  A couple of the servers came by to check on us while we were waiting.

Allegro Romano is super cozy with dim lighting. So perfect for those on a first date, or any date.

I would actually give the food 4 stars, but 6 stars for the service, so they get a nice round 5 stars from me.

We started the meal off with bruschetta, which was delicious, but the garlic was a bit strong.  I prefer the bruschetta at Il Borgo, where the bread is toastier, with bigger chunks of tomato & basil.  We also ordered the beef carpaccio, which is "Kobe Style Black Angus thinly sliced w/shaved aged Parmesan cheese, arugula & truffle oil."  I thought it was good, but I think the cheese was too strong for my taste. Maybe too aged?

For the entrees, both my BF & I decided to get pasta dishes, since we're both truffle fiends. I got the rigatoni with black truffles & madera wine, topped with caviar. My BF ordered the fettuccine with white truffle sauce.  Both were delicious, but I liked my dish more.  I found the fettuccine cooked a little too al dente, too chewy for my liking.  The rigatoni was perfect, however.  I am looking forward to my leftovers.

And since my bf & I couldn't decide on a dessert to share, we both ordered our own: I got the tiramisu & he got the espresso mousse. Both desserts were light and fluffy, a perfect way to end the meal.  After dessert, they brought us a couple of glasses of port wine (& they topped off the wine a second time)

The staff here is fantastic! They made our experience so enjoyable.  They were funny & warm.  And they gave us so much extra wine (esp. my BF).  We left them almost a 28% tip. Well deserved.  

We will definitely be back.  I want to try the tasting menu next time!
author: Grace C.

description:
Incredible experience!! The food, the ambiance, everything! Wether you are on a romantic date or large party (my party was 15) Lorenzo treats you and yours first class. The food is authentic and for a moment you feel like you are in another world. It is a must for locals or out of towners (me) as it truly was unique. A special place indeed. 

Try it. You will not be disappointed.
author: Raquel G.
