description:
5 stars for the service, 3 stars for the food.

I badly wanted to love this place after reading all the reviews. The cozy restaurant is adorable. The staff friendly and entertaining. They do give all the girls roses. We also got port and a glass of champagne on the house (though it tasted like cooks sparkling wine).

Now the unfortunate part:

We ordered :
The bruschetta - which cost $3.50 and our waiter gave us a look and said "don't worry about ordering those, I will take care of it. *wink*" We never got bruschetta.

Salmon and caviar crepes - good but very small. 4 bites. Rest is salad.

Mushroom trifolati - mushrooms on a bed of spinach. Our favorite of the night.

Fettuccine with white truffle sauce and shaved white truffles - the amount of truffles they put on my plate was well worth the $18 but the fettuccine was practically cooked al dente. It was so undercooked it was crunchy at the ends. 

Lobster ravioli - sauce was ok. Ravioli was ok. My bf ordered this and I only ate one because it wasn't good enough to have more. He actually said my undercooked fettuccine was better (which I made him eat the second half because I didn't want to eat more).

Tartuffo tres scalini -  "world famous" dessert. Really just a ball of chocolate ice cream rolled in chocolate chunks, plus two strawberries and two pieces of biscotti. 

Bread was plain. Dipping sauce was good (like a gravy with peppers) but would be better if both were warm.

We left and headed to la folie lounge where the food is great and service is sad and crappy. Total opposite to balance out the night.

I still stand by my statement that the best Italian restaurant in sf is acquerello.
author: Alice Z.

description: Allegro Romano remains one of our "go to" restaurants when visiting San Francisco.  It's small, intimate, and has a nice location at the top of Russian Hill in a residential neighborhood.  I like restaurants like this that blend into a city feel vice being located in a sterile mall.  Reservations are a must as the restaurant is very small.  We had a party of four and arrived at opening.  This was advantageous as we had the pick of a few tables.  We chose a table near the kitchen and away from the main door - much quieter.  This was our second visit to Allegro Romano and the service was again over the top with both professionalism and niceness.  Yes, this  restaurant is somewhat pricey with a bill of $300 before tip for our party of four.  But hey, sometimes it's worth shelling out extra money for a treat that leaves four people smiling at a great meal and our special time together.
author: L. D.

description:
One word totally sums up Saturday night dinner here...AMAZING!!  The food, the prices, the service all are phenomenal!  You best make a reservation!  Chances are you probably will have to leave a message to get a reservation, and get a call back for confirmation and availability.  I did, but was able to get a 6:00 reservation this past Saturday with only two days notice at this intimate Russian Hill gem.  

Bf & I shared: the bruschetta ($3), a  half order of the rigatoni with foie gras & black truffles ($9), a full order of the rigatoni all'amatricana, also known as Willie Brown's favorite ($18), & the tiramisu.  

Service here is wonderful, and I love how the owner walks around and helps out.  He also answered a few of our questions as well.  I have been wanting to come here for quite some time due to its appetizing menu and rave reviews.  It was hard to decide what to order but everything was so delicious!  The foie gras rigatoni was not heavy at all but you could really taste the foie gras and truffles.  This was our favorite.  The rigatoni all'amatricana was very tasty as well with the right amount of cheese mixed with the light tomato sauce and finely diced pancetta.  We can see why this pasta dish is Willie Brown's favorite dish!  We also appreciated that they split our full order onto two plates for us to share.  We were getting kind of full, but we decided to try their special tarfuto.  However after placing the order, our waiter came over a few minutes later and told us that unfortunately their freezer was broken, so no tarfuto.  We decided on the tiramisu since tiramisu is probably my favorite dessert.  Upon waiting for the tiramisu they poured us some delicious complimentary port!  And the tiramisu with their biscotti was a delicious end to a fabulous night.  Bless their hearts, they gave us the tiramisu on the house as well.  Bf was stunned at the check!  A first class Italian meal at a super affordable price in expensive Russian Hill?  We can't wait to come back to try more dishes!
author: Cat C.

description: Very good food in a very intimate setting. We had the carpaccio, risotto w fresh black truffles, pasta with sea urchin, steak, and tiramisu. The food was very well prepared, and esthetically presented. The service was friendly and attentive. A very well timed multi course meal.
author: Heidi W.

description:
Lorenzo is probably the greatest restaurant host I've ever met.  His skill in the kitchen, and his instinct for what works well is spot on.  Put those two things together, and he's got a killer thing going at Allergro Romano.  He has this kind of no-nonsense yet warm and friendly approach to things that leaves you feeling like you are in good hands for dinner.  
His casual approach to phenomenal food is so well done that it is almost easy to miss.  It's like being at home, where your grandmother whips up this phenomenal meal without any fuss; it just kind of happens.  This is what Lorenzo does - he's darting about, talking to customers, pouring wine, directing the staff, running back to the kitchen, and suddenly you have a curated meal in front of you.  Sure you can order exactly what you want, but if you let him select a few things, you are infinitely better off.  
So, details.
The wine list is impressive.
The caprese salad is awesome - he uses some kind of basil pesto that is intense, but just the right amount.
Bruschetta -  can't get enough of it.
And the entrees are top notch - Every one I've had is superb.
Dessert  - if you are a dessert person, this place is worth it just for dessert.  Let Lorenzo surprise you.  You won't be sorry.
If you are walking, it is worth the near vertical climb to the top of Russian Hill.  Get up there and enjoy!
author: Dan O.

description:
I had Allegro Romano on my list for a while as I read all the wonderful reviews on food and service. 

And finally when I got to visit the place, it became the place for the ABSOLUTE WORST experience that made me DOUBT THE USEFULNESS OF YELP.  

Unlike how it was mentioned in the reviews, the ambience was NOTHING SPECIAL, if not to cheezy with Rose petals and glitters on the table. With limited seating and with just TOO MANY show-off photos of celebrities visiting the place, the place was just INELEGANT. (So you want to impress your company? Look for other countless amazing Italian places around the city, as you'll almost never run out of options for that.) 

But this lack of extraordinariness is bearable. It was when they COMPLETELY IGNORED and DISRESPECTED my time that I was done with.  I called the restaurant to set up a time to go pick up before they opened. They told me to come at 10am. So from Berkeley, I ran out of my place at 8am to be there on time. I started waiting 9:50am and then until 11:00am, NOT EVEN A FLY showed up. Did I get any alert at all? 

Was that even a legitimate excuse? ABSOLUTELY NOT. With ZERO ownership of the customer experience/relationship of the business, they did NOT seem to know how to respect regular customers who were NOT CELEBRITIES.
author: Jen K.

description:
Allegro Romano was absolutely amazing.  The service was outstanding and the food was outstanding.  We had 2 waiters serving on us, and they were both incredible -- very attentive.  I was celebrating a birthday with 2 friends, and they brought out an appetizer, 2 desserts and port for all of us on the house!  They certainly helped make my birthday awesome! 

The food was also unbelievably delicious.  We started with their burrata cheese appetizer that I am still dreaming about.  We also had their tortellini with pesto sauce and fettuccine with white truffle oil sauce.  Both of these dishes were out of this world! Will certainly be going back soon!
author: Sara R.

description: Oh my goodness. What a wonderful Italian experience! The owner was the friendly most hospital host, waiter, valet director ever! It looked understaffed at first but I was wrong! The staff there is more the capable of catering to their guests in this unsuspecting setting. He sang, we sang, we all sang! We had a nice intimate experience which may have been unique given it was our anniversary and the owner's birthday AND July 4th. We had a surprise at the end of our night with a secluded 360 view of San Francisco and fireworks under Bay Bridge. The food? The wine? Magnificent! 5 stars hands down
author: C C.

description:
Been meaning to try this neighborhood spot for at least 10 years, finally made it for a very early dinner Friday night. Walked up the Broadway steps and in to the empty restaurant w/out a reservation. Lorenzo, the owner sat at the window table on his cellphone, a waiter stood around-- I asked if they could seat me for an early dinner out of the way and headed toward a table near the kitchen door---Lorenzo jumped up and showed me to the table, waiter hung around too. 

Table settings were lovely and adorned with fresh rose petals and glitter. Went with one of the specials and something not done at home, the Osso Bucco and a glass of the Chianti. Lorenzo went back to his window table and cellphone. The waiter and busboy paced the restaurant floor---it was early, just after 5p, pacing was distracting. I occasionally chatted with the waiter. Lorenzo left for awhile, (maybe he went down the hill to his new place ala  Romana). The waiter brought a small plate with one appetizer bite of bruschetta to enjoy with my wine.

The Osso Bucco flavors were delicious and presentation lovely. Ate as much as could, take the rest home. An older couple came in, they sat them next to me. Lorenzo was back and took care in seating them. Several women came in a bit later, he took care of them and appeared to give instructions to the waiter. 

In the meantime, I ordered a Cappucino and drank my wine, which was delicious. The waiter brought me a special biscotti with a dollop of ricotta and fresh strawberry to accompany my coffee--- which arrived tepid rather than hot. Again, the presentation was beautiful, the plate dusted with a cinnamon or nutmeg powder and sparkling. Simple and elegant.

At one point, Lorenzo must have asked what I had as heard the waiter tell him Osso Bucco, I could not hear Lorenzo's response. Before finishing, the waiter sat the bill on the table corner, I finished my biscotti, the busboy asked about the Cappucino and offered to make another,I declined, paid my bill. On the way out, I motioned to the waiter who followed me towards the door and quietly told him about the Cappucino, maybe the machine was not hot enough. 

I can imagine eating here in the evening with candles lit and tables sparkling. I'd love to try another dish or two. Yet, would I bring a friend or two or three rather than dine alone again?Am not sure at all. Never once did Lorenzo smile or appear genuinely welcoming of any patrons to his lovely restaurant on the top of a very lovely hill on a beautiful sunny San Francisco day.
author: Nancy D.

description:
We have wanted to try this place for a long time. Climbed up one time before and it was closed but this time we made it. We had early reservations so there were only a few couples dining at the time which made it seem less crowded. They seated us right by the kitchen door.
Service was great. Food was good but with all the hype prior to us going it was kind of a let down. Wine was very good and after we finished, the waiter asked if we would like more wine, we declined so he poured us some anyway on the house.
Then more wine, then more wine...time to go. Thank goodness we were walking.
All in all a nice evening.
author: Jeff C.

description: Delicious and beautiful place. The lobster ravioli and lamb shank were delicious. Nice date atmosphere.
author: Holly B.

description:
New FAVORITE restaurant in SF! 
(And we have lived here for 20+ years)

You know how we are all looking for that hidden restaurant that has predictably amazing food, a local, inviting feel where you look around and everyone is having a great time and enjoying themselves and their food and you feel like you're a part of a community? Well, Allegro Romano is that place! 

Huge kudos to Lorenzo for making each guest feel so appreciated and for all the special welcoming touches that make you feel like you are a guest in his home. Again, the food is spectacular.  I promise you will leave feeling happy to have eaten at this local gem of a restaurant.

We will be back soon and often! 

Liz and Mike
author: Liz P.

description:
We had been to this restaurant on Valentine's Day a few years ago.  My husband had remembered that experience as a great evening, and their unique tradition of offering red roses to ladies on their way out was a nice touch. So he thought he might call and check for a reservation a few days ago.  He left a message and later called again, and a female confirmed our reservation.  

So when we got there from Napa last night, the owner came out to rudely tell us that we had no reservation, and questioned my husband on whom he had talked to and when and let us know there was nothing he could do for us as it was Valentine's Day and they were booked.  The reason for the crappy review is that he was just plain rude and completely unhelpful.  

My husband is not a fan of conflict so we walked out after being basically kicked out.  As we were walking to the parking lot where we had left our car, we spotted another cute dim-lit Italian restaurant only a couple of blocks down that had a surprisingly similar name: Ala Romana.  They let us know that they were booked but had an opening as there had just been a cancellation.  The menu looked great, and the ambiance was nice, so we decided to stay.

Long story short, we realized my husband had probably confused the name and called Ala Romana to confirm a reservation instead of Allegro Romano.  After we were seated and enjoying our meal, low and behold, the owner of Allegro Romano walks in and starts acting like he owns the place.  Our server let us now that he in fact does!  So the success at Allegro Romano translated into the opening of a satellite venue a few minutes away.  

Why wouldn't you offer to check if they had a table that could accommodate us?  Or at least let us know about it?  Because you don't care and you'd rather not deal with an issue even if it night be an opportunity.  Instead, you prefer to assume we lied about having a reservation, or at least acted that way.  I will not be back to Allegro Romano because your attitude is not reflective of a welcoming host, your space is incredibly tight, there is no privacy, nothing spectacular about the cuisine as far as I remember.   The roses are a beautiful touch, but my husband brings home the perfect bouquet without needing your services.  

DON'T YOU KNOW THE CUSTOMER IS ALWAYS RIGHT? Long term, your attitude will implode your business.  Good luck with that.
author: Mlle V.

description:
Came here with my parents.  Parking in this area on a Saturday night took 35 minutes, was nigh-impossible and we ended up parking illegally (which distressed my Singaporean parents to no end).

Mum had the risotto, I got Mahi-mahi, Dad got steak.  Everything was very good, I think.  They even gave us free bruschetta when we complained we were starving.  Owner was friendly and the wall is papered with his pics with celebrities, haha.

It's a homey family-type place, very loud, not exactly romantic or classy but very friendly.  The waiters were hilarious, cheeky and bantered with my mum, which made her night.  It was fun and I would definitely come back if I were in the area, but I live in SoMa.
author: Letitia L.

description:
As any person can probably tell by a quick skim of the latest reviews, this place SERIOUSLY needs to get an adequate reservation system going. I've actually asked the owner himself about this--he just laughs it off. Why?? Because this restaurant is probably the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. Period. 

If you really want to try this place--show up a bit early--like 5:30 or 6. If you have 2-4 people, there will probably be tables open because the place is off of the beaten path. 

Every single time that my girlfriend and I have been here, it's been one of those experiences that we can't stop talking about on the way home. The ambiance couldn't be any more romantic: classic Italian opera music plays in the background, rose petals line each table, and the owner speaks to his staff in Italian. The service that goes along with it? The best we've ever experienced. Every waiter is so knowledgeable about each dish they could write a book about it. Your drinking water never gets past the halfway point. As soon as your wine is a few sips from being gone, you're asked if you want another. To end the dinner, you're given a complimentary glass of port and biscotti cookies, and, if you're with a girl, they give her a red rose on the way out. 

The quality of the food just tops it all off. We've ordered the prosciutto with melon as an appetizer, the squid ink risotto, the lobster ravioli, the pasta carbonara, and other dishes. No matter what, you really can't go wrong with any dish that you order here. Just try what you think looks good and go with it!

Oh, and one more thing: It's not that expensive either! A dinner for 2 people comes to about $90-$100. 

If you can get past the nonexistent reservation system, this is truly one of the best dining experiences in SF.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Nice ambience and neighborhood feeling.   The is location is cozy, staff is friendly and for the most part the food is decent.  I would try this place for a nice quiet lunch or dinner if in the neighborhood but I would not venture all the way here if you're in the mood for italian food.

The food is really not that special.  It's the same old Italian dishes that have been served for years throughout Italian restaurants all over the world, but by modern standards it needs an update.

Anyhow, this place is decent and ok but not worth the trip if you like good Italian food.
author: Giorgio P.

description:
This is a cute little place that's perfect for a date. It's romantic and provides an intimate atmosphere for a lovely dining experience. My boyfriend and I came for dinner and didn't have a reservation, but they were able to accommodate us anyways.

The service here is superb. Our waters were never lower than halfway and they constantly replaced our bread and dipping sauce. Even though we barely used our sauce each time, I think it must have gotten replaced ~7 times throughout the meal! Talk about taking care of their customers.

Mushroom Trifolati: This was a bit disappointing for us. It wasn't anything special and seemed like a dish we could cook ourselves at home. 

Beef Carpaccio alla Romana: One of the best beef carpaccios I have had. It had shaved Parmesan cheese on it with fresh arugula and truffle oil. The thinly sliced Kobe Style Black Angus Beef was really tender and exploded with flavor. I HIGHLY recommend this appetizer!

Black Truffle Risotto: This was a special that night. Since I never had risotto before, I decided to order it and I am SO GLAD that I did. It was creamy and aromatic. When it was brought to our table, Lorenzo (owner) came over and shaved us a generous helping of fresh truffle. Mmm. They should really put this on their regular menu.

Chillean Sea Bass: This was another special that night, and it came with mashed potatoes and spinach (the same spinach that was in the mushroom trifolati). The fish was cooked perfectly and was served with a lemon caper sauce. The sea bass literally melted in your mouth and retained its moisture well.

Complimentary Housemade Biscotti: This came with strawberries and cream. Nothing to complain about since they were free.

At the end of the meal, they gave me a red rose. Nice touch Allegro Romano. Very nice touch.
author: Ava S.

description: Everything about this place is perfect. Best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. The owner Lorenzo is so attentive and the food is absolutely amazing. It's more than just going out for a nice dinner with great food, it's an experience. On top of it all, the prices are modest. Best kept secret in SF by far.
author: Jason R.

description: Italian food at it's best
author: Sean F.

description: One word. Lorenzo. The owner who will make you smile and gives your table an unforgettable evening. Food is very good. Lamb dish is superb. The branzino excellent. The gelato a recipe from grandma. A lovely nob hill gem tucked away that only the locals know about. Worth booking a table right now!!
author: G. D.

description: Starters and main dish were very good. The food and service is amazing. Thank you Adrienne!  We will come back
author: Nil A.

description:
Took my Dad here with the hope of enjoying a comfortable, relaxed, and delicious meal and evening.  Enjoy we did! Service was great - warm, engaged and friendly staff.  I loved the location - in the heart of a purely residential area so you get away from a lot of the outside noise/foot traffic. 

The risotto/scallop dish was yummy. My dad and bf both enjoyed their fish dishes, too. The bruschetta was also very fresh and tasty, it was a great way to start the meal. Would happily make a return visit!
author: Brianna M.

description:
Cute little place, good food, decent service. 

The food deserved a 4-5 star review... but since thats not all thats considered I would have gone with 3.5 if possible. Its a cute little place, nothing fabulous, but no real complaints. The staff was friendly enough. I have to say I asked for a recommendation and they said everything was good instead of recommending one or two options (this is a pet peeve of mine... you have tried it, just tell me your favorite). 

Now onto the food- I had scallops and risotto (I dont ever order risotto... not sure why I decided too but scallops sounded tasty). GET THE SCALLOPS AND RISOTTO... delicious!! At our table we also had some other good food, not as good as mine (in my opinion). The food is good, so I would go back, I just wasn't overwhelmed.
author: Jess K.

description:
Did I go to a different restaurant than the other 300+ people who gave this place rave reviews? I was so looking forward to this place having had it bookmarked for months but the mediocre food and shoddy service was a complete letdown.

On Food:
- Caesar Salad was advertised with Fresh Dungeness Crab. The crab was fishy and had that slightly tinny taste that said it was pre-packaged.
- White Truffle Tortellini in white truffle pesto sauce - pesto masked a lot of the truffle flavor. Dish felt heavy and didn't taste special. (Took some home to reheat and the grease soaked through the take out container and made a mess in the microwave)
- Linguini with sun-dried tomatoes and garlic and halibut. This was clearly the tastiest dish of the night. There was still a little over-reliance on oil, and the fish didn't taste super fresh
- Biscotti with watermelon - Good biscotti with a nice licorice flavor

On Service - we had already been to a whiskey tasting before arriving at dinner and so were in no mood to drink. After declining to order alcohol, it seemed that service went downhill from there:
- We had to ask the server for the specials of the day. Half of what he said made no sense and after overhearing specials being presented to another table, realized he left a couple things off
- Sat around for a while waiting for someone to take our order, made eye contact with a couple of the waiters, tried to wave them down and instead saw them tell each other to come take our order.
- Ask for an opinion on the three different pastas that listed truffles as ingredients and basically got a response along the lines of "well, there's the pasta with truffle cream sauce or you can get the tortellini that is filled pasta with a paste in a sauce". Thank you sir, I think I can read. 
- No idea why, but had a hard time flagging someone down for check and to-go box in this tiny 32 seat restaurant. Had to remind them that we had a to-go box after we paid the bill and were ready to go.
- After reading so many reviews about women getting roses at the end of dinner and seeing every other table around us get them, was extremely disappointed to see that we were neglected.
author: Judy C.

description:
TERRIBLE. Do NOT go here. The service is AWFUL, I've never had a waiter (who is also the owner) be so rude to me and the other people at my table. 

Where do I even begin..

We ordered 4 appetizers to start, they only brought 3. We reminded them about the prosciutto, our fourth appetizer, and the waiter claimed we did not order it. What?! The three of us heard it ordered. He should have said, "Oh I'll get it for you right away.."
We ordered a bottle of wine and he ID'ed all three of us. We are all in our 30's, but fine. The weird part was then he took all three of our drivers licenses away and into the back.. to do I don't know what. He never gave a reason either..
While we were enjoying our bottle of wine, at 9:58p, he came by and told us "I am not allowed to serve alcohol past 10p, you have to finish it before then." What?? First, I've never heard of this before. Second, why did you not tell us earlier?
When we were done with our drinks, he took them outside and poured - ie, littered - the drinks outside (not just water!). 
The atmosphere is as weird as can be. They must have dimmed the lights 5 different times just over the course of our dinner. They also played music that was skipping, like a scratched CD would do.
The bill he gave us was well over the price of the food we ordered. **CHECK YOUR BILL** because I bet he will overcharge others too. When we were actually doing the math, he then accused us of NOT wanting to pay - huh? Of course we want to pay, we just don't want to pay for things we did not order. He then accused us of not remembering what we ordered - what?? And then we asked him what the price of the desserts were and he told us $8, and then as we were going through the bill, he said they were each $9.
We ordered the mousse for dessert, and instead we were served cake. We clarified, and they said, "This is the mousse." (I've now seen the same thing has happened to other Yelpers.)
I think the waiter/owner is on DRUGS. 
When we were leaving the restaurant, we didn't hear what the waiter/owner said to us on the way out, but we *think* he said "Enjoy McDonald's." What!?!
DO NOT GO HERE. TRUST ME. The owner is terrible and an awful waiter. A place like this does not deserve to continue to stay in business.


***UPDATE*** The owner wrote a comment to my review saying I wrote a review for the wrong restaurant. This is absolutely the right restaurant. If you read through others' reviews, you'll see he uses the same story. Not only is he a terrible owner, he is a liar as well. Avoid this restaurant!
author: Farrah L.

description:
This place is a small boutique restaurant located high up on Russian Hill. The people working at this restaurant are very attentive and want to make sure your meal is up to standard. The food was amazing and very tasty. My daughter loved her pasta with white truffle. My filet was very good as well. 
The Tiramisu was average. The wine list is good and deep and has a lot of wines from Napa.
author: Zee R.

description:
This is my new go to Italian place.  Definitely tucked away in Russian Hill away from the hustle and bustle of SF.

We started with the prosciutto and melon (excellent) and mozzarella caprese.  Both were very tasty.  We also had the scallop risotto and rigatoni with truffle & caviar sauce.  Both entrees were delicious and reminded us of the pasta we had in Italy.  We really haven't been able to find a place in the US that serves pasta as good as we had in Italy.  We've found the place!  We had the chocolate gelato for dessert which was good but the table of ten next to us each ordered the chocolate mousse. The guy next to me wolfed it down in three bites in less than a minute.  I'll def get that next time.   Will definitely come back soon.

If you go here on a weekend, I recommend reservations.  A couple people were turned away because the restaurant was already full/packed at 5:50pm.
author: Shelly W.

description: Amazing all around! Took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner and had a great experience. We ordered the bruschetta, caprese salad, rigatoni alla amatriciana, gnocchi, and  a couple different wines. The service was incredible and they even gave me a rose at the end of the meal and offered to call us a cab. I can't wait to come back!
author: Kianna H.

description:
After the long slog up the Jones Street hill, I was so happy that this place ended up being AWESOME. I was casting about for a well-reviewed spot that had reservations available for 7:30 pm on a Thursday and these folks fit the bill. We did not regret the choice for a second. No missteps, only happiness.

There were 3 of us for dinner and we had a bottle of wine, asparagus with parmesan, mozzarella caprese style, and complimentary bruschetta to start. Then for entrees we had tortalinni with white truffle and a basil pesto, osso bucco, and saltimboca. Every dish was really delicious. We ordered some strawberries to finish.

And they end the meal with a bit of complimentary port and gave me two roses to boot.

The place is small and cozy, and the service was so friendly, welcoming, and responsive.  The price was pretty darn reasonable, and I'll definitely be back.
author: Joetta G.

description:
Awesome food, great atmosphere and incredible service!
The Bruschetta is very good way to start your dinner: very tasty.
We then had pasta: the Rigatoni carbonara with the black truffle and the white truffle Fettuccine. Exquisite !! So much flavour. 
The wine was also very good. 
The atmosphere is really cosy and intimate.
And to finish: we had two waiters taking care of us and they were both very helpful, polite and always smiling. They even offered us a small dessert, liqueurs and to me a gorgeous rose.
A really nice experience, I'll go back for sure.
author: Laura G.

description:
I don't write reviews , I believe that the food business is a tough one and we as customers always have high expectations BUT this restaurant is so special that I had to write this one

I understand that some owners are proud of their food and that's why they are arrogant and pompous about themselves and their establishment BUT I don't know what we missed tonight ! Why is the owner so proud ? The food is just below average .... I thought I was at a American restaurant having pasta .... Overcooked and saucy !!!

Here is how it went ....

The owner took his sweet time to take our order. He wanted to make sure we were ready and knew exactly what we wanted before we bothered him ! What a dick ! My friend asked if the special fish for the day was good ..... The answer "personal choice" .... WTF ... We thought this is one of those restaurants where the owner is proud and snobbish but the food is good ( YELP ..... This is your fault ..... How can this restaurant have 4 stars .... Is this guy paying you ??? )

With no help from the owner our party of 6 our appetizers were bruschetta , asparagus , and the buratta. The buratta was very good. Bruschetta and asparagus was just average

the saving grace was our bottle of cab .... Atlanta peak 

Each of us had a pasta dish and the only pasta dish that was decent was the gnocchi 
The fish was overlooked 

For desert we ordered the tiramisu and chocolate mousse. The tiramisu was very good but the chocolate mousse was a chocolate cake !!! It tasted like a chocolate cake from Safeway ...... I even checked with the owner .... Is this a mousse ? And he was like YES

How can any chef be proud of the food here ? 


Do not waste your money here ..... I hope the owners pride brings him down
author: Techno R.

description:
Great experience, wonderful food, and good service! 

To put it lightly I felt completely spoiled here! We were celebrating a special occasion, and the staff bent over backwards to ensure my night was extra special. 

The food was great but the service was better! Very attentive and appreciative not just to our table but to all the tables around us. 

I will be coming here again and would highly reccomend this place!
author: Elsa S.

description:
The food was 4.0 stars.
The decor was 1 star.
The interior of the restaurant is extremely dated. I felt like I was on the set of a 1980's romantic comedy. The confetti and rose petals on every table was a bit off-putting. Good food, good service bad interior.
author: Mike S.

description:
Simply Superb!
I've been a regular customer for the past 8 years and have recommended this restaurant to many friends and family over the years.
My company wanted to do something special for my colleagues and left me to do the planning.  I decided to call Lorenzo to plan a private event, something unforgettable.  It was a culinary journey with 5-courses to delight.  
We sang, we danced, we ate and had the most memorable time, I recommend having an intimate party for anyone who wants to build team spirit and have a fantastic time.
Lorenzo and crew are dynamite and this place is a gem!!!!
Live, Love, Laugh and Relax are words to live by!
author: Charlie P.

description: Love.....just love this place.....this is our "secret' go to in the hood....the freakin foie truffle gnocchi.....are you kidding me....just about as good as it gets.....just everything is wonderful....the owner is a lovely man running around all the time...very gracious and just so attentive ....and of course you gotta love the rose petals and roses.....enjoy...
author: Eddie J.

description: Went tonight, highly recommended, I found it to be over rated. The food was ok, but not the wow factor I would prefer.
author: Thomas P.

description: Good things come in small packages! The restaurant is very small and you should try and make a reservation but it is so worth it! Lorenzo made us feel like we were family. The food was amazing and the vibe was fun!!
author: Michelle B.

description:
I've been to Allegro Romano a few times and it never disappoints. I would say this is some of the best Italian food I've ever had and by far one of the best restaurants in the city. The experience is wonderful as well. It is a relatively small restaurant (10-15 tables), so the dining experience is very intimate. The waitstaff is superb, the owner is magnificent, and everyone there is just happy to be doing what they're doing. 

As far as the food goes, the white truffle fettuccine is exquisite. It's quite heavy, so be prepared for that. The bruschetta is refreshing and flavorful, really something else. The veal was a bit less impressive. Nothing was wrong with it, but I've had better elsewhere and there are definitely better options on the menu. Be sure to save room for dessert. The tiramisu is the perfect consistency and a great way to wrap up a great meal.
author: Victoria W.

description:
My wife ordered the Black Truffle Fetticini Special which was brilliant! Stole a few bites from her plate...was still salivating the next morning.

I ordered the Rigatoni Amerigina (Willie Brown's Favorite). It was very good...but after a few bites it had me thinking I should have tried the Foie Gras Rigatoni. Next time for sure.

Our friend had the Rissotto. It was also very good...worth ordering if you have a hankering for a rice dish.

The Bruschetta was okay...nothing special. I've made better at home. The Caviar Crepe was delicious...but the serving was tiny. Didn't think it was worth it...better to explore other appetizers.

The service was top-notch. Definitely going back sooner than later.
author: Zoran L.

description:
the bf took me to this little gem for our 7yr anniversary last month. and i'm just not getting down to writing a review. shame on me. 

let's see... where do i start? this restaurant is on a quiet corner in russian hill and parking sucks. big surprise. you can even see the sweeping views of the bay bridge from outisde the restaurant though! 

we walked in and were seated at our table almost immediately. i fell in love with how romantic and intimate the setting was inside (i believe the max capacity is less than 40, so make sure you get your reservations in). a dab of colorful confetti and red rose pedals were scattered around the tea light candle in the middle of our table.   

let me just say, the service was impeccable! the owner, lorenzo, was really nice! i believe he's the only one who's even allowed to answer the phone. i finally remember why he looked so familiar! i remember catering to him while i worked at ed hardy a couple years ago! small world. 

now, onto the food reviews...
for appetizers, we started off with beef carpaccio alla romana. omg... this is what heaven tastes like! this does not compare with any other carpaccio i've had in the past! the meat is so fresh and tender! the argula with the aged parmesan cheese and truffle oil blended so nice with the beef! ok, i'm starting to salivate..

onto the pasta course... bf ordered rigatoni all'amatriciana. i'm not a huge fan of pancetta (or any type of bacon for that matter) so i thought this pasta dish was alright (but apparently, it's willie brown's fave). however, i ordered the homemade lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce. ohh my gahhh... this is the best italian dish i've ever had! you can't get this better anywhere else, so this is a MUST try if you like ravioli and lobster. the vodka sauce was perfection and i wanted a second serving of this dish!

second course, we decided to split petto di pollo al allegro romano. it was cute how they actually split this dish onto 2 separate plates for us. the sauteed chicken breast was so tender and juicy! the picatta sauce tasted like a light gravy and it went well with the sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes. mMm... i'm still salivating. 

lastly... the dessert course. of course we had to order the tiramisu! wow... is all i have to say. this is a MUST have.. whether you're super stuffed or not. it's an orgasm in the mouth! 

after our waiter boxed up our leftovers, i was given a rose. apparently, they give all the females a rose right before you leave. it's a really thoughtful gesture. i definately can't wait to return! hands down, this is the BEST italian food i've ever had!
author: Ann T.

description:
Allegro Romano is a small 32-seat Roman restaurant in the Russian Hill neighborhood of San Francisco. Strategically tucked away from the tourists and the endless amount of mainstay restaurants in San Francisco, I made reservations for Allegro Romano knowing that this would be more of an intimate, romantic setting without all the "hustle and bustle" you would encounter while dining at a 75/100-seat restaurant.

Our server was very courteous and attentive and had a warming demeanor that made you feel as if you were right at home. I started the night off with the Soup of the day. Unfortunately I can not remember exactly what it was other than the fact that it was delicious. As for my entree I was in debate over the Fettuccine with white Truffle sauce (flown in from Piedmont Italy) or the Homemade Lobster Ravioli in Vodka Pink Sauce. I opted for The Lobster Ravioli. Fresh Lobster stuffed in Ravioli with Vodka Pink Sauce was superb. While enjoying dinner and wine with great company I had a chance to converse with the owner who was quite pleasant and inviting. As we were getting ready to leave the restaurant after a fantastic dinner the owner (Lorenzo) gives a long stem red rose to my girlfriend as a parting thank you gift which I thought was very cool. 

In conclusion, if you would like to dine at a classy, romantic local neighborhood Italian restaurant in San Francisco then dine at Allegro Romano. The food is fantastic owner and staff treat you like royalty and you never know when you could be sitting across from one of the many celebrities that frequent Allegro Romano.  You will not be disappointed. I will be back.


p.s.- Keep your head on the swivel for the only parking is going to be on the street which could be an all day event in SF.
author: Alastair G.

description: Amazing food and memorable experience! We opted for family style and we were not disappointed. Everything was absolutely delicious and the service impeccable! Our host was delightful - we were made to feel like family! In celebration of their 15 year anniversary the restaurant patrons did a rendition of "That's Amore!" We had a blast!!!
author: Kris M.

description: Had one of the worst meal in San Francisco ,terrible food, and terrible rude service .
author: James I.

description:
This is the place to go if you're looking for delicious Italian food, top-notch service and an intimate atmosphere. This place is on the smaller end, so make sure you have reservations or come early. We circled the area for parking for at least 30 minutes and ended up finding a parking garage a few blocks away. It was all worth it :)

We ordered the bruschetta alla romana for our appetizer, which was delicious. For entrees we had the homemade lobster ravioli with vodka pink sauce and fettuccine with wild boar bolognese and porcini mushrooms, which were perfect! The sauce from these dishes we so good we soaked them up with the complimentary bread. For dessert we had a yummy cheesecake. We enjoyed every single bite of our meal and can't wait to come back!
author: Sammie B.

description: Best service in SF by far! And best Italian food in the city. Wish I had found this place sooner. Lorenzo runs a terrific place and the staff are all top notch and ensure a wonderful evening.
author: Jeff G.

description: Wow.  Just got a voicemail from the manager or owner dropping F-bombs about me "not showing up" for a reservation tonight.  However....let's back up.  I ate here years ago and thought it was good but customer service questionable but whatever, it's the city.  A few days ago, I thought  "hey, it's been a while since we were there - let's check it out with some friends that just moved here." I made a reservation on OpenTable for a table tonight (Friday, Nov 25).  Yesterday, I cancelled the reservation (and even have the confirmation) because my husband is sick.  Bummer.  Moments ago I received a voicemail from the restaurant that it is extremely rude to not show up for a reservation and well " F*** you" said the Italian-accented speaker.  What?!?!?!?  Who DOES that?  I am in shock that someone would have the gall (and stupidity?!) to really leave that in a voice message on my phone.  Will NEVER be going here and I look forward to proactively telling every single person I know to avoid it.
author: Coco L.

description:
you have to be a foodie to be a yelp elite, right? With that said, italian is  everybody's favorite, right? WELL - this restaurant was unlike ANY italian restuarant i've ever been to.
We waited 10 minutes to be seated because we didn't make a reservation. While we were waiting, other couplers arrived. be aware, there might be a stench of cheese when you 1st walk in. We talked about it with people that just walked out and they couldn't smell it. We all decided it was the black truffle that we must be smelling. Once we sat down, we could no longer smell it so don't let this influence your deision on going. And everyone that walked out said how delicious their meal was. Once seated the experience started. There was red roses sprinkled on every table. Our waiters were very cultured, very italian. Our waiter told us the specials right away. They presented the wine perfectly, let us taste it and served. BTW we didn't know it is BYOB. They service wine as well. Our appetizers arrived within 5 minutes. Bruschetta and spring salads were delicious.Our entrees were lobster ravioli for me and every bite was perfection. The sauce wasn't too much, it was absolutely perfect. My boyfriend got the Linguini al Aglio, with halibut. Sauce was perfect, a little spicey. Every bite of the fish was to die for. 

Lastly we got the tiramisu. Now we have been in search of the perfect tiramisu all over NYC, and my boyfriend thinks we found it here. every bite was AGAIN, perfect. I would give this place more stars if I could. 

I would highly recommend making a reservation when visiting. Atmosphere is very intimate, very romantic. I even saw some waiters giving the women at their tables a red rose before they left.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Yesterday my boyfriend and I had the opportunity to dine at Allegro. We started out with some appetizers. The caprese was delicious and then we had a truffle risotto. The truffles are flown in directly from Italy. The risotto was perfection. I ordered the rigatoni and my boyfriend ordered the tortellini. The presentation was phenomenal and cooked perfect. We then shared the chocolate gelato for dessert. The wine and the food were both unbelievable. 

In addition to the food being superb, the service was impeccable. We sat next to the ambassador of Korea and received the same service as him. Not once did we fill up our own glass, our plates were cleaned as soon as we finished and all the servers were extremely knowledgable about the food. The owner even was there and sliced the truffles for our risotto. Not only that, the service didn't stop once the bill was paid, they called a cab for us and continued to fill our drinks for us until we left. 

Allegro is a must visit. You won't be disappointed. Make sure you make a reservation as they seat just under 40 people in the restaurant and they turned away a few people during our dinner because they were booked. 

We will definitely return to Allegro our next visit.
author: Nicole M.

description: We came early and it was nice and quiet to start with. We were greeted by Ian, very friendly server. Service were good, but for some reason, owner did not say any word even though he was there the whole time? We ordered 6 things for t he 2 of us. Kobe beef carpacio, was a lot of shaved parmesan cheese, which we were not into it. Caviar rigattoni with old madera sauce was great (a bit too al dante for us). Willy Brown red bacon rigattoni was my husband favorite. The lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce was excellent! Scallop Risotto w/Black Calamari Ink was another great dish too, although I wished the scallops were bigger. We also had the veal, was good and really loved the mashed potato. We ended up with cappucino chocolate cake with biscotti and fresh whipped cream. They gave us a stem of roses for our 10th anniversary. Parking was a nightmare!
author: Wendy T.

description: Best Italian food in San Francisco.    The truffle pastas and ravioli are amazing.  Lorenzo is a great host and he always makes his guests feel welcome.    We've been coming to this restaurant for many years and the service and the food has always been superb.
author: Seth T.

description:
Came here last night with my family for my mom's birthday and had an AWESOME time. The food is fantastic, the truffle fettuccine is legendary, the atmosphere is warm, comfortable and very charming. However, for this review I'm going to focus on that one thing that really stood out to me: the service.  

Lorenzo & his staff have something that I'm sad to admit many restaurants in the city lack which is love for what they do. They connect with customers and work to provide a memorable, and welcoming experience to everyone who enters their doors.

My 95 year old grandpa was with us last night and I have never seen him brighten up at any restaurant like he did last night. For his 96th birthday in 2 weeks, he wants to come back (keep in mind, he's an old Chinese man who I thought only liked Chinese food)!
author: Allyson N.

description: Always a great experience! There are very few restaurants that consistently go above and beyond to ensure the best possible customer experience. Allegro Romano seems to do this with ease. I've been coming to this restaurant for the past 3 years and each time Lorenzo and his staff exceed my expectations. Excellent food, superb service and perfect atmosphere.
author: Cory B.

description: We had a reservation on Christmas Eve and got to the restaurant early.  We were seated immediately and served immediately.  That was great.  Service however for the first two courses was very quick and rushed. For the second course the tempo slowed-thank you!  The food was wonderful.  We received a complimentary dessert and port-nice touch.  Biggest negative:  $40 corkage fee.  We will never come back to this place because of that.  Hello, unless you have an incredible over the top wine menu (which I can't fine online) then sorry never coming back!
author: Dee Dee B.

description: I live right by here and see it packed on a nightly basis.  Packed with diners trying to have a nice evening with scrumptious Italian cuisine.  Then they walk in, rudely greeted by the owner, order and attempt to eat what's on their plate.  Those same people are the ones I hear outside my window stating how disappointing it was, as they sulk back to their car they spent a decent chunk of time fighting for.  I was also one of these hopefuls who took two bites and decided to leave and go to Capo's (yum).  It really is horrible food in addition to the owner's attitude.  With ample excellent dining choices right around the corner, don't waste your money or time here!
author: Sara S.

description: By far, one of my favorite places in San Francisco- a must every time I make it into the city. Make reservations well in advance for a Friday or Saturday evening dinner. The place is a very small restaurant- maybe seating 60. The service is amazing and they give the women fresh cut, red roses during dinner. They've also sang "That's Amore" and the whole restaurant joins in the few times I've been- a really sweet and fun addition to the evening. The food- where can I even start? I'm never disappointed with their authentic Italian food. The staff will also call a cab for you when you're about ready to leave. They make you feel like family. Molto bene.
author: Caitlin W.

description:
Amazing personalized service
Super friendly owner
Great ambiance
White Roses for the Ladies
Black Truffle Risotto was to die for(possibly one of the best truffle dishes I've ever had in my life)
Hard to get reservations but def the wait.

Can't wait to go back
author: Sandy M.

description:
The manager is Italian. Many servers are Italian too. Maybe that explains the down-to-earth attitude, authenticity and passion. They are not staff but more like your neighbors who have been to this restaurant more often than you. 

This place is truly a hidden treasure in a quiet neighborhood. I have complex feeling writing this review as I kind of want to keep this place a secret :) Romantic interior. Pasta made in house daily of course, the best quality ingredients, simple recipes, but superb flabor. From wine to appetizers (bruchetta + artichoke hearts), from entrees (rigatoni + scallopini) to desserts (tiramisu + anis flavored biscoti), nothing is short of delight. Before we left, waiter Eric gave my friend and I each a long stem red rose :) 

Everything, I mean EVERYTHING about this place reminds me of Italy. Every time I visit SF, I will stop by.
author: Yuan F.

description:
What a beautiful evening!  It was our 50th anniversary.  The staff and Lorenzo treated us like billionaires.  The FOOD....it was the best Italian I have had.  We are foodies so we get food.  Wild Boar sauce............! It was certainly the food but the service was so over the top.  I felt really special.  What more can we ask for.  Special, really special. The port "on the house" ... way more than we had expected.  Don't you all expect this.  It was our 50th anniversary :) 
Thank you Lorenzo.  We hope to come back for our next anniversary. We are from Seattle. Thank you guys.  Good Job!!  Oh, the Borolo that was a special wine.
author: Don S.

description: I've never written a bad review on Yelp before. I made reservations 2 weeks ago for 4 people. I find out day of that 2 people can't come and, because I'm a good citizen, I call ahead of time to let the restaurant know. They tell me not to come at all now because they only have a table of 4 and refuse to seat 2 people at a table of 4. I've never ever had that happen at a restaurant. The food may be phenomenal but they clearly don't give a shit about their customers.
author: Marnie F.

description:
Love this place! Very romantic and cozy. 

I had a bad craving for some lobster ravioli, and this place hit the spot! Lobster Ravioli was to die for. It was cooked to perfection. The lobsters were fresh and juicy. 
Excellent service! I went in around V-day 2012, They had rose petals on the tables. The servers gave out roses to the ladies. They sure knew how to make customers feel specials. I will be back...hungry for MORE!!!

PS - Parking is tough in this neighborhood. Try asking the host. They can tell you their secret parking spots :)
author: Teddie B.

description:
I called more than two weeks in advance to make a reservation for six to celebrate three birthdays. I got a call back within a couple hours to reserve a table. I suppose things would have been fine if I didn't need to change the reservation time.  I called back the same night and left a message to see if I could move the reservation to an earlier time and to leave a credit card number to lock in the date and time. No call back. So I call back again and leave a similar message at least three times.  A week later, I do get a call back. Fine. I mean, this was the restaurant choice of one of the birthday honorees; otherwise, I probably wouldn't bother. I am informed that we can move the reservation to an earlier time but that the restaurant is very busy this time of year.  I probably wouldn't be annoyed by this comment if I weren't calling almost every other day and leaving messages. 

Food was generally good. Bruschetta was okay but the beef carpaccio and fresh prosciutto and melon were delightful. The rigatoni pasta with caviar and black truffles was good, but no fresh shaved truffles. The lobster ravioli was nice, would have been nice if there were more lobster in the dish. The white truffle tortellini has a light subtle truffle flavor.  Petto Di Pollo is nothing special. The spinach was good and the piccata sauce was not over powering. One of the birthday celebrants also tried the monk fish pasta special which was also good. The scaloppini with porcini mushrooms was very nice.

We shared desserts. The tiramisu was light and flavorful and the chocolate mousse cake was delicious.  The complimentary biscotti was a nice touch.  We ordered gelato as well but did not get it.  We didn't bother asking for it since the chocolate mousse cake was so good. They also wanted to clear the table and get us out. Definitely not the leisurely Italian meal you might expect. 

I should mention that my views on the food may be a bit skewed because of a recent trip to Italy. I did like the aromatic rigatoni with black truffles and the chocolate mousse cake. 

We did feel rushed because we were told there would be a private party later that night. We just sat down!  Food came out quickly.  The restaurant is cute and small, but customer service could definitely needs to be improved.  No roses or even a happy birthday for our celebrants.
author: Emily Y.

description:
Amazing service.  Our wine glasses/water glasses were never empty.  The owner and waiter checked on us frequently and had actual conversations with us.  Lots of treats provided on the house, too!   

The truffle fettuccine was delicious!  The Willie brown favorite was smokey and tangy and a healthy portion.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Dina H.

description:
Where to begin. What should have been a fun festive  evening between 3 good friends turned into a dining fiasco. We have been celebrating one of many (over 20) birthdays together throughout the years. We were shocked at the horrible treatment we received from the staff at Allegro. Particularly our first waiter. 
Our reservations were made over a month in advance for 6pm on a Saturday night to celebrate my birthday. Due to conditions beyond our control we were running a little behind so called the restaurant at 5:45 to say we would be 15 minutes late. They couldn't find our reservations. After much debate on the phone (none of it apologetic) they agreed to seat us but we would need to be out by 7:15. Once we got there (at 6:15), our reservations had been found "in the back"??? They said we could stay until 7:25. Really a whole hour and 10 minutes for a fine dining experience? The soon to be rude waiter said that is all they ever allow and kept blaming us for being late.  The rude waiter walked away but continued to glare at us giving us the stink eye and shaking his head. A very nice young man was trying to accommodate us. We should have left but we were tired, hungry and it was Saturday night in the city. So we decided to stay thinking it has to get better, but it doesn't. Before we picked up the menu 3 different employees came to our table asking the same questions but no one seemed to know what was going on. The waiter that was already rude to us came to our table to take our wine order. When I offered to order our appetizers at the same time he started in on us saying "One thing at a time!" and then hustled off. We were aghast. When he returned with our wine his attitude was even worse. After a couple rude remarks my friend signaled to him to calm down and he huffed off shoving his order note pad into the hands of the nice young man that seated us. Ok so now things are going to be OK we thought. No such luck. The food was soso. The salad was fine, (spring mix with oil and vinegar), I've had better, the carpaccio soso, lobster ravioli, OK, veal saltimbocca horrible. After trying to cut it with a fork, then the knife we were given, then a steak knife we requested, we still could barely cut or eat this dish. We asked for a doggy back (actually for the dog this time) but it never arrived. They did comp our wine and bring us 3 broken biscotti's with a candle for my birthday. Fifteen minutes before the entire staff serenaded someone else with a celebratory round of "Happy Birthday". Ours was a more "eat this broken cookie and don't let the door hit you on your way out! 

In addition we were seated by the kitchen door. Normally we wouldn't care but not a person walked by that didn't bump my friend's chair. This happened constantly through out the evening. It was so bad it actually became comical. Fortunately we all have a good sense of humor and are able to enjoy each other's company no matter how badly you treat us. On our way out another couple arrived and they couldn't find their reservations either. When we looked at the reviews on Yelp we saw that this is a common occurrence. We won't be back to Allegro's but we will have many future adventures together in the city.
author: Lianne W.

description:
Small and cozy corner restaurant in nice neighborhood.  Staff was very welcoming and attentive.   We ordered the Bruschetta alla Romana, spinich salad, bean soup  and Asparagus alla Parmigiana for appetizers.  All were satisfying.  Entrees included Fettuccine with White Truffle Sauce, White Truffle Tortellini in Basil Pesto Sauce, Linguini and Halibut, and Veal Osso Buco with a couple bottles of chianti.  
The food was very good.  Not crazy over top but very good.  I gave this 5 stars for overall experience.

The servers were very attentive, the owner stopped by and we finished the meal with several rounds of port.  

Overall, very good dining experience.  Very relaxing and really nice ambiance.
author: Ken K.

description: Service was only fine.  Food was very disappointing especially considering the ridiculous prices.  $32 for salmon that would taste better at Street a few blocks away.  Ravioli that was extremely dry and lacked the cheese it was promised to include.  Very very upset that so much money was spent and the meal was so mediocre.  I brought a guest from out of town and I was embarrassed by my choice.  I have been here once before and it was only slightly better.  I won't come back despite living a block away. So sad.
author: N F.

description: This was going to be my second time here. I'd loved the food the first time. When arriving at 9:10 they tell me the kitchen is already closed (the restaurant closes at 10). To top that they send me to a brother restaurant, when I arrive (and you know that walking in San Francisco is not great) it was closed for a private event. Not happy with the service!
author: Sebastian G.

description:
About 65% of the time I agree with the ratings on yelp* and the other 35% I don't.  In this case, every positive review for this establishment is right on the money.  

A friend raved about this place so I finally decided to go last night.  I called for a reservation at about 2pm and was surprised someone answered the phone since this place is only open for dinner.  I was able to make a reservation for two at 7:30p.  Good thing too; this place is pretty small, with 40 seats.  I got there 5 minutes early and the host was regrettably turning a couple away....the restaurant was booked for the evening.

The food was wonderful.  The service, impeccable.  I mean, you can really tell that the owner (who was also the host) cares about his business.  He wants people to enjoy themselves.  He wants people to come back.  He understands what customer service means and ensures that his staff delivers.

My friend and I ordered between the two of us: risotto with white truffle, baked fish, lobster ravioli, crab caesar, and tiramisu.

Everything was cooked to perfection.  The fish, which was baked whole then de-boned, melted in our mouths.  And the tiramisu was light as a feather.  The lobster ravioli sauce looked heavy, but no.  It was just enough flavor to keep you wanting more without you feeling too full.

And the service....the owner constantly made rounds around the dining room clearing plates, delivering food, and making sure everyone was happy.  He is a very charming and genuinely friendly man with an equally friendly wait staff.  Water and wine glasses constantly being refilled, you don't need to ask for much here.  You just get it.

We weren't rushed at all and pretty much closed the place down.  

I highly recommend this place....just go and you can thank me and the rest of us 4 and 5 star yelpers later!!
author: Yelper F.

description: Welcoming, customer oriented and extremely delicious. Great place for a date, or dinner out with friends. I can't wait to go back!
author: Natalia M.

description:
This is a really cool restaurant: only 32 seats in this cozy venue located in the middle of a neighborhood. It feels like you are in a small romantic trattoria in Venezia. The servers are outstanding and treat you like you are part of the family. There are two great corner booth tables in the very back of the restaurant that each accommodate a party of two. Request one of those and you can sit close by your companion and enjoy an excellent view of all of the happenings in the restaurant. 

The food at Allegro Romano is solid and reasonably priced. While we certainly have enjoyed better Italian food, you won't be disappointed if you don't set your expectations too high. We enjoyed the bruschetta, the salmon and caviar crepes, and the special risotto with freshly shaved white truffles. But this spot is more about enjoying the vibe of this authentic neighborhood eatery experience. The food only makes it better. Enjoy!
author: Mark B.

description: Pasta was decent but not the best.  The decor with the glitter was really cheesy though.  Not a good date spot.  Ambiance is really weird
author: Nelson W.

description: Felt like we were back in Italy.  We just celebrated our engagement at Allegro Romano last night.  My fiancee and I were treated like VIPs.  Thank you for the warm welcoming Lorenzo and team!  We had the bolognese and Willie May's... perfectly cooked pasta too.  Loved the rose petals on the table.  I highly recommend to anyone seeking an intimate Italian dinner. 5 stars!
author: Kelly M.

description: This place is amazing - menu doesn't change often but it never gets old. Also very inexpensive all things considered.
author: Justin Y.

description:
2nd time here.  First time blew me away and although I didn't write a review that time, it would have most definitely been 5 stars.  It's been a couple years, and the place is *almost* as good.

Black truffle risotto appetizer - fantastic!  Perfectly cooked rice and sooo much truffle.  Seriously considered putting in a full order to go so I could have it the next day!

Melon and prosciutto appetizer - disappointing...skip

Fettuccini with white truffle oil - good but not as good as last time.  I remember having the truffle shaved onto my dish last time, so it must've been in season last time.  Just truffle oil this time was still good, but not great

Truffle ravioli - really really good.  

Tiramisu - fantastic

Will be back for more truffle!!
author: j k.

description: We arrived with no reservation, still only waited for three minutes. Staff and manager go out of their way to make you feel at home. Was our first time and we're blown away with how good food is,everything on menu is good.Low lite,romantic type vibe.
author: Desi P.

description:
OK I'm going to disagree with many of the other Yelpers. It is true that it is a romantic spot with excellent service.

However,  you ARE going there to eat, right? f you have been to Italy and have partaken of the most wonderful tender homemade pasta (in the world), then you may be disappointed here. They do have decent pasta and they do have decent sauces, but, sadly, neither is up to Italian standards. Their boar bolognese was tasty but not a correct bolognese -- too tomato-y and too watery; their tortellini supposedly filled with truffles was not, though its pesto-cream sauce was nice enough; the veal with porcini was a bit overcooked although the porcini sauce was very nice and mushroom-y. The tiramisu was surprisingly light and terrific. The service was very attentive, the wine list quite nice, and the red rose much appreciated. (I didn't mind Brad Pitt and Bill Clinton staring down  at me, actually. The pictures are discreetly small).

DON'T FORGET THE HILL!!. The Broadway sidewalk has steps leading you right up to the restaurant perched on top, and the view of the city and Bay Bridge is gorgeous. But it is quite a climb up those steps, if you approach on foot.

Sorry but I am very fussy about Italian food, and this doesn't make it just like all of the other Italian restaurants in the US. We did not order the lobster ravs, mentioned in other reviews here, so that might have been our big mistake.

Perfect place to take a first date who has never been to Italy. Take a cab, and don't miss that view.
author: Susan B.

description:
Took my Girlfriend and my daughter to Allegro Romano for her Bday. This was our first timer here, One word "Amazing", the best Italian restaurant we have ever been too. The service was perfection, the food was authentic Italian. Every dish we ordered was amazing, the ambiance was great, good location.  This became our favorite Italian restaurant, we recommend everyone try this place out.
Michael
author: Michael S.

description: We had a date night here on a Thursday night and had a great experience. The service was absolutely impeccable, with several servers and Lorenzo (the owner) all making sure we had everything we need from the moment we walked in. The rose petals on the table were a really nice touch, adding to the intimate, romantic vibe of the place. We started out with asparagus smothered in butter and cheese (just the way asparagus should be!) and some very simple but perfectly prepared tomato soup. The bread came out with a really nice zucchini dipping sauce, which almost made up for its lackluster performance. The bread was probably the only real low point of the meal. For mains, we had a steak special, perfectly cooked (which is often a challenge even at very high end restaurants) and paired with spinach and tasty gorgonzola mashed potatoes. My wife had the tortelloni with white truffle burata and pesto, which was pretty amazing. I tried to get my hands on as much of her meal as I could! We finished off with a chocolate on chocolate on chocolate gelato concoction which was as decadent as could be, along with a glass of port on the house. This is definitely a place to check out! Service is world class, atmosphere can't be beat, and the food is knock out.
author: George S.

description:
San Francisco turned into Rome the day I first saw this Russian Hill  spot. It seemed absolutely enchanting and I recommended it far and wide. But now after several visits the bloom is off the rose since  I have discovered as have others that Lorenzo, the host and owner, responds to messages and reservation requests only when the mood grabs him if you are not a celebrity  with your photo posted on his window He is mercurial to  a fault and rude in his disrespect for his patrons. The food is adequate, not fabulous and the last time we dined there we felt rushed as the staff went through the motions to usher us out for the second seating.
Too bad this place got so impressed with itself- it could be a gem.
author: Jeff C.

description:
WOW!  My favorite SF Restaurant.  I'm declaring this our special occasion spot.

We tried it Friday night with my parents in town and LOVED it.  We picked it from a friend's recommendation.  The food was delicious, creative, and very satisfying.  Also the portions we very reasonable for pricing and quality.

Our favorites that we ordered were the lobster ravioli that everyone mentions (although this was the best of the dishes,) my husband's special sea bass fish dish, the crab salad, the mushroom with spinach starter, the carpaccio,  and my fish with potatoes special of the day.  All of the food was so stellar that I'm thinking you truly cannot go wrong when ordering.  

To top it off we wound up having 3 deserts.  Biscotti, tiramisu, and chocolate gelato.  My table had a happy win-win moment when I declared the tiramisu being the best I'd ever had while my mom claimed the chocolate gelato. Needless to say we devoured both.  SO GOOD!

Keep in mind: parking is a challenge (ask the restaurant for help,) they give red roses to the ladies at the end of the meal, and you need reservations.  I think they serve dinner in seatings (possibly at 6 and 8).

Must.  Go.  Back.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Spectacular is a one word description.

On the ferry ride back from Sausalito we. We're given a recommendation to Allegro Romano by a resident of the city.   "It's my favorite restaurant in the city.  So, as a pseudo anniversary dinner we went last night.   

A small, well decorated venue that sits about 40-45 people.  4-5 people attending to the patrons, including the charming, well dressed owner.   

We split the warm spinach salad first.   Perfection!  Great taste, texture, presentation and portion.   We then split the buffalo cheese capressi.

For entree we split the White Truffle Tortellini.  Wow!  Very Good.

The staff was very professional, attentive to the customers and conversational.

We will look forward to our next visit to the city
author: Heather B.

description:
My boyfriend and I discovered this place a few weeks ago, and is now a favorite of ours. We came back again a week after our first dining experience. 

The place is really cute and special, warm and inviting, cozy and romantic. 
The staff are fantastic - just excellent service, warm and inviting people who really care about making you happy. The owner is very friendly and involved and really gets customer service. He truly cares about his business and creating a great dining experience for his customers.

The food is amazing. We started with Crepes al' Caviar e Salmone (interesting and fabulous). I had the halibut and  fettuccine and my boyfriend had the  fettuccine with white truffle sauce (out of this world!). Our second visit I had the lobster ravioli and he had the fettuccine with wild boar, and we started with risotto and white truffle appetizer - again all just wonderfully done. 

Biscotti and port wine was given to us complementary which was a very nice touch. 

You can't go wrong here. I can't wait to come back and try more on the menu. It is such a delight to dine here. Such a cute quaint neighborhood too. Parking can be an issue, but I have a Smart car, so it's not been a problem at all for us ; )
author: Janette S.

description: Excellent restaurant. Owner brings a personal high touch experience to the meal. Great value. Tip: climb the hill to the restaurant to make room for some delicious food.
author: Robert M.

description:
This is my second time here, first with the bf, second time with the bf and my dad. The first time I came we order the brushetta appetizer I ordered the tortellini truffle pesto which was very tasty. My bf order the lobster ravioli (very good as well). They give you a free desert the biscotti which is good, and they kept filling me up on port wine. I don't particularly love port but it was free so why not.

It's a very small so make reservations esp on Fri or Sat, and there closed on Mondays. Just call or email them super easy. 

The second time I went with my dad and BF I order the special Parmesan risotto with FRESH truffle shavings!!!! OMG sooo deliousssssss. My BF got the wild boar pasta an my dad got the veal.

Celebrities and famous people  come here apparently cuz they have pics of them there all over the walls. Thats cool, I wanna see brad pit eating next to me.
author: Jess O.

description:
HANDS DOWN THE BEST ITALIAN FOOD IVE HAD IN THE BAY AREA! 

Parking is a bit hard but its definitely worth it. This place is located on a cute little street in Russian Hill. Its a perfect place for a romantic date night!

The service is amazing and the food is delicious. I ordered gnocchi and it was cooked perfectly, seasoned well and looked beautiful. It was a flavor explosion in my mouth. I LOVE gnocchi and order it at pretty much every Italian place I go to... Allegro Romano makes awesome gnocchi! At the end of our meal the waiter brought over free dessert wine and biscotti. Also, the girls at our table were each given a long stemmed rose. 

THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!
author: Reena P.

description: We were lucky enough to be introduced to this little gem last night by a local.  It is a lovely and intimate space. We shared the beet salad and meatball appetizers. The salad was great but the meatballs were sublime. Tender and rich and the sauce simple enough to compliment rather than complicate. Good Italian bread was served with an interesting dipping sauce. We accepted the owners wine recommendation, an excellent Chianti Classico Reserva. The special was grouper and it was a satisfying portion of perfectly prepared sweet white flaky fish with a delicate piccata sauce over mashed potato.  Piccata too often is overpowering. This was perfectly balanced and subtle. The guys had pasta and both dishes satisfied,  Delicate biscotti, a tiramisu and a glass of port rounded out a perfect meal. Did I forget to mention that the service was impeccable?
author: Patty D.

description: One of the best Italian meals I've had and certainly one of the coziest restaurants in SF. Great for a cute date and a nice place to enjoy a bottle of wine. Romantic, and not a tourist in sight ;) Perfection.
author: Brittany B.

description: Staff is so friendly and the food is amazing. The prosciutto appetizer and truffle risotto were out of this world. Highly recommend this place!
author: Kate G.

description:
I'm Italian/Sicilian by descent, so it takes a lot for me to go pay money for Italian food.  Because, all modesty aide for the moment I can cook better Italian food than most supposed Italian places in San Francisco.  I love this place.  So much so that I confess, I was reluctant to post this.

I do not lightly recommend Italian restaurants to people because, as I've said elsewhere on this site, my ethnic 'cred is on the line.

As far as this wop is concerned, this place is, bar none, consistently the best Italian in San Francisco!  There is none better.  I used to live in the neighborhood, when I did we were there a couple of times a  month for years.  I don't live in this neighborhood any longer and Ive rarely been there this last ten years now, but oh man it is still that good.

Its not cheap, but its not terribly pricey either. As far as I'm concerned for what you get, the food, the service, the whole experience, its a bargain for what you get.

I feel morally compelled to point out that this is one of those places where, if you know what you're looking for, and you're willing to spend some time scouring the wine list, there are some absolutely sublime wines, for less than what you'd pay for them at retail.

I've lived in San Francisco for many years, and, as much as I love this place for being so casual and accepting, one of the downsides is often service, even in high-end places is, well, pretty casual.   The service in this place is consistently absolutely  impeccable.

Food, wine, service, the neighborhood, this place is the entire package.  Go there, just go.

Oh and in so far as some of the negative reviews of this place goes, and I did, many years ago witness such an event, they won't tolerate loud, drunken cretins ruining other people's experience there.   I happen to agree with this and applaud them for it.

One word of caution, the place is tiny, make a reservation, don't just show up

Also, if you want a special place to impress someone, take a date, give someone from out of town a memorable San Francisco experience, this is a good place to do that.   Walk half a block East from here to the wall at the top of the hill on Broadway and experience one of the best views of San Francisco you'll never find on any tourist map.  I used to spend hours sitting here when I lived in this neighborhood.  You can see the fog rolling in at sunset, hear the foghorns out on the bay, and it is very peaceful and quiet up there.  It is, in a word, magnificent.
author: Michael C.

description:
I feel like my experience must not have been representative because I'm really not sure what everyone else on yelp is raving about (and I really wanted to love Allegro Romano). I would pass this place up (in fact I'm sorry I wasted one of my last few dinners in SF on this place).

My primary problem with this restaurant is the attitude. They make it almost impossible to make reservations (I called and left a voicemail - my calls were never returned, I wrote two emails which were left unanswered) and so we ended up showing up here early one evening (before the dinner rush) in order to try it out.
