Furthermore, when we showed up, there were pictures everywhere of celebrities who had come to eat there (perhaps an LA thing to do, but it seemed unnecessarily self-praising), and they were playing classics from Andrea Bocelli, Frank Sinatra, etc. on repeat (like a classic, romantic mix tape ). The host / servers seemed very distracted by some people who were coming later that night. The waiter told us to order quickly (at 6pm) because a large (seemingly "important") party was coming at 8pm. (What?!) They kept looking out the window, and going in and out the door in anticipation (which became very cold - one person in our party tried, in vain, to get them to close the door). 

It is worth noting that the homemade pasta (Fettuccine with White Truffle Sauce) was very tasty - however, IMHO, it's not worth the effort.
author: Helen D.

description:
There is something to say about a restaurant that stays old school. A restaurant that caters to the locals and is off the beaten path. There is a certain charm that comes with this philosophy, that is, if you can get your foot in the door.

I made reservations with their answering machine. The message on their machine told me that someone would call me back. No one ever called me back. I figured that based on the other yelp reviews that I should just plan on coming in. My girlfriend and I took an Uber there and were greeted at the door by a friendly waiter. He asked if we had reservations and I said that I had called and requested a table but had never heard back. This may have been my fault for taking the chance but in this day and age, in San Francisco no doubt, I feel as though something as simple as a call back should be SOP. When we were told that the restaurant was full and that there was no room for us we were told that we should go to their sister restaurant down the street and that we would be taken care of. 

I understood that we did not have a reserved confirmation but for them to then send us to another restaurant and then not let that restaurant know we were coming was what put me over the edge. We were made to look foolish. Walking into two different places and turned away from both. We were both dressed up and it was to celebrate a special occasion. The staff just made a bunch of excuses as to why they could not answer their phone or call us back or why we couldn't eat there. All of this felt very elitist as though we were not allowed to eat there.

I have lived in SF for over a decade and love it here. This is my home. I have been to some of the finest restaurants in the city and I just cannot believe how they run their operation. Open table could have solved this issue easily.

They will not be getting my money anytime soon.
author: Morgan H.

description:
Hands down, my favorite Italian place in SF. I live in North Beach where Italian Restaurants are a dime-a-dozen, but whenever any visitors ask where the best Italian food in the city is I say Allegro Romano without hesitation. (If you're wondering, which you're probably not.. the best Italian dining in North Beach is Vicoletto. amazing!) 

Allegro Romano.. my first time there I was dining with my cousin. We had a couple of glasses before dinner, ordered a bottle at dinner, which is perhaps why the food was so outstanding. The white truffle tortellini with basil pesto is the most incredible dish ever. The appetizers are great too--- bruschetta, the mushrooms, everything. You really can't go wrong. When I was last there with my boyfriend, he ordered the lobster ravioli with vodka sauce which was (unsurprisingly) insanely good. 

The best part about Allegro is that it's off the beaten path, on a quaint street in Nob Hill. It's a little gem, which is why celebrities tend to flock to it when in town (you will see the extensive wall collection of pictures.. Brangelina, Bill Clinton, et all). The service is also fantastic!

Highly, highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Came here for my b'day dinner and by far the BEST Italian food I've had.

It's tucked away from the busy city and has such a cute vibe to this place. It's a very small restaurant which makes it feel very intimate and perfect for a date :) 

Lorenzo, the owner, is super sweet and helps out his staff. ALL the waiters work together (since it's such a small place) to serve you. They were on top of things but weren't annoying. They were friendly, and have a sense of humor which is a good thing! 

Appetizer - Mushroom with spinach (very rich and flavorful)

Main Course - Lobster ravioli - BEST I've ever had. sauce was creamy, buttery and just plain delicious. It tasted very authentic. 
Rigatoni alla Amatriciana  - Seriously the best pasta i've ever had. Had bits of bacon it it..MMMMMmmmMMM
Filet Mignon - cooked to perfection, just delicious!

Dessert - cheesecake....well, you can't go wrong with the cheesecake. 

Lorenzo pays attention to the small details...had his staff put a candle on my cheesecake when they came out and didn't have one on there (lol) and also gave me a rose, and what girl hates roses? 

I suggest you get a corner table if you are on a date, they have a little curtain thing to separate you from the kitchen and from staring at the other people across from you. Also, their wine selection is awesome! 

Definitely will come back here, will probably do without the appetizer and fillet mignon but will try more pasta dishes!! Thank you Allegro Romano for making my b'day a memorable and delicious one! :)
author: AK M.

description:
I want my $10 cab fare back.

My friend called at 5pm on a Wednesday to see if we could get reservations.  The man who answered the phone told my friend they could seat us if we were there by six o'clock.  I hopped a cab and was there at  5:55pm.    There was already a large table seated and another man was sitting alone at a back table (the restaurant was 3/4 empty).

When I told the guy who greeted me that we had just called and wanted a table for two, he scanned the restaurant and said it was impossible to seat me because they had a large party coming at 7pm.  I questioned how that could be when we just called.  He apologized, said he wasn't the person we spoke to, and handed me a business card for their other restaurant close by.
I was stunned by this treatment.

So, my friend and I were shut out of dinner and I was out $10 on a cab.

Tsk, tsk, Allegro Romano.   That is no way to run a restaurant in a city that's full of them.
author: jane s.

description:
Parents came to town and I was so incredibly excited to have found this place and take them here. This place had come highly recommended so I immediately called to make a reservation. The owner/chef/manager called me back the following morning to confirm the reservation and everything sounded great. I thanked him for getting back to us and he said he was excited to have us.

When we arrived at 7:42 for our 7:45 reservation the next evening they had no record of our reservation. They gave us some line about how they get confused and there are two different restaurants. They told us to go to their "sister" restaurant Alla Romano just down the street saying it was the same food.  It was not at all the same. We walked in, saw the menu, and walked right out. They made a half attempt to win us over but just wasn't the same.

I had heard nothing about great things from this place and had even amped it up to my family. After they lost our reservations and very kindly shoved us out the door, the entire evening wasn't the same.

Really unfortunate and poor way to lose a gracious customer and potentially a huge advocate of their business.

Couldn't reinforce Mile V's review from 2/15 any more.

If they read these reviews and would like to try to win back my patronage I can be reached at (650) 319-6756.
author: Todd P.

description:
Allegro Romano is a gem of a restaurant atop Russian Hill.  On entering I am greeted by one of the servers and notice the host/owner sitting at one of the tables.  He is conducting business on a cell phone, but later greeted some customers.  Obviously locals and repeat clientele. 

The servers here are great.  When I began to over order my server recommended a half salad, a half order of pasta and then my entree.   My server also produced a nice glass of red wine, and it was far from pricey.  And they have someone in the kitchen with a deft hand.    

My half order of caesar salad topped with crab was lovely.  Fresh romaine lettuce.  Fresh and abundant crab.  

A half order of risotto and scallops with a fig balsamic sauce was good largely due to the sauce, which was different and tasty.  The scallops were a bit rubbery.  

Scallopini with porcini mushrooms was only OK.  The veal was shy of top quality but was well cooked.  The mushrooms were nice, and the spinach and mashed potatoes were perfect.   The reduction sauce was watery and didn't taste of wine, but I liked this plate anyway and the price was right.  

Next time my inclination would be to go with some seafood as they displayed the fish before I ordered.
author: David D.

description: Had a really wonderful experience here with a friend who had been several times before. We received several complimentary things (probably because she is one of the most beautiful/charismatic people you will ever meet) like flasks of wine, desserts, mini courses, etc. Waiters were flirtatious which was pretty funny for a big group of girls. I had the lobster ravioli - the only star off is that the food just wasn't that different. It was good, but not particularly unique; standard Italian yummies. We also got some melon and prosciutto, which was pretty tasty. Would definitely come back here, and recommend that others do the same. Would bring a visiting friend here too, since the experience was generally so positive.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Honestly, I wasn't going to write a review for this restaurant.  It already has 215 reviews and only 32 seats.  For being popular among celebrities, I'm extremely shocked there isn't a six-month waiting list and pleasantly surprised commoners like myself can make a reservation for the same week.  As I grow older, however, I've decided to be less selfish--and more sharing.  You're welcome for #216.

My girl friends and I had a romantic dinner for five here, complete with rose petals on white tablecloth, Dean Martin's "That's Amore," and one of the best service in town.  We each received complimentary port wine for dessert and long-stem red roses to take home--I can't even remember the last time a boy gave me flowers on a date.  Oh, wait... 11th grade.  Chinese hole-in-the-wall.  Unmemorable except for that.

Anyway, the food.  The food sounded mouthwatering on the menu, looked tantalizing in front of me, and tasted unbelievable in my mouth.  We began with the caviar and salmon crepes ($12.50).  They were light yet tasty; my only complaint was that they were very small.  I could've had two orders of that by myself for an appetizer, but I'm also eating to keep warm for the 50-degree winters here.  

Next I had the rigatoni with foie gras, black truffles, and Madeira wine ($18).  The sauce was flavorful, rich, and plentiful.  I even saved a few bites to take home, so that I could relive my foodgasm the next day.  Absolutely divine.  I also tried MS's white truffle tortellini in basil pesto sauce ($18.50).  Another winner.  For the record, all the pastas are homemade and heavenly.  I just can't wait to try the lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce and scallop risotto in black ink and fig-balsamic sauce!  I can't even say that without drooling a little on my keyboard. 

For dessert we shared the tartufo tre scalini--a rich, handmade chocolate ice cream roll.  Apparently, Allegro Romano and it's sister restaurant (Tre Scalini in Rome) are famous for it, and it paired perfectly with the port.  DC said it was the best meal we've had, and we have weekly dinners together at different restaurants, so that speaks volumes.

I couldn't be happier that Allegro Romano is in my neighborhood.  Not only does Russian Hill have the best French (La Folie) and best German (Leopold's) in SF, it also has the best Italian.  Ok, Acquerello may be #1 and in Nob Hill, but Allegro Romano is a close second and much more reasonably priced. 

I actually spent five months in Italy last year, so I'm kind of an authority on Italian cuisine.  Ha.
author: Liz T.

description: Had dinner here again last night and have to say this is one of the best places I have eaten at in SF. Full attention to detail, freshly made to order local and imported food with tons of flavor and incredibly attentive service. Last night, chef cooked a 6 course dinner with fresh truffles shaved into every course. My pallet was very satisfied!
author: Tom M.

description:
If it weren't for the food being good I would have given no stars (if that were possible) Seriously the food is the only good thing about this place. THE SERVICE IS AWFUL! and the owner is rude!

I went here with a bunch of friends to celebrate a friend's birthday and pretty much from the moment we walk in we got attitude by the servers and the owner. The full-of-themselves attitude and the vibe we got as if we weren't important enough to be there is what really pisses me off. 

Some friends arrived late and one friend decided to pour herself a glass of wine and the server ran over and literally snatched the bottle out of her hand mid pour then rudely asked for her ID. Instead of politely walking over and asking for her ID before she had some wine. Be professional! 

Then as he went around to check all our IDs (totally fine obviously we are in our early 20s and should be carded) he made a big stink about one of our friends not drinking (??!!) how fricken rude of the server!!! It's a personal choice to drink or not to drink alcohol and being made fun of for it is soooo not cool!

When we got the check they must of come back 10 times to see if we were done figuring out how much everybody owed. It got so rude and irritating we literally had to yell at them that we weren't done yet and we'd let them know. Then to top it off we were the last table to be in the restaurant (and it wasn't that late) and as soon as the 2nd to last table got up to leave they turned on all the lights in a passive aggressive effort to get us out. Clearly our money and patronage wasn't good enough for them. 

I've never experience service this rude anywhere! Needless to say none of us will be coming back.

Way to judge a group of girls by our age, when we were completely polite, not rowdy at all, and just trying to enjoy a night out.
author: Olivia L.

description:
Born and raised in the city, I pride myself on knowing the food scene. When Cherylynn A. suggested Allegro Romano for dinner, the record needle literally went off track.. Wha? Where? Huh? I had never heard of it before and surprisingly so! One look at the walls and they're covered with pictures of celebrities. And not only is Rigatoni alla 'Amatriciana featured on the menu as Willie Brown's favorite pasta dish, but the server also told me that Gary Danko frequents Allegro for the Fettucini with White Truffle Sauce and the New York Strip Steak. 

Suffice it say, I have more in common with Willie Brown and Gary Danko than I thought because Allegro has now become my favorite Italian restaurant in SF. BOLD WORDS, right?! Well, as I'm writing this review, my mouth is literally WATERING, thinking about other pasta dishes I can return and try. (Note: After I wrote this review, I made reservations for this upcoming Saturday).

We started off our meal with a complimentary bruschetta. The bread was toasted to crunchy perfection and topped with a fresh mix of tomatoes, basil, olive oil and balsamic vinegar. 

We each ordered the Rigatoni Pasta with Foie Gras, Black Truffles & Old Madera Wine. The server was helpful enough to suggest that we split the pasta dish to make room for the entree. I'm glad he did! The half portion size was very generous! I ate this pasta so slooooow, attempting to saver and prolong the orgasmic experience. The rigatoni was perfectly al dente, its toothsome ridges coated with a rich, decadent savory sauce of foie gras, black truffles and wine. The sauce was PERFECTION: subtly sweet, savory, and earthy. The last time I had foie gras-truffle pasta this mind-blowingly good was at Acquerello, but for double the price.

Next, I had the Scaloppini with Porcini Mushrooms. Anything that's noted on the menu as "a piece of Heaven" has to be tried at least once. The tender, thinly sliced pieces of veal were dredged in flour, sautéed, and topped with fresh porcini mushrooms in a Barolo-Port reduction demi-glace. Though "a piece of Heaven" may be a stretch, this dish was still very, very good. The port reduction was reminiscent of the foie gras-truffle sauce from my first course: rich, decadent, subtly sweet, but still savory.

I tried a piece of Cherylynn A's Filetto ai Porcino and Baretto Sauce Black Angus filet mignon with porcini mushrooms & Barolo red wine sauce and it was also very, very good. 

Just when I thought the meal was over, it got extended by another hour, some complimentary housemade almond biscotti, and a whole lotta port. Service during this entire time was TOP-NOTCH. 

Allegro is a neighborhood gem. Reasonably priced for all budgets, but with a romantic, intimate atmosphere that speaks to champagne tastes. Our server also mentioned that most of its customers come from hotels like the Fairmont, InterContinental, and the Ritz.
author: Monelle A.

description:
I came here looking to impress Italian guests and I was not disappointed. First to note, this is a small joint on a corner, off the beaten-path of all the big, elegant, tourist-trap restaurants found in Northern San Francisco. The look is simple, but the food is far from it. But as far as my reviews tend to go, I weigh the quality of the food and service first off. You can tell by any pictures that it is not an "elegant" place, though they try with what space they are given. It has characteristics of the owner, which makes it more his personal work, which I find enduring in restaurants that are "off the beaten path."
The staff was amazing. These people really knew their stuff and seemed to enjoy their job. Many dishes on the menu feature white and black truffles. Our waiter came by our table to answer any questions we had about the menu, and with him he brought a whole, beautiful black truffle so that we may see the quality and freshness of the ingredient. I loved that. Those things are not cheap and this one was an impressive size, so to have it brought out and explained was pretty neat.
As for the food, fantastic. I had the white truffle tortellini with creamy pesto sauce. The truffle flavor was just enough to boost the flavor of every part of the dish, but not overwhelming. It was by far the best creamy pesto sauce I've had. 
Another guest had their version of a carbonara (not featured on their online menu) with black truffle. Once again, the flavor of the smokier black truffle was an enticing background to the meats and perfectly cooked pasta. No bite was lacking in either flavor.
Finally, the third in our party had the risotto with scallops in black-ink and fig-balsamic sauce. I must say, the flavors of the ink with the fig balsamic were something I have not had before, and I loved it. The risotto took on a dark color, which may seem off-putting, but that is the result of the calamari ink, which in itself seems off-putting, however after one bite you will get what it is all about.
Throughout the meal our staff was friendly and energetic, filling our wine classes without being asked and offering any answers to questions we may have. As the meal came to a close, they brought us three small port glasses and filled them with a wonderful Tanny Port - on the house! But it didn't end there, we had clearly been chatting it up quite a bit and they made us feel comfortable enough to stay as they continued to fill the glasses! I was amazed at the generosity of it! They were playful but not in-you-face about anything, just consistently making sure we were well taken care of in the drinks department- which we certainly did not mind! 
Over all, I was happy. I had been nervous about impressing my guests and judging by their complements to the food, I had done well (meaning Allegro Romano did well, I merely selected it).
author: Laurel R.

description:
This restaurant definitely deserves its stellar ratings! It's a small, quaint place that's perfect for romantic dates...or in my case a fun night out with the girls. The ambience begins with rose petals on the tables and dim lighting. Not a bad start. 

We had an appetizer of salmon crepes which were delicious and well priced. My main dish was the rigatoni with foie gras and black truffles. Melt in your mouth deliciousness and under $20. Given the fact that the walls are plastered with pictures of celebrities (Brad Pitt smiles down at you while you eat), I wasn't expecting such great prices. 

The Italian owner and waiters complete the picture. Everyone is very nice. It also doesn't hurt that they give out free port and a rose for each girl on your way out. Best date with a restaurant I've ever had. If you're looking for a cute neighborhood place with delicious food, great prices, and quality service, Allegro Romano is for you.
author: Diana C.

description:
We came to Allegro Romano on a Wednesday night. It was a superb evening - the food was great, the service was friendly, and the vibe was classy and fun. 

On a weekday, the place was very busy. We had a reservation so were seated immediately. The servers were so friendly and attentive. People were constantly checking to see if we were enjoying the meal and to see if they could get us anything else. 

We split the black angus filet mignon and the fettucini with white truffle sauce. Both were superb. We also were provided complimentary bruschetta. We ordered a glass of wine each, and they also gave us a dessert wine. We remember the dessert being good but can't remember what it was (might be related to the complimentary refills on the dessert wine). Even after we had clearly ordered everything we were going to, they kept refilling our wine, as if we could have stayed all night if we wanted to. It was nice to feel like we were eating on our own time (even though the place was busy and there was a constant flow of new people coming in), instead of being rushed out. 

Kudos to the staff for making the dining experience so nice. We will definitely be back to try many other delicious-sounding things on the menu.
author: Alden Q.

description: Everything about this restaurant was awesome. If you like truffles, you'll be in heaven.  Depending on the season, they have fresh black truffles or white truffles. Pastas were made fresh and cooked to perfection. Great service, great food and nice ambiance. I'm going to become a regular!
author: Aden Z.

description:
4/12/13
What a beautiful evening to have dinner at Allegro today. I made reservations for two, four weeks in advance and I believe I received the last two-party reservation at 6. Upon entering, we were greeted by a staff member and were seated quickly. The place had only been open for about an hour and there weren't many people occupying the restaurant and made the evening quiet and enjoyable.

The excellent staff were nice, speedy, and funny. Unfortunately, I never got their names but one of 'em helped us decide on the bottle of red wine and it was a brilliant choice. Minutes after ordering, our appetizer of bruschetta came and were delicious. The bread was toasted nicely and was very cripsy but, did not crumble when cut. Tomatoes were flavorful and the olive oil used seemed to be extra, extra virgin.

I ordered the homemade lobster raviolli and have no regrets. The pink vodka sauce was not overpowering or too tangy, within the sauce were pieces of lobster (damn good). The raviolli was easy to cut with either a fork or with a knife, it stayed together and the fillings didn't spill out. The portion size was a good amount that left enough room for dessert.

My lady friend ordered the White Truffle Tortellini in Basil Pesto Sauce. Creamy, chewy tortellini. With the basil pesto sauce, you can rstill taste the truffle within the tortellini. The portion size again was as good as the lobster ravi.

We topped the night with a slice of key lime pie and tiramisu, which I believe were homemade. The tiramisu sat beside two finger sized biscotti's, two pieces of cantaloupe, small dash of whipcream with raspberry sauce on top. the plate was also netted with chocolate sauce and powdered sugar. Presentation was amazing and the tiramisu itself stayed together very well. The biscotti's had a very nice almond flavor and were semi-soft.

I definitely plan on coming back in the near future.
author: Vince L.

description:
Been here several times.  Very cute place with very friendly wait staff.  Good food too!  Nice pasta dishes.  We typically eat family style and share entrees.  This allows us to try a bit of everything.  We've had the fish & meat dishes.  Pasta is the best.

I would highly recommend the place.  Located in a residential neighborhood.  Good luck in finding parking!
author: Marie E.

description: My husband and I came here for our wedding anniversary in Feb. 2014. Very romantic atmosphere, soft candlelight, and classy. I enjoyed my experience here. Although, there was one thing that left a bad taste in my mouth. When answering that our special occasion was our anniversary they congratulated us by bringing out a plate of tiramisu, and then charged us for it. I just thought that was a little rude. If I am going to have dessert I'd like to make my own selection instead of having a server show up with a slice of surprise and then bill me, when I'd rather have something else. Other than that I enjoyed our celebration here.
author: Loren B.

description: I am so happy to have found this place! The service is excellent and the food is wonderful, every time! If you are walking, the hill will kill ya, but it is worth every step to get some tasty pasta or Carpaccio. It is a small place, so reservations are HIGHLY recommended!
author: Kari D.

description: I took my friend to Allegro Romanos on Friday night.  I myself, have been to this restaurant many, many times.  The food was not good!  After eating here 8-9 times I was so diappointed.  The owner let the entire restaurant know they had to rush.  He had booked a wedding party for 8 pm. He was so rude!  We will never, never go back.
author: Ronny F.

description:
We dine there everytime we go to the city, one or twice a year, if we can get in!
Very popular place. Intimate, with great ambiance. What really makes it special besides the wonderful food, is the way Lorenzo is always warm, freindly and fun, all the while staying right on top of everything so it runs smoothly. Always makes you feel very welcome.
The staff is excellent, lots of fun. You can see right away why people always come back. And thank you Lorenzo for always making the ladies feel special with your roses!
Nancy & Miles Crail
author: Nancy C.

description:
I was in SF for the 1st time for work. A coworker selected Allegro (via Yelp) for dinner. The food was EXCELLENT and the service was even BETTER.  The staff was VERY attentive to everything.  BRAVO!

The Caesar salad w/ crab meat and the lobster ravioli was AWESOME.  It's like they didn't want us to leave. They kept feeding us and bringing us port wine.

Make sure to make a reservation before coming to guarantee a seat in the restaurant!
author: Chris B.

description: The filet mignon was very good, but the lobster ravioli was the worst I've ever had. The mood was weird;  the wait staff seemed indifferent, as if they wished they were somewhere else. The Tiramisu was mediocre, as was the chocolate mousse.
author: Beverley B.

description:
My husband came her for my birthday dinner last Friday.  We originally had a Michael Mina reservation, but I wasn't feeling well so we opted for something more low-key.  What a blessing in disguise!  We had one of the best meals we've had in SF! 

The food was excellent, but what really sold us was the service.  I mean, AWESOME!  These people were incredible.  Staff was everywhere to serve your needs, fill your glass, wipe your crumbs, ect.  They also gave my husband about 5 pours of red wine at the end of the meal with our complimentary dessert (yes, after we ordered dessert!).  They ordered a cab for us and gave each woman a red rose.  I look at that flower on my table every day and think about that restaurant - these people are smart!!  Their attention to detail & service make this restaurant one of the best in the city. We will definitely be back!!

What we ordered: bruschetta, Rigatoni all'Amatriciana, Dover Sole with Picatta- Caper Sauce over Black Olive Risotto, Risotto with Black Truffle (special), New York Cheesecake, & TARTUFFO "TRE SCALINI".  My husband raved about the special...so much truffle!!  He said he wanted that to be his last meal...it was that good!
author: Kim D.

description:
Waitstaff, food, ambiance.  All 5 stars.  

When we first arrived, we went to a small corner table, which the server moved away from the booth so we could sit down. I think our server was new..he was a bit awkward and another server was always closeby.  We started with the Carpaccio.  I've never had it before, but holy crap.  It was so thinly sliced spread out on a big plate with this delicious cheese grated on top.  I think it was one of the most flavorful things I've ever eaten.  Seriously, amazing.

Then we had dinner: Josh had Willie Brown's favorite.  I forget the name, but it was pasta served in a delicious red sauce and the server actually recommended Josh's and my dish for the entree.  He had it prepared for Josh the way he liked it, which had long onions on top.  

I got the lobster ravioli..which was AMAZING.  I tend to shy away from ravioli at restaurants because I hate how most places make it too thin and then everything comes out.  Or I hate when I get one HUGE ravioli..it's annoying.  So I told our server that and he said, order it, ours isn't like that.  And it wasn't!  It was just the right consistency of thickness.  You cut it with your fork no problem, but it didn't fall apart when you did that.  The filling was delicious and I practically licked the plate when I finished the ravioli to get all that sauce.

We finished with a tiramisu which I never order because Josh doesn't like it..but I had a feeling if dinner was this good, their tiramisu would be also.  And it was.  Not too much rum, it wasn't soggy at all.  Delicious chocolate throughout and a great chocolate sauce on the plate.  They served it with biscotti and watermelon. Really nice touch.  

And they gave me a pretty peach rose and the server took several pictures of us outside next to the restaurant per my request.  Overall, what a fantastic experience..we'll definitely be back..even if it's on a STEEP hill and there is barely any parking.  :)
author: Rebecca B.

description: My friend Lorenzo makes the dining experience amazing! The food the wine the atmosphere make this local eatery a must when in SF.
author: Drew S.

description: This place is great! Very cozy inside on a rainy day. With the large windows and great happy hour deals, you can sit a people watch after a long day at work.
author: Angel S.

description:
This place is soooo good that I debated giving it 1 star to keep people from discovering it.  Lorenzo delivers impeccable service to both large and small groups.  Call in advance for reservations because he is often booked up.  

Dinners are reasonably priced around $18.  My favorite dishes include the Amatriciana, the Fettuccine with Truffle sauce, and the Linguine with Foie Gras and asparagus.  

Often times he will have a special that includes truffles.  He will bring the truffle out to your table and shave a generous portion on your meal right in front of you.  Normally you wouldn't be able to find a dish like this in the city for less than $40, but Lorenzo serves it for around $24.  

The best part is sometimes he gives out freebies throughout the night.  You'll get bruschetta for an appetizer, biscotti and strawberries for dessert, a glass of port and a rose for all of the ladies as they walk out the door.   

This is a gem, and an amazing place for a date :)
author: Jennifer G.

description:
From the onset it was not a welcoming experience.  We were originally a party of two (thru Open Table), but were unable to change it to three - we did try.  One of our party was early, the two of us were about 5 minutes late.  Maybe unforgiveable but should have been manageable.  Because of this they sat us at a table, originally set for two, but had to put one of us (me) in the aisle and this made the aisle tighter. I'm not a big person, 5'1", 113 lbs, but the waiter, who was wearing teal/green colored pants,(heard he might have been the manager) bumped into my chair at least a half dozen times - NO apologies. 
The bread and dipping sauce were not the best, but we could live with it.  Because two of us were not really hungry we ordered the Dungeness crab cesar salad as our dinner entrees.  Bad mistake!  Very little crab, and what little we had consisted of a few crumbs of crab - NO lump portions!  Not nice since we do live in the Dungeness crab capital of the world.  We did know that it was not crab season, but really - we could've gotte a little more crab in our CRAB cesar salad! The dressing and croutons were also a disappointment, but we let that go.  UNTIL we noticed the table next to us ordered the same salad; however, their crab portion was a healthy portion with lump meat portions. 
Where's the quality control or was this their way of NOT forgiving us for coming in late, adding an extra person, or only ordering salad as our entrees.  BTW the third person in our party ordered first and second courses PLUS a glass of wine!  She did enjoy her meal and said it was very delicious.  They also served us so quickly that we were out of the restaurant within 45-50 minutes.  
Also worth mentioning.  As of right now we still have not received our 100 points from Open Table.  Maybe we will, but I would not be surprised if we did not. If you do opt to go I hope you have a better experience than we did!!  
BTW - we did leave a tip.
author: Lavine M.

description:
I am a foodie. My husband and I PLAN our vacations around food. Ignore the negative comments. EVERYTHING was fabulous. Order anything you like and it will be divine.  Party of 5 on two nights (vacation) ordered different things each night (3 apps and 5 mains and 3 desserts) and each was heaven. Go there. Don't hesitate. 

Bonus: the wait staff is the best I have ever experienced. Vegas, NY, Boston, Maine. Hawaii, all of CA, Mexico, Hong Kong, Singapore, Bahamas, Canada included.
author: Shelly E.

description:
Having tickets for Beach Blanket Babylon we needed an early dinner - this is definitely the place to be.  

Lorenzo was the perfect host!  We began with a glass of bubbly and bruschetta, followed by Asparagus Alla Parmigiana which was heavenly and Mushrooms Trifolati which was mouth wateringly fabulous.  We had a lovely bottle of wine to accompany our pasta, the homemade lobster ravioli, followed by the fish special of pan seared halibut.

The desserts were also to die for with tiramisu and a fabulous chocolate mousse type creation.

Definitely worth the visit - great wine, great service and amazing food.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Lynne L.

description:
Dining at Allegro Romano is like having a decadent Italian dinner at a good friend's home.  The owner and waitstaff are the most attentive, generous and thoughtful I've experienced to date.   Some suggested tips before you arrive:

Make a reservation.  This place is cozy but well appointed and charming.  Luck was in the cards that a couple of cancellations allowed a few walk-ins to dine very well.  Thank you.

Walk or take a cab.  Luck also left us a rare parking spot across the street.  You may leave a little tipsy from the complimentary port after dinner.

Come hungry.  Fresh breads and dipping sauces as are port, coffee and water are repeatedly filled back up. They want you to stay, dine, chat, and enjoy life. Mi casa, sous casa.

Maybe sing a bar or two.  There was a newly married couple + a birthday, so naturally, the house sang That's Amore with applauding afterwards.  

Rose.  It was one of the nicest sentiments of the evening.  A perfect red rose handed to each gal.   Sorry guys.

Food.  Portions are reasonable and rich, so we shared some of the specials:  


Softshell crabs with spinach.  The crabs were so fresh, you could taste their salty ocean brine.  

Pasta with black truffle oil and cheese.  The waiter grated A LOT of yummy extra truffle on top.  Divine.

Turkey scallopine with mashed potatoes & spinach.  Tender and lots of flavor.

Dessert:  chocolate mousse with a cookie crumb top.  Yowza.

Amore, Allegro Romano.  Grazie!
author: Jen L.

description:
Delicious food in a fantastic atmosphere.  Authentic Italian dishes with deluxe ingredients like truffle oil and lobster.  The wait staff is very friendly and accommodating, the decor is classy but understated and the food is just plain tasty.  We were there on a night when there happened to be 2 anniversaries being celebrated so the owner turned on "That's Amore" and came around with dessert wine and everyone sang together.  Overall it was a really fun night and I'll definitely be returning soon.

My only complaint about Allegro Romano is that their reservation system seemed a bit odd.  We tried calling early in the day and got a message saying to leave our name, number of people in our party and a contact phone number.  We didn't hear back by that evening, so we tried calling again, got the same message and decided to just show up and hope for the best.  The owner said he didn't have a record of our reservation, but squeezed us in saying there'd been a cancellation.  I'm glad we got a table, but I'd like to know how to properly get our name in for next time, especially since it's a small restaurant and seems to fill up quickly.
author: Katie S.

description:
I wanted to write before my delicious memories fade, as I enjoy round 2 from our dinner last night (portions were truly gargantuan). although I did want to scarf my entire plate of garlic halibut pasta last night. but really it was like a pound of pasta each, which no one could possibly finish, um, except for the men at the table who were scraping their plates. including the husband who got the lobster ravioli (and he NEVER gets the lobster option).

produce was fresh (yummy asparagus), pasta was PERFECTLY cooked, and all was very well-priced. just wish the wine list was a bit more adventurous. service was a bunch of dolls! attentive, friendly, and good looking, to boot :) this is not the trendy latest, just a good place to enjoy italian food, done classy, done right.
author: Sasha R.

description: One of my all time favorite Italian Restaurants ever! We dined here on Friday and left it to our server to surprise us with appetizers and salads. All were delicious and fresh. Main courses were equally wonderful, followed by a dessert sampler and the famous house port. Great food, service and a very enjoyable experience!
author: Jean W.

description:
Service was a little too overbearing, and the food was nothing special. Little full of themselves! The pasta and veal was blah, nothing special. The steak was AWFUL! Dry, mealy, tasteless. I don't think we'd go back. 
The waiters were all over our women, like that Saturday night live Italian restaurant skit! It was just over the top ridiculous! I was told I was quite by the owner while with my guest. Well I am not quite now Yo!
author: Kirk M.

description: Excellent! The Truffle Risotto is decadent! Lobster Ravioli perfect, Fettuccine with Wild Boar Bolognese also very good! Great local gem!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Went with four other people, we had little tastes of each others orders. The food was to die for. I ordered the beef carpaccio to start, and then the rigatoni a la carbonara with black truffles; AMAZING. Other things the table ordered: Caesar with dungeoness crab; Willie Brown's favorite pasta with tomato sauce and pancetta; truffle cream filled tortellini with a pesto cream sauce. I would go back and get all of the same things, again! 

Only took off a star because the service was not good at all. Everything was rushed; felt like no one was genuinely nice; almost like they didn't want any people in their restaurant. I like to enjoy my meal in peace, please don't ask me a million times in the middle of dinner if I'd like a taxi called - even after we said we drove there.
author: A S.

description:
Let's just say, this place is probably one of the best Italian restaurants in SF...no in California.   Lorenzo, the owner is a mastermind.    Don't be surprised to see political big wigs or Hollywood customers.   The food is amazing and the wine is even better.   So the place is small, very small and has a home feel - don't expect some big-wig set-up you see at Slanted door, it literally feels like you are in the owner's home and he will treat you that way.   Anyways, it's a MUST TRY if you are within 400 miles of this place. 

Oh, good luck trying to get reservations.   I only got in because I was connected and am way cool... okay, maybe just because I had inside hook-up via friends.
author: H D.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday (11/2/2011) and from start to finish, our experience was great.

The restaurant is quaint and kind of hidden within the neighborhood. The decor is tacky but it just adds to the place's charm. For a Wednesday night, it was packed...I'm assuming that it usually is. We started with the mushrooms, caprese, and a glass of Prosecco. From the first bite of our appetizers we knew we were in for a treat. For dinner, we brought our own bottle of wine (Corkage: $25) and we had the lobster ravioli and the veal. Our entrees were to-die-for, everything was rich and tasty and cooked to perfection. For the meal alone, 5 stars.

The extras of this restaurant really pushed it toward a place I'd love to frequent on a regular basis, if only I lived closer. One of the servers (who had a great set of pipes) busted out into Opera mid-dinner. The servers made a big fuss over my birthday which I appreciated and thought was cute. We were brought a complimentary dessert and two glasses of port.

On a side note, everyone, from the hostess, to two servers, to presumably the owner...offered to call us a cab. I guess some people would be offended or felt like alcoholics, but I thought it was great. Awesome food, friendly service, and making sure you get home safely - 5 stars for sure!
author: Brooke I.

description: Wonderful recommendation from a friend of the beaten path that you have to try!  Top notch service with great ambiance!!!  The food is outstanding! !!  Make reservations on a weekend because it's small and intimate you dint want to Mia or on this place. So reasonably priced I couldn't believe it.
author: Dori D.

description:
The food wasn't mind blowing and was a few small dings I could give some of the dishes but overall it was good. What's really great here is the incredible service. It's a small neighbor joint and they treat it's patrons like family. The portions were hearty and we got twice as many desserts as order followed by and additional comp plate of cookies. ANd that wasn't enough, glasses of Port magically appeared when the desserts were served. When the glass got lower than half way, they'd come around and fill..like 3 or 4 times. I serious had tell them no more. 

Excellent experience.
author: Scott M.

description:
It's not like me to too often give 5 star reviews for a restaurant, but this place was amazing! Quaint little establishment seating approximately 30 people. The staff was top notch, the atmosphere perfect, and the food.... Oh my god the food. Risotto with white and black truffles - fantastic!  Tiramisu was to die for!  But if that wasn't enough, 10+ glasses of complimentary port and complimentary biscotti!

In one word: AMAZING!

Being from Boston, I have not experienced a dinning experience such as this in North End! Highly recommend this place!

Things to watch out for:
- Parking, there is none. Take a cab.
- Make reservations at least 2 hours in advanced.
- Consider that it will take 30 - 45 minutes to get a cab in this city.

CIAO!
author: Pete N.

description:
Best Italian restaurant i've gone to in the city so far.  The restaurant was very willing to take reservations on a weeknight for 4 people.  They were willing to help me find parking across the street, which was an unexpected surprise.  The food was absolutely amazing and the service was top notch.  

Though I haven't gone to too many italian restaurants i can recommend in SF, but this place is definitely legit and I would recommend it to anybody.
author: Michael C.

description:
The only negative thing that I could possibly say is that parking in the area is terrible. If you are considering driving I would look for other options if you don't want to drive around for a while looking for a spot. The restaurant itself - Fantastic! This has to be one of the most underrated restaurants in the city and just became one of my favorites. I am going to become a regular here and take out-of-town guests here for sure.

We came in a party of five for my father-in-laws birthday and right off the bat we were greeted by the owner/chef and his great staff. The people here really make you feel at home; actually as a guest in their home. I think the reviews complaining about service or the overbearing owner is from people that like to be left alone and eat with their heads down or have no experience with cultures outside of the US. The owner walks around and jokes with people and the staff is attentive and friendly. The ladies at the table loved being addressed as bella. From start to finish we were there about three hours and never once felt rushed to leave. We actually were encouraged to stay longer even though the restaurant was almost full all evening.

As for the food, it was a large selection of better-than-average Italian fare. Everything tasted very authentic and reminded me of when I was in Italy. The prices are also extremely reasonable for the quality and portion size.

If you are looking for a restaurant where you can sit, eat and leave this is probably not the place for you. If you want a memorable dining experience with great food this is the place.
author: Frank J.

description:
Wow! This is an Italian restaurant run by an effervescent Romano named Lorenzo who makes you feel like you are his personal friend $ houseguest. We absolutely enjoyed our meal - Mediterranean sea bass, Fetticini al Fredo, spinach and mushroom side and the chocolate crusted gelato.

I am ambivalent to praise this place any more than I am right here or I/we may have a harder time getting a table ourselves. 

A true neighborhood trattoria that is a gem for Nob Hill/Russian Hill with even a bit if secret parking. 

Kudos to my partner for even noticing it!!
author: Enrico P.

description:
Quite frankly I'm just disappointed. 
A summary of my unfortunate experience is as follows; I had some family coming from out of the country (always a stressful time), and a family friend had recommended this place, so my family couldn't wait to try it out. I had called early in August to make a reservation for early September. I work restaurant hours, so I wasn't able to call when the restaurant was open. I left a concise message with my name, phone number, and reservation details, asking to be called back to confirm whether or not the time I had requested was available (their message machine said it was okay to do so, or else I would have arranged to call when I knew they would be open). I waited till the last week of August, thinking they may call me back closer to the time the reservation was made to confirm. Long story short I called back twice, each time leaving a message asking to be called back at said number about said reservation - nothing. So I felt suspicious and called when they were supposed to be open, first time no answer, second time, no answer again. Third time was the charm I suppose, a gentleman answered the phone, told me there was no information about my reservation. Moreover they had a wedding planned that exact evening, he went on to tell me the time they would be in, for how many people, that the reservation was made in March and so on.

This would have all been fine, I would have asked if there was anything available for Saturday or Sunday in that case, but the tone I was spoken to in was so completely and absolutely degrading I was truly shocked. He had an "Oh well, this your fault not mine, attitude", and I wasn't even offered and "Oh, I'm so sorry unfortunately we have had a wedding planned for that evening" related sentence.

All in all, we will not be enjoying the apparently amazing food at this restaurant, and further we never will. A place that doesn't know the basics of customer service doesn't deserve my patronage when there are copious amounts of amazing struggling restaurants in the city.
author: Angelika M.

description:
Allegro Romano was highly recommended by my sister-in-law! I decided to make reservations here for my boyfriend's recent birthday. This place is very small, reservations are highly recommended. The food was delicious and very flavorful.

Some of the dishes we ordered included:

- Lobster Ravioli 
- Scallop Risotto w/Black Calamari Ink
- Wild Boar Fettuccine

All were amazing! I am not a fan of calamari ink, but the risotto was to scrumptious. I would definitely come back here again. The service was great and they were very prompt when it came to our needs.

This is a cute date place or just a small intimate dinner! Be sure to make reservations! Also, parking is not the best in the area, so give yourself some extra time :)
author: LilyAnn N.

description: Definitely more date night than business dinner.  Overall very good food quality though my Branzino was a bit fishy tasting and somewhat overcooked. The Tiramisu was excellent - light and delicious.
author: Patricia S.

description:
I have nothing good to say about this place.

I live on the same street of the restaurant and I see how the owner and his staff treat the local area.  The owner is not genuinely friendly.  He will only barely muster up a smile if he knows he is going to make a lot of money off you.  

I went there recently with my husband and brother in law.  We spent about $250 for the three of us.  The wine was pretty good and the food was a grade B.  The sparkling wine they serve before the meal (complimentary) tasted cheap and it gave me a headache.

The main waiter (tall with black slicked back hair) is totally disgusting and when I was getting up from my table, my husband turned to talk to my brother-in-law and the waiter literally tried to kiss me - about one inch from my mouth.  It was not a typical European kiss although he disguised it as such.  He was totally staring at me the whole time he was waiting on me and I was really uncomfortable.  I live in the neighborhood and he always cat-calls to me when I'm walking by the street and says perverted things to me.  It is brazen and shameless how he carries himself.  I cannot believe the owner would tolerate that waiter as an image of his restaurant. 

I think it's really silly and embarrassing the way the owner puts pictures of himself and celebrities on the front window.  It really is not classy.  If celebrities or wealthy people visit your restaurant, then the classy thing to do would be to not advertise that.  Plus, they are not even on real photo paper - just on cheap paper.  It looks trashy to me.

Lastly, parking in this neighborhood is really hard.  Many of us come home from work and have to search for 15-30 minutes.  This restaurant owner has him and his friends motorcycles parked sideways to take up parking spots for their guests.  Then they move the motorcycles out so that restaurant guests can take up neighborhood parking.  It is so rude and disrespectful of the neighborhood that you have your business in.  Stop being so CHEAP and go to the city and pay the city to zone the area outside of your restaurant so you can have commercially permitted parking there.
author: Chloe V.

description: This is seriously good Italian.The bruschetta is good, but the fettuccine with white truffle sauce...add chicken and call it amazing. The tiramisu is to die for. If you feel like ice-cream, you cannot go wrong with the the tartuffo. Lorenzo is so friendly and so is everyone else that works there. I just love this place. Can't wait to experience Tre Scalini in Italy!
author: Sawsan D.

description: Top rate restaurant . Made our reservations from NY. Food,service were excellent. Best food we had in Frisco . Hard to get reservations.
author: Howard P.

description:
I don't have anything bad to say about this place or my experience.

My husband ordered the Ribeye, which was cooked to perfection. The roast potatoes that went with it were amazing and had much more flavor than the roast potatoes I've had in the past. 

I had the Lobster Ravioli, I couldn't decide between that or the Scallops but the ravioli was amazing. 

We also had the bruschetta, the tiramisu, key lime pie, and the Chianti. All were equally delicious. The service was amazing, probably the best service I have had in SF, they had our food ready right away filled our coffee cups and water glasses quickly. Our server was excellent very professional but also had a personality. 

They also gave us a complimentary glass of port and a complimentary dessert which was also delicious. I can't say more about how fabulous it was. At the end of the night the hostess brought me a rose to take home.

I'm so happy we live right around the corner so we can go back again!

If you're coming to town I would definitely suggest giving Allegro Romano a try!
author: Meghan A.

description:
Thank you, yelp, for introducing me to my new go-to Italian restaurant!  

I found Allegro Romano because my boyfriend and I had a massive craving for lobster ravioli, (which, if you've ever been to Rino's Place in East  Boston, you know exactly why this would be the case).  Based on reviews, Allegro seemed the most promising.  So, off we went on our Wed. night date.  

We walked in around 8 pm to an almost full, dimly lit, quaint space.  The first thing I noticed were the rose petals on each table and I thought, damn, we should have made a reservation because they're obviously having some sort of special event.  Fortunately, this was not actually the case.  We were greeted by ebullient flower arrangements, a bustling staff, and the very colorfully dressed Miami-esque, (Lincoln Rd., anyone?) owner, Lorenzo.  

Here's what we ordered: a carafe of the house Sangiovese (which was really decent and I am not typically a fan), the porcini mushroom over soft polenta appetizer special (3 stars), caesar salad w/ dungeness crab (4.5 stars), fettucine bolognese (3 stars), and of course, lobster ravioli (4 stars*).  

* I'm a New England girl.  I know my lobstah.  The ravioli's themselves were perfectly cooked, but could be meatier.  The flavor of the lobster was lost in the sauce, which is not necessarily a bad thing.  According to my bf, the sauce "is like liquid crack.  It's like ice cream."  I completely agree.  We slurped up every last bit. 
  
What we got was 2 rounds of yummy, garlicky bruschetta prior to our appetizers, bread w/ red pepper eggplant dip, the meal we ordered, 2 dessert plates with fruit, biscotti, and whipped cream, (because we didn't order an actual dessert), and bottomless port.  

I'm not sure if it was simply the 2nd glass of wine, the cheese of the glass motif/celebrity photos decor, the ongoing joke that our waters never got below an inch of the rim, (or for that matter our wine from the spot of the initial pour), or the farce of the endless complimentary add ons to our meal, but at some point we started laughing and didn't stop.  

The staff is INCREDIBLE.  What was lacking in certain dishes was more than made up for by the impeccable service and hospitality.  The mood is infectious.  I loved every minute of it and can't wait to go back for more.
author: Ashley Y.

description: This is hands down the BEST Italian food I've had in the Bay Area.  Moving from Boston where we have some of the best Italian food in the country (also Providence, RI), I was disappointed with a lot of the other places.  Allegro Romano was the best.  Made a res on OpenTable, we were a little early but we were able to sit right away.  The restaurant itself is small but beautiful.  The food was great.  We tried the caprese salad (I've had better on the East Coast but still very good), asparagus (amazing!!!) and arugula salad (delicious!!) to start.  For entrees, two of us (myself included) ordered the scallopini which was really delicious.  My fiancee got the bolognese which was fantastic - not too acidic and the pasta was cooked just right.  My father ordered a special entree which was Maine lobster with clams in red sauce.  He and his girlfriend both said the lobster was overcooked, but again, we are snobs from New England when it comes to seafood!  For the record, he cleaned his plate!!  Also - our waitress told us that we could order half-orders of pasta, so we all tried the pesto tortellini.  This was hands down the best thing on the menu!  The pesto was creamy and fresh, and the tortellini were cooked beautifully.  We finished dessert with espressos and tiramisu.  The dessert was very good but not the best tiramisu I've had (it had a little too much cocoa for me).  The espresso was delicious.  They did not offer sugar in the raw (which i usually drink with espresso), so I drank it black and it was good!  The service was exceptional also.  The one "downside" would be that after our coffee & dessert it took a really long time (like 20 minutes) to get the check.  It was a particularly warm evening in SF and the restaurant became very warm, so it would've been nice to get the check and leave sooner.  BEST PART of the meal was about halfway through dinner they flicked the lights on and off and played "That's Amore"  - everyone sang along and the manager/host character came around and clicked everyones' wine glasses.  They also gave out red roses to all of the ladies in the restaurant.  Overall, a wonderful experience and i would recommend to anyone looking for Italian food in SF!
author: Caroline C.

description: Went with my BF last night - fantastic truly Italian food, with a great host (Lorenzo) and a phenomenal wine selection. Will DEFINITELY recommend to my friends. There's a reason why everyone who is who eats here. Delicious!
author: Janelle A.

description:
*Food - YUMS! - We ordered an appetizer "package"-like deal that allowed us to get tastes of almost all of the appetizers. SOo good.  For my main course I had the lobster ravioli and it was amazing.  I think there was only one of us who wasn't 100% happy with his food, but he didn't dislike it either.

*Service - Super nice, fun, goofy staff.  How nice were they?  One person in our party thought they were almost TOO nice, haha.  Definitely made the experience more than just an average dinner out.  Just an example of how much above and beyond they go for their customers:  2/4 of our party came into the restaurant and explained that the other two were looking for parking.  They told us that one of the waiters would be happy to move his motorcycle that was parked right out front so that we could have his spot.  How amazing is that?!  

*Atmosphere - Cozy, intimate, and warm.  Although they don't have a lot of space, I think that's part of their charm.  

I will definitely be going back to Allegro Romano at some point, and I'd recommend it to anyone else!
author: Kelley B.

description: Great little place. Not pretentious, nice staff, and food was solid. Had carpaccio, capresse, white truffle pasta (special), lobster ravioli, and monk fish risotto. Tirramisu and cheesecake for dessert. All good and reasonably priced. Will be going back.
author: Cameron B.

description: Typical, overpriced, overrated, unimaginative italian restaurant.  Russian hill has some amazing restaurants. But Allegro romano is not one of them.
author: amit s.

description:
Where to start...

My boyfriend and I came for a nice dinner before a night out. We came in around 7:30, and the cozy spot was already busy. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly throughout the night- checking in and then leaving us to enjoy. 

I had the caprese salad and black truffle risotto, and my boyfriend had the melon with prosciutto and truffle ravioli. Everything was perfect. Ingredients perfectly fresh, creamy flavorful sauces, yet nothing overpowered the truffle. 

After the hostess called our cab, our waiter brought by a few glasses of port. We spoke a few minutes, everyone here is great!
author: Victoria H.

description:
Not worth the walk at all. The food was not fresh, just another tourist trap with illusions of grandeur. My 7 year old daughter & I wanted to eat Italian food after touring the city and decide on this place after reading some of the reviews. When we got there, we're greeted with the usual "do you have reservation" but with a grimace face. (That was clue number #1 to leave). 10 to11 tables in this place and only 1 was occupied. (Clue #2 to leave). The hosted seated us & took our order. The waiter in the restaurant wouldn't even come out of the office to inform us of the specials. We heard them being recite to another group of people which is when he came out of us office.

The lobster ravioli (which my daughter had) tasted like it was frozen and the a la vodka sauce was too heavy and a bit on the cold side. My pesto tortellini was overly dipped in thick heavy pesto sauce to hide the old frozen taste which made me sick hours later that evening.

By the time we left only 2 other patrons had arrived, so the place was never full. I usually tip 20 - 25% but the place and service we received only warranted 10%.
author: Denise S.

description: Wonderful place for a nice meal. Food was absolutely delicious and I stuffed myself silly. Staff is attentive and very nice and accommodating . Place has a great ambience to it! My new favorite spot!
author: Fred L.

description: The black truffle risotto and lobster ravioli with vodka sauce are to die for. Absolutely wonderful service- the servers go above and beyond to make a wonderful experience. I will be back for more of that risotto!!!
author: Steph P.

description: Absolutely the best Italian food I've had in the bay area, along with excellent service. The manager and all the servers are Italian, super friendly and passionate about the food. We started with an asparagus truffle soup and caprese salad, both were delicious. What stood out for me was the entree- fetuccine with white truffle sauce. The owner came by and shaved a generous portion of black truffle on my pasta. Everything about the dish was to die for- the homemade pasta, creamy sauce, and the truffle shavings on top of everything. I am salivating just thinking about it.
author: Peggy L.

description:
I've been wanting to try out this place for a while, and I'm really glad I waited all the way until Valentine's Day. This is going to be a pretty long review since I had such an amazing experience.

My boyfriend and I ended up coming 30 minutes late for our reservations due to the crazy Valentine's Day + rush hour traffic. When we finally got there, we parked at some random spot just so we could check in before losing our reservations. Upon walking in, the owner didn't seem impatient at all despite us calling every ten minutes to tell him we would be taking a bit longer. He gave us a very warm greeting while walking us over to our table lined with rose petals and candles. My boyfriend was about to order first and go find a different parking spot while we waited for our food, but the owner overheard our situation and told him to just go get his car and he'll give him a place to park right in front. 

The restaurant itself was very intimate since there were only 20 or so seats. There was a special Valentine's Day menu and we ended up ordering two appetizers (the carpaccio and the caesar salad with dungeness crab), the lobster ravioli for each of us, and the tiramisu. I felt like the cheese was a bit sharp and detracted from the taste of the carpaccio a bit, but it was still good nonetheless. The caesar salad was pretty good and had a lot more crab meat than I was expecting. They took the courtesy of splitting up the salad into two dishes for us without having to ask, and even so each of our dishes were still generously sized. The lobster ravioli stole the show and my boyfriend probably mentioned how much he liked the sauce at least 10 times. We noticed that the tables around us were getting biscotti on the house for dessert but we decided to go ahead and order their famous tiramisu. The tiramisu was rich and creamy and did not disappoint. The bill came out to $90 for everything, which was a pretty good price considering we each essentially had a four course meal.

Honestly, I probably would have rated the food itself 4 stars, but I can't help but give them a 5 since they have the best service I have ever seen. Our water never even got to the halfway point because they were so quick at refilling everything. The second our bread was gone, they would go get us more. I noticed that the servers went around to all the tables and would often crack jokes as if they've been friends with the guests for a long time. The owner himself came around the entire time to talk to the patrons and to check if everyone was happy. The couple next to us was talking to one of the servers about their last visit and he told them he remembered them, where they sat, and even how their table was arranged. There was a proposal while we were in the restaurant and every single person in the restaurant clapped when the owner announced that the girl said yes. They ended up flickering the lights above the couple a few times and then played a few upbeat Italian love songs for them. The couple got up to dance and the owner encouraged all of the other couples to do so as well. The icing on the cake was when the servers gave every girl a rose as they were getting ready to leave. On top of that, they moved the entire table so that the guests sitting on the inside could get out easier. When my boyfriend and I walked out of the restaurant at the end of the night, the owner personally came outside to shake my boyfriend's hand, kiss my hand, and thank us for coming. I definitely felt like I was a part of a big happy family the entire night.

I noticed that there was no one there to take up the empty seats as people were leaving. However, the servers were getting the empty tables ready anyway. They probably knew that people want to take their time and enjoy themselves on Valentine's Day so they spaced out the reservations in two waves.
author: Anne L.

description: Amazing experience! The food was phenomenal! Amazing steak, amazing pasta, amazing dessert. The owner was so fun and made our friend's 30th birthday such a wonderful experience! Will definitely be back the next time we come to San Fran! A must!
author: Meagan S.

description: I remember having a wonderful time here about a year ago, so I decided to come back and make a reservation. I left a message on their voicemail and followed it up with an email (after two days of not hearing back from them) still no response. If they did not have anything available, the LEAST they could do was to call me back and say so. I will never come back again, especially since it's an establishment that does not recognize that customer service is not limited at their physical site, when the check is about to be handed to the customer.
author: Jonsey B.

description: Off the beaten path. Small, noisy and delicious. The food was amazing. Menu had much to please any palate. Nice to be away from the touristy restaurants and be right smack in the middle of a neighborhood. I would definitely suggest a visit while in the San Fran area.
author: Roe F.

description: The best service I've ever experienced combined with amazing food!  The staff created the most memorable dining experience I've ever had. Didn't realize reservations were required or that there were only two seatings, but walked in in between seatings and got a table due to cancellations/no shows. The staff treated us like royalty with the utmost professionalism and fun. The added touches like a rose for every woman at the end of the meal were touching. With three waiters to this small restaurant they teamed to ensure not a single thing was missed at any table. Despite there being a large group, our food came out timely and hot, not effected at all by the larger order. Fresh rose petals on the tables and the superb service made for an incredibly romantic (and entertaining) evening.  Our cheeks hurt from smiling by the end of our experience. Seriously...best dining experience ever!
author: J B.

description: If Allegro means "happy" and "cheerful" in Italian, then the sign is on the WRONG restaurant!! Read the Yelp reviews CAREFULLY before stepping foot in this restaurant! There seems to be a common theme with LOST reservations and a RUDE Lorenzo (owner/manager/chef). Our experience matched many other Yelpers who have been disappointed. Suffice it to say, I would never recommend or set foot in this restaurant again. We have had so many incredible dining experience in the lovely city of SF. Why patronize a place that treats the customers so poorly?! Eek! Me thinks not!!
author: P W.

description: This is the best Italian food in San Francisco. This or Albona. Excellent food. Make early reservation
author: Christian D.

description:
Had dinner here with a few friends last weekend and we had a great experience.

Had reservations for 7:45 and they were ready for us, no waiting. 

It's a cool, quaint atmosphere in a nice neighborhood. The wait staff were very friendly and funny. Definitely a very pleasant experience.

Appetizers were delicious and I had the Rigatoni (which is Willy Browns favorite dish apparently). Everyone thoroughly enjoyed the food.

Ordered a bottle of wine, friend tasted it, they decanted it, friend changed his mind and Lorenzo was VERY gracious and understanding when we ordered another different bottle. It was actually not a corked bottle, my friend just didn't like it. Once it has been decanted, I figure the restaurant has no obligation to bring another bottle out since we tasted it and gave them the thumbs up. Amazing customer service.

Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a nice, friendly, neighborhood restaurant with kick ass food.
author: Rob H.

description:
Wow, I hope to keep this my little secret... but I am so nice to share! This place is amazing. I'll continue to go here with friends, family, big groups or small. A romantic success is how I'd describe this quaint Russian Hill neighborhood Restaurant. The food is delicious, the ambiance is serene and Lorenzo is my new best friend.

As a guest you'll feel well taken care of. Each table looks like it is set up for a special occasion, which is how it should be every time you eat out.  

We filled our tummies with the most delicious sea bass and fillet mignon. Mmmm... And they wont let you leave without tasting at least one or every dessert they have on the menu.

The portions are plentiful and the price's are unbelievably amazing for the service and food your receive.
author: Dee C.

description:
This place is fantastic. A+ for food & service. 

Make a reservation, especially if it's a weekend. We called Friday afternoon for a Saturday res and they were all booked up, LUCKY for us, they had a table for that night! We got there on time and they sat us in about ten minutes.

All our food was absolutely delicious. One of the highlights was the black truffle risotto special. The white truffle fettuccine was also to die for. My friend ordered the Rigatoni all'Amatriciana, which was recommended by the waiter. It was good, but definitely not as delicious as everything else. We flagged down our waiter and she politely told him there was nothing wrong with the food, she just wasn't crazy about it. He joked that he was hurt that she didn't like his favorite and brought something else for her right away. I mean, that is GREAT service!! There is nothing wrong with the food and they just want you to be happy so they bring you something else anyways!! Love this place. 

Definitely worth going and I hope to go back next time I'm in the area. My only one tiiiiiiiny gripe would be that the decor is a tad outdated, but it actually kind of works for this charming and yummy Italian restaurant.
author: j j.

description:
AMAZING.

Service was top notch--I celebrated my birthday here last night and they made the meal so special. They put flower petals/confetti on the table and gave us awesome bruschetta, biscotti and port on the house--what a treat! 

Their fettuccine with white truffle sauce is quite possibly my FAVORITE pasta in the city now. The sauce wasn't overly truffle--just a hint so it didn't make me tired of the taste. Went very well with a glass of pinot.

Lobster ravioli was awesome too, with big chunks of lobster meat in the stuffing. At first I thought they also tossed the pasta with lobster but it ended up being pieces of tomato, haha. The pink vodka sauce was so great we used our bread to wipe the bread clean....no shame!

Homemade tiramisu was light and sweet, a perfect end to our meal. My only complaint was that the mushrooms trifolat appetizer was a little bit of a disappointment...probably something I could have made at home. Next time I'll get the crab caesar salad instead. 

Definitely recommend. Trotting up those massive hills up to the restaurant makes this meal all the more worth it!
author: Stefi C.

description:
I went here on a moment's notice with my fiance one night (we live down the road) and we were swept off our feet.

The service is just outstanding. It's so intimate in there and they are staffed by the hardest working, friendliest guys in the industry. Their wine selection is pretty awesome --I love Borolo.

I believe I had pasta with the white truffle sauce the first time we went there, and my girl had the catch of the day, which I believe was swordfish? In either event, they are super attentive, give you lots of well prepared and delicious food and will even give roses to the women sometimes. 

Jacket not required, but highly respected by owner and staff (who by the way will take it off your hands and hang 'er up.

Heavy pours on the wine and extra biscotti if they like you :-)
author: Tim L.

description: This is as good as it gets! I am was born and raised on the East coast. I am from an Italian family and sharing Italian food was what glued my family together. When I moved to the West  coast 7 years ago, specifically the state of Washington I went through total food withdrawal. I just couldn't find good Italian food like back in Jersey until one day my husband and I found the restaurant Allegro Romano in San Francisco. It was like being home! I can't say enough about this restaurant, staff, and the wonderful owner. If you really want a taste of some of the best Italian food on the West coast you need to try this restaurant.
author: Caroline S.

description: Couldn't find reservation but made it up in service and delious food
author: Diane B.

description:
I read some of the other reviews before writing this. I like attentive waiters; maybe some people do not? Everyone is different! 

I've only been here one time, but I had a really positive experience and would recommend it to anyone. I remember thinking the food was great, the atmosphere cute and fun, and the service excellent.
author: Chloe M.

description:
It's a very small restaurant, but the level of customer service and food were fantastic. The Italian waiters had a great sense of humor, and someone (either the owner, waiter, bus boy, or hostess) was checking on us regularly. Our waiter even bought us roses and a brought over a bruchetta dish to try for free. At the end of the meal, the hostess stopped by to see if we wanted her to call us a cab. We didn't even have to ask! 

Out of everything that I tried, I enjoyed the hand-made tortellini the best. I would definitely go back again!
author: Jenna K.

description: Very rude and unprofessional,made a reservation and when we got there they told us they can't serve us because we did not make reservations they were rude
author: Soraya H.

description:
After many years of wanting to go here, we finally went on a Wednesday night. It was super crowded, the owner (I think) is super cheesy, the decor is hard to place.  Its early 90's/egyptian/moms craft den.  There are roses and party confetti strewn about on your table, I ended up eating a piece or two by the end of the night.

The food is okay, not any better than Trattoria Contadina or Tomasso's.  Where they win, is the service with personality and the quaint location.  After we declined dessert, they brought us a little something anyways.  Then, proceeded to pour us never ending glasses of port.  This is what made our just ok meal memorable.  I'd give it another try if someone twisted my arm.
author: jessica b.

description: Best Italian we have had. The Owner, Lorenzo is a hoot! The tables are quaint. Melt in your mouth good. The staff was amazing. Very funny, professional, and helpful. Loved the food!! Best Risotto I have ever had. Best Bruschetta my wife has had including In Italy! Talked with others in the restaurant from all over the world. Great time. Fun entertaining and great food!!!
author: Graham Y.

description: Please understand that this rating has nothing to do with the food. But if good service and honest workers are important to you, then read this. I was in San Fran for a weekend and called Allegro Romano for a reservation. The gentlemen who answered the phone said they only had a 6 o'clock reservation left. I told him I would take it. We broke our necks getting to that restaurant on time. When we got there, there was a line. He seated everyone that was in line. Then when it was my turn, I told him I had 6:00 reservations and gave him my name. He said one minute and left. I recognized his distinct voice and knew it was the gentleman I had spoken to on the phone. He came back and said, "I don't know who you spoke to but I can't find your reservation." Now, I am looking at the book and my name is written clearly on the book. So, I said, "you took the reservation and my name is written right there!!" And then he said, "well someone gave your reservation away." So I said "I thought you couldn't find my reservation." Then he said, "it's first come first serve." So I said, are you kidding me? "Then why did you give me a reservation?" He told me I would have to go somewhere else. I could go to his other property. I don't care who you are. I don't care if your food tastes like heaven on a plate. YOU DON'T LIE!!! What happen to accepting responsibility, apologizing, and maybe comping an appetizer for the mistake or something. What is wrong with people????
