author: Tammy G.

description: This place is amazing. I dream about it often, the white truffle fettuccine, the fish, the wine...simply the best meal I've ever had. We stayed at the restaurant for 2 hours never feeling rushed or hustled to pay the bill. The owner truly loves what does and it shows. Great place to celebrate an anniversary or date night. I wish I could eat here every week, but I'd like to keep my girlish figure! :) oh and the rose at the end of the night, great touch! see you in my dreams white truffles...
author: Casey H.

description: Excellent service! We went a little earlier than normal(5:30) and had the place to ourselves. We had a ton of appetizers which were all delicious. I had the bolognase and it was very good. For dessert we had the chocolate gelato and it was excellent.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Went there on Saturday at 5:30 without a reservation.  Knew it was chancey, but thought why not try.  Walked in to a completely empty restaurant and was told, and I quote, "We're packed."  No "I'm sorry" or "please call first for a reservation next time" no nothing.  No warmth. No hospitality.  Might as well have said "get the f--k out!"  Real neighborly.  Just "We're packed."  I looked around at the empty tables, shrugged and said "I sure hope so for your sake" and walked out. 
It was reminiscent of the last time we were there -- the restaurant was empty, we were given the worst table in the corner, and the next people to arrive were slotted in right next to us even though every other table in the restaurant was wide open.  Very uncomfortable.  Very stupid.  Of me.  To think it wouild be any more inviting the second time around.  Never again.
author: Debra S.

description: There's nothing that I can add that hasn't already been said. Perfection from the service to the food. My wife didn't want the mashed potato side so they said "we can replace it with whatever you want." She suggested asparagus which weren't on the menu and they came out grilled and delicious. Perfect evening
author: Brendan M.

description:
While staying in Nob Hill for our anniversary, my husband and I made a reservation here because of the proximity to where we were staying (and the great Yelp reviews). It definitely lived up to the reviews.
The small dining room is perfect for a romantic dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful. And the food was excellent: I had a squid ink risotto that was amazing; my husband had the lobster ravioli which was also great.
Perfect place to go for excellent Italian food in a romantic setting.
author: Alicia R.

description:
I've eaten here so many times over the last eight years. Every time, and I mean EVERY time, it is spectacular. 

We took a group of 15 out-of-towners here this past week and every single person was thrilled with the food...best bruschetta I've ever had, truffle risotto that blows your mind, exquisite tiramisu. The service was outstanding, and Lorenzo even made a special birthday toast for our friend who was turning 75. 

This is the best Italian food I've found in SF. Enjoy!
author: M R.

description:
The food I would rate 4 stars, but I must must must give an extra billion stars for the service. My aunt was in town so my parents and I decided to take her out to Italian food. I had my eye on Allegro Romano for a few weeks so we decided to give it a try.  I had made a reservation ahead of time and we arrived just in time. The table was ready, scattered with rose petals, and neatly set up. We waited about 15 minutes for my father and he STILL hadn't found a parking. The owner, bless his soul, offered to move his motorcycle across the street so he could get a parking! Talk about consideration for one's customers. No restaurant has ever done that for us, and we were extremely impressed and eternally grateful. In addition, there was a proposal that night! We witnessed the last part of it and there was definitely a huge congratulation for the couple. A very great start to a dinner.

We ordered bruschetta and crepes with salmon and caviar as appetizers. Both were pleasing, but the crepes were the clear winner. The bruschetta was tasty but slightly soggy, as if it had been sitting on the counter for a while. I prefer it when it is still crisp and crunchy. For main entrees, I ordered Willie's Brown Favorite, my mother ordered the linguine with olive oil/garlic and fresh halibut, my father ordered the filet mignon, and my aunt ordered the special which was baby shark. I enjoyed mine though I secretly thought to myself that I could make something similar at home. My mother's order was my favorite - the olive oil/garlic had a kick to it and it was spicy! Absolutely amazing. My father's filet mignon was overcooked for my taste (he ordered medium when you should ALWAYS order medium rare or rare!) but still very tasty. My aunt's baby shark (tears running down my face) was similar in consistency with ahi tuna. Good, but nothing spectacular. Again, tears run down my face when I think of the poor baby shark ): The food was solid, but nothing truly amazing that would make me race back here any time soon. We skipped dessert, but they offered us complimentary biscotti.

The service was stupendous. They did not rush us or made us feel like we had to leave. They conversed and threw jokes with us without doing so overwhelmingly. Our waiter did abandon us at random times but that was because he was congratulating ANOTHER couple on their proposal! TWO PROPOSALS in one night! 

Altogether, good food (not amazing), amazing service, romantic/cozy ambiance. A well deserved 5 stars!
author: Hannah L.

description:
I had hoped Allegro Romano would be the neighborhood Italian gem we've been looking for but I was left wondering what all the Yelp hype was about.

Don't get me wrong: Lorenzo and the servers are very personable, and the space and location definitely have charm.  But the food?  Boring and not well-executed.  (One exception: The pasta was delicious.)  We were disappointed with the appetizer, two meat entrees, and the dessert.   

Also, we felt rushed by the staff at the end of our meal.  We purposely made an 8PM reservation so we could take our time over a four course meal with wine and coffee and not worry that the staff needed to turn the table after us.  However, we couldn't help but feel like they wanted us out by 10PM.  One of the servers attempted to clear our dessert before we were finished, and soon after that, a rose and the check appeared on our table.  (We were still eating dessert and at least two other tables were still occupied.)  Next, our coats were brought over to the chairs next to us.  Granted, they were gracious at each step and apologetic when we finally frankly asked if they needed us to leave, but still... not the note on which anyone would like to end a meal.
author: Kelly C.

description: Good ambiance and amazing staff. The truffle risotto was delicious, however our fish was mediocre (at best) and still had many bones left in. Overall, I would go back again but not as frequently as other restaurants in the city.
author: Eric H.

description: Stumbled upon this place via yelp.  Read that reservations are a must, so I called around 3pm to try and get a table for that evening (saturday night).  We got the last open reservation, at 5:45.  The dining area is small and intimate, classy.  The owner/manager greeted us and checked on us 2 more times during our meal.  The servers were extremely nice as well.  Complimentary bread and a red sauce for the table.  My husband and I shared the caprese salad which was fresh and delicious.  I had the veal with porcini mushrooms and my husband had a pasta with pancetta and tomatoes.  Veal was delicious, he agreed it was better than his pasta.  We finished with tartufo for dessert which was incredible.  We both come from north jersey and appreciate good italian food, this hit the spot!
author: Meaghan P.

description: This restaurant is INCREDIBLE. A rare gem in a city filled with amazing food, Allegro Romano combines incredibly warm service with extremely tasty food. The atmosphere is cozy and familial and the meal is rejuvenating. Thanks, Lorenzo. I'll be back.
author: Justin M.

description:
This place is fun, delicious and the owner and staff are a riot!  Went with my girlfriends and we had an awesome time with fantastic food and a very   upbeat atmosphere.  We had appetizers of asparagus, crab caesar, and the beef carpaccio(YUM!).  We had entrees of Lobster ravioli, White Truffle Tortellini with basil pesto(amazing) , Fettuccine with Wild Boar Bolognese(a true house specialty) and Sauteed Chicken Breast (tender and juicy)  We tasted each others dishes, and for me, the Tortellini won for the best entree, although each meal was delicious.

For dessert we shared a key lime tart and the ice cream rolled in chocolate pieces(forgot what it was called) and since it was a birthday, we were treated to some homemade tiramisu.  The desserts were also very good.

You will leave with a smile on your face!!
author: Michelle B.

description: Stumbled upon this while walking my dog and just had that instant feeling that it was going to be a great place when I saw it. I came back with a friend and we had a pleasant time. I was shocked by the low prices. The portions are generous and the food was delectable (I had the tortellini and bruschetta). The service we had was also phenomenal. Our server was very attentive to our needs and made sure we were well cared for- scraping crumbs off the table, refilling glasses, etc. Previous SF Mayor, Willie Brown, was even dining next to us with friends. The whole place is very cozy, friendly, and a great spot to bring a date!
author: Sara D.

description:
My husband refers to me as a "meatball snob" because as an Italian, I am incredibly picky about going out for Italian food.  It's usually just a disappointment--but not this place.  We wanted to go somewhere special for our anniversary, and my boss recommended this gem.  Everything was top-notch, from the food to the wine to the service, and truly felt like good, home, Italian cooking!

We have since been back for a celebratory dinner with friends, and a company party that topped the charts--you'll no doubt feel right at home in the intimate setting, especially when That's Amore starts to play!  I would highly recommend Allegro Romano to anyone looking for some good, authentic Italian cuisine and a memorable evening.
author: Jamie B.

description: Great little place with a fantastic vibe and a very cheerful owner. I'll be back next time for sure
author: Ben D.

description:
We lucked out making reservations a couple of hours ahead of time, and I'm glad we did. A tight space that works for the restaurant works for the customer with highly attentive service. 

The atmosphere was romantic Valentines day which was great for us who were, in fact, trying to have date night in a new city. For a regular night Italian craving, perhaps I'd leave Allegro to the lovebirds.

At our server's recommendation we started with the porcini mushrooms atop polenta. One thing I love about being closer to agricultural sectors is an appreciation for what is in season. The mushrooms were so rich and decadent, no long term storage there. The fresh parsley added a beautiful lemon flavor to the Rigatoni Amatriciana. 

And it was worth the wait. I asked for recommended wine pairings for the Amatriciana and enjoyed a beautiful Sangiovese. I haven't had this dish but once since in Rome and it lived up to my salivating memories. 

Franky N went with the lobster ravioli which was delightful. When I couldn't take any more, they suggested dessert. Why the hell not, I'll walk it off on the way home. Glad I did; the Panna Cotta was fluffy, light and not too sweet. The sweetness was taken care of by the servers who insisted on filling my complimentary glass of port every time I took a sip. 

Bad influence they are. 

To complete the evening of great service, the manager called for a cab to meet us outside. I don't know the area very well, but what seems to be the top of Nob Hill - literally - doesn't seem like a common crossing for taxis.
author: Amanda E.

description:
I never yelp, but after my dinner last night, I must.  This is far and away the best Italian food you will ever eat - even better than any meal I've had in Italy!  The food is amazing.  You cannot leave before you have had the fettuccine with truffle sauce - delicious is an understatement.   

What makes the restaurant, however, is the owner, Lorenzo.  He treats the restaurant and those who come in with such kindness - you always leave feeling as if you were an important VIP.  The waiters are great, truly fun to be around and your water (and wine) glasses, are never empty.  Lorenzo gives you more than a meal - you get an experience that will live in your memory.

I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant.  Every time I come I walk away wondering why I don't eat here every day of my life.  Delicious perfection!
author: Stacy J.

description:
My wife and I go to SF often and try different restaurants.We dined out on Saturday 12/20/13 at about 8 pm. Allegro Romano was absolutely wonderful. We were greeted with a smile and great service throughout our visit. We shared a ceasar salad with crab meat, delicious!!  Our entrees were the Fettuccine with Bolognese and the Lobster Ravioli; both tasted delicious!!!!

We did not order dessert but they gave us some anyway, and some port wine to enjoy it with. Nice touch!! If you are seeking a GREAT Italian Restaurant in SF this is the place!! Allegro's is small but can accomodate small groups. This restaurant is very romantic and out of the way and my wife and I highly recommend it.
author: Steve P.

description: Hands down the best Italian restaurant in SF. Amazing food, and equally great service. Not always available, and not on the menu, but try the black truffle risotto. You won't be disappointed.
author: Pat R.

description:
One of the extremely few authentic Italian places I've found out in California.  The food & the quaint tables just reminded me of the little family-run trattorias you find in Italy. Maybe they'd rather be praised as a ristorante, but the wonderful feeling of family that you get there just reminded much more of a trattoria.

The food, in a word - scrumptious. The staff, especially the owner Lorenzo, were warm & wonderful hosts. 

Port, port, port, port. Roses.

You do lobster ravioli right and you've got me for life.  They did & they do.

Bravo Lorenzo bravo!

To all of you lobotomized clowns out there who give nonsense like Olive Garden, Bucca di Beppo and Pasta Pomodoro more than one star on yelp, please RUN - do not walk - to this place so you can experience a true Italian meal in every sense of the word & experience.
author: Phil K.

description: This restaurant is a gift from the gods! You will love the ambience, the staff and most importantly THE FOOD! It is hands down the best Italian food (make that the best food) I've ever had the pleasure to eat...we were a party of 8 and when I made the reservation (and I highly recommend a reservation) they gave us a time and at the appointed time we were seated...we were pampered by what seemed like the entire staff of the restaurant (including the owner) and knew right away why so many people want to eat here....everyone is treated like a celebrity...when the evening was over they asked if they could call us a taxi and when we walked out of the restaurant there it was...can't wait to go back to San Francisco and Allegro Romano!!!
author: Andy W.

description:
We eat out a lot, in many different major world cities. I don't give a five star rating lightly. 

These folks are creating top quality food, yes, but that only gets you so far. What they are also doing is creating the perfect atmosphere for a lovely romantic dinner. Got a birthday or anniversary dinner? This place is great. 

Tiny dining room, impeccable (OCD) level of service, but still friendly instead of stilted. Great food which is straight up the fairway fancy Italian (not fusion, no atypical complexities) but also not a bunch of red sauce dishes. Beautiful tables, simply decorated with rose petals and wine. 

And, for the wine lovers out there... Good wine list which errs on the affordable side, so you can celebrate even on a budget. Good champagne and port as well. Be sure to save room for the Tartuffe dessert, and for a cheese plate to go with your port. 

Top marks. Thanks, Allegro. You did well by us.
author: Tim F.

description:
I just had a wonderful meal at Allegro Romano. I made a reservation early in the week as I know it would be busy on Friday night. When we arrived, we were seated very promptly by the hostess. When we got to our seats, I was pleasantly surprised to see rose petals on our table.

The restaurant is small, but very cozy and quaint.

To start we ordered the brushetta, and asparagus soup. Both were very good, especially the soup.

For main course, we had the fettuccine with wild boar and porcinni mushrooms, and the lobster ravioli. The fettuccine was delicious, with many layers of flavor, and the pasta was cooked perfectly.

The lobster ravioli was very rich, and tasted very creamy and smooth. The flavor was really good. 

And for dessert, we shared the chocolate gelato, that came with fresh strawberries and biscotti. The presentation was very nice, and was a chocolate lovers dream. It was a perfect dessert to end a great meal.

This is a neighborhood gem, and definitely a place to go to. Service was superb, waitstaff was very friendly, and as a bonus they even gave us a rose at the end of dinner. Also the prices are very reasonable. Will definitely come again!
author: Eddy N.

description:
Another prime example of why I don't trust Yelp.
It was just okay.
Service - 3 stars
Attentive, a little overbearing.  They REALLY push the specials with black truffle.  Even tried to change my order, had to hold my ground and insist that I really didn't want the black truffle.  One of the servers kissed my friend's wife, ON THE MOUTH as we were leaving.  WTF!?
Food - 2 stars
My friend nailed it when he took a bit of the bread and said,"Uh-oh, the bread sucks, we're screwed."
Standouts were the wine, bruschetta and the asparagus appetizer.
Pastas were okay, everything needed a bit more of something- more acid, more spice.
Would not go back.
author: John K.

description:
This little place was recommended to us by the owner's brother, who happened to be our waiter one afternoon in Rome this summer.  We could not have been more impressed!  The service was incredible, the staff was very friendly and the food was great!

They welcomed us with complimentary bruschetta, which was delicious.  Each of our meals was excellent (two types of pasta, a scalloppini and the salmon), as were the appetizer and salads, all accompanied by a pretty nice barbera.  Prices were very reasonable ($16-$22 entrees).  Again, the service throughout dinner was excellent.  Desserts were decent (tiramisu, chocolate tartuffo gelato and key lime pie), as were the espressos.

We were ready for the check and already agreeing that we would definitely return another time when along comes one of the servers with four small glasses, which he proceeded to fill with port on the house.  Then comes a plate of biscotti.  Then, more port.  Then, more biscotti.   Then, more port.  This might have gone on all night if we didn't have to drive back across the bay.

Lorenzo, the owner, had to leave for his other restaurant before we had finished.  I am disappointed I did not get to formally thank him wonderful evening, but we will certainly get another chance very soon.  

One very important tip:  make reservations well in advance.  The place is small, around 10 tables, and was full pretty much the entire time we were there.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I think this is a Great place for a long-relationship-couple.

There are many things I like about the place.
1. Conan O'Brien was here!
The picture is on the wall right by the toilet.
2. The owner guy constantly humming singing corny italian songs very merrily.
3. The waiters were all happy and always checking our table.
4. The steak and the plate were hot.
5. Very clean toilet.
6. The location. Top of the broadway tunnel. What a nice hidden neighborhood here! This is why I like about SF. 
7. Small place but very comfortable seats.
8. Female guests get orange rose before leaving.
9. Gary Danko was here! Twice! It gotto be good.
10. The dipping sauce for bread.

And most of all, such a nice and cosy, low key down to earth place.

The day before we went, my gf call her mother and told her that we are going to Aleegro Romano for dinner. and talking about who has been there before while she was checking the web site. The web site shows numbers of movie stars and politicians visited here and took picture with the owner.
And the menu doesn't say anything about the price.
So, her mother said, "The place must be expensive! You should not be going there."

That sounds like my mother.

We had,
Bruschetta
Gnocchi with Gorgonzola cream and walnut sauce
Filet Mignon with Porchini sauce
Tiramisu
House caraf, $30 was good deal for 2 people.
+tax,
$89 for 2.
I don't think it's expensive.

The menu is all traditional Italian family dinner. It is not fancy high end fusion kind of food.
It's simple, but very traditional authentic Italian.
We had such a nice comfortable dinner. It was really good.
We were there for almost 2 hours but seemed like 20 minutes.
Good time goes fast.
Thank you Allegro Romano for giving us great dinner.
We love to come back.

P.S., j leno and schwarzenegger weren't here yet.
FXXX THEM!
author: Nobu K.

description:
Pure magic. The recent birthday dinner I enjoyed at Allegro Romano was a gift from start to finish. It was a Sunday evening (when they are normally closed) but luckily, the restaurant happened to be open on this night. Magical moment number one. 

We were treated to two delightful glasses of champagne as we waited for our table to be prepared. Magical moment number two. As we settled into our corner cozy booth, Lorenzo (the proprietor) came over with a warm welcome. Earlier, I had mentioned to my boyfriend that I was in the mood for a bottle of Barolo wine with the classic Italian fare. Lorenzo asked us if we would be drinking red or white wine that evening. He produced and decanted a beautiful bottle of Barolo that he insisted on giving us as a gift. Magical moment three. 

The food was sumptuous. Perfect bruschetta, classic Caesar salads heaped with Dungeness crab, tender scaloppini with fresh porcini mushrooms in a Barolo-Port wine reduction sauce, Black Angus filet mignon and an unfathomable version of tiramisu that I absolutely LOVED. I normally won't even touch the stuff. I flat out do not like tiramisu. This version however, was, well - magical. And devoured. 

As we sat beaming in the post-dinner afterglow, marveling at the meal we just had, Lorenzo strolled over once again. With a gracious smile and the delivery of two roses he casually mentioned that this was his mother's birthday too. He then proceeded to pull the proverbial rabbit out of the hat.  "Your dinner is on the house tonight. I wish you a very happy birthday."

Pure magic. Five stunning supernovae.
author: wendella a.

description:
what a great experience.  dining here reminds me of when I used to live in Italy- excellent, friendly service, really delicious food made with fresh ingredients, and an intimate atmosphere.  the service was excellent- we probably had 4 different servers helping us with various aspects of our meal and they were all very friendly, knowledgable and attentive.

we started with the caprese salad which was fresh and really delicious.  adding truffle oil really makes a big difference  for a dish that is driven by natural flavors (and not seasoning).  they also brought us out some brushchetta which was only ok in my opinion.  for dinner, we had the rigatoni with caviar and black truffles and the fettucini with white truffle sauce.  SO RICH, but so delicious.  we were both full before we even got the pastas, but we couldn't stop eating because the food was just so good.  the flavors are well developed and you get a really nice portion of food.  we were too full for dessert, but they still brought us out some biscotti to enjoy and port which was delightful.  im generally not a fan of port, but i could get on board with this port after such a nice meal.

no doubt I will be coming back here.  reasonably priced, delicious food, excellent service.
author: Lisa C.

description: Food was good, not great. Nothing really interesting about the menu--the same standard Italian fare you could get anywhere else. What ruined the meal was the service. No exaggeration--we could not go more than 45 seconds without a server or busser visiting the table. Take one sip of water, someone stops to refill it. But they don't service the whole table at once. The next time someone takes a sip of water, someone else stops to refill the glass. 30 seconds later, 3 bussers and the hostess all hover over the table frantically looking for something, anything, to fill or clear. The second you take the last bite of food, they clear the plate before you're even done chewing. But never quietly or subtly. Every single time the conversation is interrupted. Seriously, within 15 minutes of sitting down we were all nervous wrecks. I felt like I was being circled by a frenzied pack of hyenas. By the end of the meal, all 8 of us only wanted one thing: to be left alone.
author: Michael M.

description:
Enjoyed dinner here recently, with clients.  Started with the crepes al caviar e salmone -- fantastic!  Practically melts in your mouth...

Unfortunately, the ravioli di aragosta in salsa rosa was not nearly as lovely as the appetizer; however, the others in my party enjoyed their entrees so, perhaps, it was simply an "off" night for the vodka pink sauce.

Either way, there are so many wonderful choices for dinner in San Francisco -- I'm not sure I would return to Allegro Romano.
author: Laura S.

description: Delicious lobster ravioli and great service, recommended us the main menu and desserts, I loved the food and really enjoyed it here.
author: Lucia F.

description:
The food was exceptional -- they do their menu very well. Let me quickly move past that to what made the experience truly outstanding.

What set the restaurant apart was the charming, playful, engaging owner and staff. I went with a female friend, and they thought we were on a date, which catalyzed a slew of jokes, free appetizers, a rose for her, free dessert and free port post-dinner. The water in my glass never dipped below 3/4 full. The service was tremendous, they've nailed the ambiance, and the staff set the place apart from other great restaurants in the neighborhood.

Take a date here, immediately.
author: Austin K.

description: We had the bruschetta, prociutto with melon, black truffle risotto, lobster ravioli, and finished off with the house tiramisu. We would recommend all these dishes without hesitation! Dinner was fabulously delicious (it's been several weeks but I can still taste the risotto and ravioli in my memory!), service was impeccable, and wait staff was very friendly and professional. There were generous shavings of black truffle on the risotto, as others have commented on before. We were lucky enough to be there when the restaurant wasn't too crowded, but I guess they were waiting for a large party to arrive so they did turn away someone who walked in looking for a table. We made reservations about a week in advance and even then they suggested an earlier time as they didn't have the original time we wanted. All worth it! We've recommended to all our friends in the San Fran area.
author: Kassia L.

description:
Quite simply, one of my favorite restaurants in existence.  Tucked away amongst homes in the Russian Hill neighborhood, this unassuming looking restaurant boasts pictures on its walls of the many celebrities who visit.  It's smaller than my house with maybe 6-10 tables total (so make sure to get a reservation!), and each visitor is treated as a cherished guest.

The food is outstanding, other reviews will tell you that.  But what really sets this place apart is the neighborhood feel.  By the time we left, we knew our waiter's name and he knew ours.  He gave my wife and mom roses as we left.  What a great experience.

An added bonus?  Not expensive.  Seriously.  You'll be hard pressed to find an entree over $19.

If you seek a restaurant with fabulous food and an authentic, neighborhood feel, this is perhaps the best restaurant in San Francisco.
author: A L.

description: Love the atmosphere here. Very old school, rustic, and intimate. Great food, great wine, and friendly.
author: R M.

description:
Love love love Allegro Romano! Came here for the first time last night with a group of 6 professional, but rowdy girls to celebrate a birthday. The whole experience was top notch. The service, the food, the personalities, the decor, the lighting, the music. I loved it. The staff was super friendly with us and catering to our high maintenance needs, especially the owner, lol. This place has a nice balance of romance, perfect for a special date, and fun, for a celebration. The place is small & intimate, so they can't host too large of parties, definitely call ahead for groups. 

Two of my girl friends had just gotten back from Italy and they felt like they never left. Everything we ate was delicious. Some of the dishes we had were the bruschetta, caprese salad, asparagus, and much much more. I can't recall, but am uploading photos with captions. :)

Definitely cab here as the neighborhood is a tough one to find parking.
author: S A.

description:
I had a reservation with Allegro Romano for Thanksgiving dinner with my family.  However when we arrived at the restaurant Thanksgiving evening for dinner, we were surprised to find that the place was closed.  

To begin with, I had a very difficult time making a reservation.  A person rarely answers the phone and if you leave a message on the answering machine, they do not call you back.  When I finally got a hold of someone, I specifically asked twice if they were open on Thanksgiving evening for dinner and was told each time that they were.  So you can imagine my disappointment when we arrive Thursday night and found out that they were not open.

I called the day after Thanksgiving to make sure that I hadn't accidentally made the reservation for the wrong day.  Someone other than the owner answered.  The person informed me that the owner had decided to close the restaurant for Thanksgiving after I had made my reservation.  I told the person that I had never received a call or a message on my answering machine informing me of this decision.  The person told me he would have the owner call me back to make amends, and confirmed that my phone number was correct.  

The owner never called me back.  I called multiple times on Monday and even left a message.  My calls were never returned.  Honestly, there are so many great and welcoming restaurants in San Francisco that serve amazing food and have friendly service, I wonder why I even wasted my time on such a rude restaurant that didn't have the decency to inform me they were closed on Thanksgiving and left my family and I hanging.  

In the end, we decided to go Wayfare Tavern (we had walked by it earlier that day and saw it was open).  Wayfare Tavern seated us immediately even though we didn't have a reservation, had great food, friendly service, and I would highly recommend them.
author: Jamie S.

description: This is my favorite restaurant ever!  I come here only for special occasions, because they treat you like gold here.  It feels as though you are in a little town in Italy and the owner comes out to sing for you, cook the most delectable dishes and make you feel like you are in their home.  I would give this place 20 stars if I could.  You would think they could skimp on the quality of food, but they go way out of their way!  Run, don't walk there!!!!!!
author: Cameron A.

description: My first visit here was in June 2012.  My boyfriend franticly tried to find a parking spot for ten minutes, then dropped me off to make the reservation.  I causually said he was looking for a space, then they ran outside and waved him down & let him park in a reserved spot for the restaurant.  As I was waiting, they brought me a glass of wine, which was nice.  We then ordered one appitizer to split, then brought us two.  We ordered entrees and had a fabulous meal.   The wild boar ragu was so tasty!  We then were stuft and declined dessert.  What did they do?  They brought us dessert!  After gorging on wine, appitizers, entrees and dessert, I walk out with a rose and a $30 bill.  The experience was amazing.  I highly recommend this place, especially for a romantic dinner.  It's now my favorite spot!
author: Catherine H.

description:
Never disappointed with Allegro, wonderful black truffle risotto special. 
As always excellent service! Lorenzo and his staff are top notch.
author: Pamela N.

description: Hands down my favorite restaurant in San Francisco bar none. The food is awesome and the service is truly exceptional and on a level that sets them apart. My wife and I have been here lots of times and taken various friends (we are British so we get a lot of visitors) and they all love the place. You do have to book early as it's not a big place and is always full and I find it's best to call after 5pm when they are open or drop in and make a reservation.
author: Jonny D.

description: Went here on my fiance's birthday and had an AMAZING experience. The food was great (lobster ravioli - yum!) and the staff was beyond delightful. It was tough to get a reservation but absolutely worth the wait.
author: Donovan B.

description:
Part of my job is to refer guests or make restaurant reservations at their request. I have been dealing with the owner & his restaurant for years, which was usually positive, but just today I had two different guests have issue with the restaurant. ITS NOT EVEN THE FOOD BECAUSE THEY NEVER MADE IT IN THERE! Making reservations is a complete NIGHTMARE because they NEVER EVER acknowledge voicemail although the owner claims to return phone calls. What's worse is them NOT returning a guest's phone call. You've got to have the 'in' with the owner
 or be one of his hoi-polloi regulars to get any acknowledgement. It just gets worse every year but then again he's successful enough that he doesn't need the additional business. It's unfortunate because it WAS a great place where he always went out of his way to make you feel @ home. I think 'someone' needs to come down to earth and go back to running an approachable and great neighborhood restaurant it once was. If you truly want to dine here, make sure you call during business hours because maybe you'll get a live voice on the line.
author: Darlene D.

description:
I had a delightful dining experience here last night for a friend's birthday celebration. They graciously accommodated our group of 9 with short notice after Bix "lost" our reservation. It turns out it was their 5 year anniversary and so they were giving all of the ladies roses - how charming! 

Let's move on to the most important thing - the food. 2 words - super delicious. Everyone in our group enjoyed everything. Personally, I had the ceasar sald with fresh crab meat and the rigatoni with pancetta. Yum! They also helped us pair the food with a very nice, yet reasonably priced wine. 

The one challenge here is parking, so take muni or a cab. 

Outstanding service and tasty food - cinque stelle!
author: Rebecca O.

description: Grace and I call Allegro Romano our favorite Italian restaurant.  The pesto sauce was outstanding.  It's a small restaurant and the atmosphere is just perfect.  The owner puts a lot of love into the food and it pays off.  It may have been the moons in alignment - the chocolate mousse and port was one of the best pairings I've ever had - just a great.
author: Robin S.

description: This was one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. We went for our 25th Anniversary. The restaurant was recommended by our son and his girlfriend who found it last year. It is a small restaurant, but we had no problem with reserving a table for four. The waiters made us feel like family and they gave us some complementary dishes to celebrate our Anniversary. We had several plates of appetizers and every one was delicious and easily shared. For our main course I had a filet and my husband couldn't decide between a couple of pastas so they made him a plate with both. The menu was large with truly decadent ingredients and we only wish we could have ordered it all. We shared some bites and there wasn't a single dish that was bad. We even got several desserts including a complementary espresso cake which was so rich and creamy and port that was liberally poured and enjoyed by all.  I will definitely go back. It's my new favorite restaurant.
author: Jean B.

description:
We had a fantastic experience, from the moment we made the reservation for 15 to celebrate our son's graduation from Cal.  Shockingly, very few restaurants in the area were willing to take 15 people at 7 pm, but this restaurant welcomed us with open arms.  When we arrived driving the impossibly large 15 passenger van, Lorenzo and one of the waiters rushed outside to move their motorcycles to make room for us to park.  Such kindness reminded us of the most amazing experiences traveling in Italy.  
Taking care of a group of 15 is no easy task, but the waiters made everything carefree and simple - serving delicious  antipasti, family style, letting everyone order of the menu for the entre and then capping the perfect meal with dessert samplers.  I was particularly impressed when the waiter suggested a house Chianti rather than trying to up-sell me into a more expensive selection.  The wine was wonderful!  Our guests all agreed that this was one of the finest meals for all of us.  Thank you, Allegro Romano, for helping us celebrate in style and treating us the honored guests in your home.  We will never forget this evening!

P.S. Asparagus appetizer was out of this world!
author: Larisa G.

description: When we were visiting Italy we met the owners brother and he told us to try Allegro Romano. We have dined a few times now and it is my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Love the neighborhood, love the quaint size and the food is AMAZING! My favorite dish is the shaved truffle linguine. The owner is so nice and the wait staff is great too. A must go and try the tasting me it's affordable and the best way to sample the best of Italy. I'm addicted to the fresh shaved truffles on the fettucini and the owner makes you feel like family.
author: Amy T.

description: This place is very close to 5 stars in my view but the final verdict is 4. There was a little confusion which led to an unnecessary delay in being seated (despite having a reservation) - but they made up for it with complimentary bruschetta. We shared the Dover Sole and Rigatoni all'Amatriciana and both were phenomenal. Tiramsu was good but not the best ever. I will definitely be back to check out the Lobster Ravioli.... this might just be my favorite Italian restaurant in the city.
author: Priya N.

description:
I am a bit reluctant to write a review because I am not sure I want everyone to know just how good heaven is...

If you want an experience and a real taste of pure heaven, then you must try Allergo Romano. It's so much more than a good meal, it's the dining experience of a lifetime.
author: Alexandra G.

description: Go here for dinner and save yourself the airfare to Rome.  It couldn't be more authentic Italian.  Not only is the food beyond delicious, the whole atmosphere is understated romantic and sophisticated.  Perfect for a very special night out.
author: gayle l.

description: If you are looking for a unique and romantic experience in San Francisco then Allegro Romano is THE place. The food is just amazing from the simple dishes on up and the specials are typically really exceptional. I had a fetticcuini with black truffles when last there that was to die for!! Lorenzo and his staff make things perfect and the service is first rate in this intimate setting on Russian Hill. I live in Texas but when I am in SF I always try to get a table if I can...so make your reservations in advance if you want to share in the experience! Ciao Lorenzo!!
author: John S.

description:
one of the best italian meals i have had outside of italy.  

amazing food - perfect pastas, great starters, great grilled fish
perfect service - friendly and attentive with grat suggestions.  they clearly care

this is what i was hoping for from seven hills
author: nick g.

description:
Allegro is a GEM. Both times that the bf and I have dined here we have left happy after the great intimate dining experience, delicious food and incomparable hospitality. Ladies, how often do you get to go to a restaurant where you leave with a rose? 

Oh, Allegro, I can't wait to go back!
author: Marlene L.

description: On Monday, 8/5/2013, we had dinner reservations for 6:45 pm. We arrived at 6:49 pm and when the owner told us that we were late and our reservations were given away, I thought surely he was joking. Well, he was not joking. There was no apology or anything. I just felt totally disrespected, and my friends I consoled ourselves down the block with an excellent Italian dinner at Amerena's
author: margie c.

description:
i don't give 5 stars often, but i really liked this place. i came here with my husband and my parents for my birthday and i can't believe this is my first time here!

the restaurant is small and cozy - we were definitely pretty close to the table next to us, but it was fine. there were definitely a lot of waiters serving in a small space, so the service was great! i really wanted to try almost everything on the menu, but we had to pick.  the owner came by the table to show us a piece of black truffle and told us we could get it with fettuccine or risotto and as a main or an appetizer. i couldn't resist and decided that since it was my birthday, i could splurge a little. so we ordered a truffle fettuccine as an appetizer to share. i got a bit worried after, because i realized we didn't know the price!

i ordered the scaloppini with porcini mushrooms as my main course. Hubby ordered the special, which was the osso bucco. I helped my mom choose the risotto with scallops in a black ink and fig sauce and my dad got the king salmon.  

they serve bread with a red dip - i think it was tomato and red pepper? not sure. i wish the bread were warm - because you could tell it was pretty good bread.

then we waited for our appetizer. they mistakenly took a couple cold appetizers to our table with some sharing plates and made it a point to change the plates when they realized our appetizer was warm to a warm plate. good service!  oh wow - the truffle fettuccine was sooo good. rich and heavy, but i kept on wanting to eat more. and i think the owner shaved at least 8-10 pieces of truffle on the pasta. it was so flavorful and addictive.  my favorite of the night for sure.  

for the mains, my favorite was the osso bucco - it was so tender and flavorful and seasoned just right.  then it would probably be the risotto and scallops. the scallops were cooked perfectly! and then the veal and salmon which was good, but nothing special (the mushrooms on the veal were yummy)

we didn't get to try their desserts, because we brought our own cake. They helped us serve the cake on nicely decorated plates.

The best part of the meal was the fact that it was so reasonable. The truffle fettuccine was less than $20 (phew!) and they didn't charge us a cake cutting fee which is really nice.  They also gave all the females in the restaurant a beautiful red rose at the end. Will definitely be back!
author: Eleanor C.

description:
Looking for a place to take my fiancée that had a romantic atmosphere that she had never been before, I came across Allegro Romano. 

Reviews of other "romantic" restaurants in San Francisco mostly steered me away, but Allegro looked very promising.  I called the restaurant (reservations not available through OpenTable) and found that they were booked solid on Friday and only had two relatively early reservations on Saturday, so I took the later of the two.

My fiancée and I took a taxi to the restaurant, which was tucked away in a residential neighborhood.  We arrived a couple of minutes before our reservation and were greeted by Lorenzo, the owner. The service leading up to being seated was impeccable!  I looked at my fiancée's hard-to-please pleasant surprise and knew Allegro was the right decision! 

From the indications on Yelp I was apprehensive about the pricing, but when the dinner menu arrived the pricing was reasonable. The specials were a Halibut over garbanzo bean mashed potatoes and spinach as well as a lobster linguine...I was torn about which to order, but fortunately my fiancée was in the mood for the Halibut and so I ordered the lobster.

The wine selection was good, though it was a bit pricey, but were able to find a decent selection none the less.  When the food arrived, we actually switched and I started on the Halibut while she started on the lobster. She felt the linguine was a bit overcooked, but that that lobster was amazing! I thought the Halibut and garbanzo mashed potatoes were outstanding! So we switched again. I enjoyed the lobster and linguine, while she agreed that the Halibut was very tasty.  I like my pasta a bit overcooked, so the linguine was right up my alley.  The portions were the perfect size, as neither of us left hungry after the meal (a huge problem at some restaurants in SF).

We typically don't order desert, but decided to go with coffee instead since we were not yet ready to call it a night. When the coffee arrived, the waiter also showed up with fresh strawberries and biscotti.  When we finished with the meal we were concerned about having to call a cab, so I asked our waiter about which company to call...he told me not to worry about it because they would call the cab and let us know when it arrived.

I had already paid the bill, but we were not rushed out of our table while we waited for the cab. Water continued to be refreshed as we continued our conversation.  When the cab did arrive about 15 minutes later, Lorenzo himself let us know and thanked us for coming. 

Overall, this was one of the best experiences I've had at a restaurant in a while! The atmosphere was perfect, the size of the restaurant was quaint and intimate, the service was impeccable and the food was wonderful! I was surprised at the low price of the bill (even after a bottle of wine) for this high-level of restaurant! We will be returning again to enjoy the love that was ever present in everything at Allegro Romano.
author: Jon K.

description:
Excellent service, 
great food (I guess it depends what you get)

I got penne pasta in marinara sauce with spinach, soft wonderful cheese, and just the right hint of garlic.
What a delight to my tastebuds.

I lived in Phoenix, AZ for 8 years, so it could be that I got used to the sorry@$$ crappy Italian food here, but it was the best I had tasted in years.

I travel across the country and abroad while trying to find outstanding marinara pasta bc AZ food is so horrible.

This place is one of my top 2.
(The other place was abroad)

I would definitely recommend this place to a friend, assuming they have similar taste with me.

The only downside about this place is difficult access to the restrooms
(gotta go alll the way into a hotel lobby)

Also, don't let the bill surprise you.
author: Cadence C.

description:
Adorable neighborhood restaurant with extreme charm.  Staff, including the maitre d'/owner, is super attentive.  Diners get a glass of port with desert and, the women, get a rose from the owner.  Food is uncomplicated but very good - pasta is home made and excellent.  

Make a reservation because the restaurant is small, fills up quickly, and does nor really seek to do too many seatings in any one evening.  Also, allow plenty of time to park since spots are very difficult to find.
author: David A.

description:
The food was of the best Italian I've ever had, and I used to run an Italian kitchen!  The service was impeccable.  Yes, it was friendly and gregarious... good Lord people who have criticized the over-friendliness of the staff and owner... did you realize that you were dining in an Italian restaurant???  It's the nature of the beast and it's what makes it so special and wonderful!  

They spoiled me rotten.  It was my 40th birthday and I was celebrating with several friends at my side.  The food came family style in waves of delicious variety.  The Black Truffle Fettuccine (imported from Italy, of course) was so orgasmic that I had to cut it into tiny pieces and let it just savor on my tongue, hoping that the flavor could stay with me forever.... oh, just remembering makes my mouth water with satisfaction!

The waiter danced with me to That's Amore by Dean Martin... The entire restaurant sang happy birthday to me... The wine glasses and water glasses never hit bottom.  It was a perfect evening....

Until the bill came.  This was the only reason I'm giving Allegro Romano a 4 star rather than a 5 star rating.  And, as I type this... I'm not convinced it's completely fair.  Ideally, I would give them 4.5 stars.  Here's the bill situation.  We only ordered 3 carafes of wine, but apparently they just kept bringing them and we ended up having 6, and two were comped.  There were so many dishes of food coming and we weren't able to assess how much wine we were drinking or not drinking because we never ever served ourselves.  If the glass was down a half an inch, they would top it off without us even really being aware of it.  We should have clarified the price of the family style dining prior to ordering it.  We made assumptions that it wasn't going to be too much because the entrees ranged from $15-$25, so even double the price of the most expensive entree wasn't a big deal.  Ultimately, when the bill came, each of the 7 of us owed well over $100 each.  None of us were prepared for that singular expense.  We handled it, but it did knock the wind out of our sails.  I know to many of you readers out there, you may be thinking that a $100 a person isn't a big deal, but to me and my group, it was a lot for one meal.  

Ultimately, it was very, very worth it.  The experience will stay with me forever.  And, it really WAS worth the large price tag.  I just wish we knew up front of the expense so it wouldn't have been such a shocker.

I will be back again and again, as often as they will have me!  I'll just walk in knowing the operating system this time so I can navigate specific to my budget!
author: Melanie S.

description:
This restaurant gets four stars largely due to the ambiance and the hospitality!

We came here for Valentine's Day dinner (on the 13th to avoid the crowds) based on the Yelp reviews which were spot on.

We immediately were given a bruschetta appetizer, which wasn't anything special but it was a nice gesture.  We then ordered a salad and the carpacio, which were both done very well.  For the entree, my husband and I decided to split the lobster and crab ravioli in a vodka cream sauce and the gnocchi in a truffle sauce.  Both dishes were very good, and we were stuffed.   

Consistent with other reviews, we were given unlimited port wine and free tiramisu for dessert (my husband asked for the check, and they proceeded to give us two clean spoons and the tiramisu!).  I was also given a red rose on my walk out.  

When we got the bill, there seemed to be an extra $8 charge, which I think explains the "free" bruschetta, tiramisu and unlimited port wine.  A little sneaky but given everything we received it was a steal!

This is definitely a place to come for a special night or for a date night.
author: Marisa G.

description: My ex boyfriend and I came here on our first date and it was a cute but kinda cheesy.  The food was pretty good and the service was great.  I don't recall what we had but we shared all of our food and didn't have any complaints.  I do remember that the waiter kept topping of our wine and even gave us a complimentary dessert wine to share.  Surprisingly I haven't been back but definitely worth checking out.
author: Suz L.

description:
I can't believe I've never been to this restaurant! I've lived in SF for a decade and this place is my new go-to Italian restaurant!

My husband and I came here on a recommendation and walked in with no reservation on a Friday night. We were treated like one of the celebrities hanging on the wall the entire night. We started with the best bruschetta I've ever tasted - it's harder than it looks to get something so simple so spot on. Their caviar & salmon appetizer is to die for - and they even gave us a little extra after I gushed about how good it was! We had the rigatoni and the truffle risotto - literally the most decadent portions of truffle I have ever seen, I felt like I was swimming in heaven it was so good! Why fly to Italy when you can duck into a great neighborhood restaurant that is better than the food I had there?

We both had fish as our 3rd course, my sea bass was cooked to perfection so that the natural flavors really shined. Our servers kept serving us rounds of drinks on the house - all so delicious that we staggered out of the restaurant full of the best meal we had ever had.

This restaurant is a must-do - a quiet little place tucked in an iconic neighborhood run by a wonderful proprietor. They make classic and beguilingly simple dishes where the natural flavors of their ingredients truly stand out. We expect to come here for years to come - just get there early enough to try to find parking. :)
author: Christie W.

description: Horrible restaurant that I will never visit again. Made reservations, was welcomed in by waiters and owner. While waiting for the rest of our party to arrive, waiters kept returning to our table telling us we had a time limit to order. After about the 3rd time we asked if we could go ahead and order because we knew what to order for the people joining us. ( who by the way were no more than 10 min late). They then told us no, that we had to leave because there was a big party coming and our business was no longer required. Stunned, we asked again to just order and as the rest of our party was walking in we were escorted out by the owner. Who wasn't even apologetic. Horrible service. The one thing I learned working in the restaurant industry is never treat any customers worse than others. Treat them all the same (fantastically and with respect) because you just may not know who those people you're upsetting are.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Have recently dined here twice recently. Amazing food, romantic atmosphere, staff and owner are very attentive. 

Good for large parties or a table of 2. 

Must try!
author: Alex P.

description:
Allegro Romano gets 4 1/2 stars. The food, the experience, Lorenzo - all of these ingredients make for a fantastic meal. 

What a find! This restaurant is as quaint and charming as the surrounding neighborhood.   The ambience is cozy, warm and romantic.  My boyfriend and I sat at a corner table.  Dining by candlelight with rose petals on the table is a great way to end a long week, let me tell you.  Lorenzo, the owner and our waiter, was as cheerful and sunny as his bright yellow pants.  I don't think I have ever eaten at a restaurant where the owner greeted me, then walked outside to help my boyfriend find parking - an incredible act of kindness in a city where parking frustration can damper any activity. 

The food was delicious.  We started with the lobster bisque and caprese salad.   The truffle oil on fresh mozzarella and tomatoes was to die for! The bisque was creamy and rich. My boyfriend ordered the filet, which came in a delicious sauce.  I ordered "Willie Brown's favorite," which we now refer to as "one of my favorite pasta dishes in the city." Tangy tomato sauce, chunks of Italian bacon and al dente rigatoni - fall comfort food, at its best. As a special surprise, Lorenzo brought out a delicious dessert plate with tiramisu, biscotti, and fresh strawberries with whipped cream.   The complimentary port was a nice touch too.  If the experience couldn't get any better, Lorenzo handed me a long stem pink rose at the end of our meal. 

In the middle of the meal, they played "That's Amore" and the entire restaurant burst into song.  Lorenzo asked, "Today is a special day - does anyone know what day it is?" Fifteen minutes later, he answered, "Its Friday!" I found it to be truly refreshing to find a restaurant and staff that offer first class food yet do not take themselves too seriously. No pretentiousness here. 

I was pleasantly surprised to find great Italian food tucked away from the busy tourist traps in North Beach. Give it a try on a Friday night; reservations recommended. Great place to bring a date! When you go, say hello to Lorenzo!
author: Nicole S.

description: Excellent service and food is spectacular!  Asparagus alla Parmigiana, Mushrooms Trifolati, and Homemade lobster ravioli with vodka pink sauce  was so delicious! It totally hit the spot. Everything was was so freakin good! Great dinner place for date night! You will be very pleased.
author: TifFancy N.

description:
I love to try new restaurants but this just didn't hit for me.  We had a group and it was pretty packed in the restaurant.  There was a large party that night and so it can be done.  The staff was wonderful and the food was okay.  I don't know who he is but whoever is in charge had a temper tantrum that night so it was uncomfortable and made the food hard to enjoy.

Putting that aside, for San Francisco the food was okay.
author: Peggy R.

description: AMAZING! Excellent! Cozy little neighborhood restaurant with authentic Italian food. Perfect.
author: Cari T.

description:
The reasons why this place beats Frascati... and believe me, i LOVE Frascati. 

1. Lorenzo! The most amazing owner with the sassiest fashion sense.
2. Andrea Bocelli Music 
3. Lobster ravioli
4. Tiramisu (a must try)
5. The rose that all the ladies get when they leave. Definitely adds the romantic feel to this already magical restaurant.

Everything on the menu was delicious, and the service was friendly and warm. This little restaurant had me begging for more every time I left. 

Hrm... this would be an awesome place to go for Valentine's Day...!!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Before you read the review, you should know that...

Food = 4.5 stars. Service = 4.5 stars. Temperature of the restaurant = 2 stars.

I would have loved to give Allegro Romano 5 stars but was uncomfortably hot during my meal there. Yes, it was during the strange SF heat wave in mid-October. But shoot, I can't enjoy my meal to the fullest (even when it's super delicious) when I am extremely warm. And the restaurant wasn't even full.

That being said, THIS PLACE ROCKS. I would definitely return, although just a forewarning it's a celebratory/romantic kind of place. Came here for my dad's birthday dinner as a double date with my parents and boyfriend and had a wonderful time.

1. We were seated right on time (6pm reservation, although the server warned us there was another reservation for our table at 8. But hey, honesty with your customers? Mad respect).
2. The owner came over and introduced himself.
3. The servers knew a LOT about the specials of the evening.
4. Service was excellent. Almost TOO excellent considering the fact that my water glass was filled at least 10 times during our 1.5 hour dinner...not an exaggeration.
5. My fish (sea bass) was arguably the best fish I have ever eaten in my life. It wasn't overly seasoned and literally melted in my mouth. Served with spinach and mashed potatoes. I died.
6. My mom raved about her lobster ravioli.
7. My boyfriend got the salmon, he said it was good but not the best he's ever had. So...don't order the salmon.
8. My dad got a pasta special. He loved it.
9. Desserts ordered were tiramisu and cheesecake. Tiramisu was so goooood! Their biscotti that they serve with their desserts is also delicious, and I'm not a big biscotti fan.
10. They found out it was my dad's birthday and dessert was on the house :) I really respect places with great customer service and AR was not a disappointment.
11. Ladies get a rose upon departure from the restaurant. Excellent touch, Allegro Romano, excellent touch.

Will definitely be back, the prices aren't bad when you consider what you're getting and it was one of the most enjoyable dining experiences I've had yet in SF.
author: Nicole W.

description: This place is so romantic and would typically be a sad place to eat alone but the waiters and food made up for it. Amazing lobster ravioli and I didn't feel rushed at all. It's a great out of the way spot and the owner gave me directions to the next place I wanted to find and walked with me half way there. Great place!
author: Misty L.

description:
Last night was my second visit. I had excellent experiences in service and quality both times I went.
The first time we were there, we were a party of 4. The couple we were meeting circled the neighborhood for 25 min looking for parking. When our server asked us where the other half of the party was, we explained the situation. He told us to have him bring the car up front and he'd get us a spot. Way above the call of duty! No one has ever done that for me before.
Now the food. I had the truffle risotto and it took every ounce of self restraint not to lick the plate. Everyone else's dishes were delicious. The boar bolognese and the fois gras rigatoni were amazing.
We went back last night and I had the truffle risotto again. It was just as amazing as I'd remembered. My boyfriend had the boar bolognese again too. My friend had the white truffle fettuccine and we were arguing who had the best dish and couldn't decide.
They also gave the ladies in the party a rose as a parting gift both times. The first time the chef comped us a bruschetta; the second time we had a nice glass of port with dessert as a surprise.
I LOVE this place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Highly highly recommended.
author: N M.

description:
Allegro Romano is always busy.  I had tried to get in many times either showing up at their door hungry or ringing an unanswered phone.  When we finally got in we found that they thanked us for coming back again and that they were sorry they did not have a table for us before.

The place is cute and the tables are beautifully decorated with fresh rose petals and memorizing aromas come from the kitchen.  The owner came over and informed us (it was only 6.30 at this stage) that we were welcome to the table all night, to take our time and enjoy are meal.  We ordered and the waiter brought over two additional complimentary appetizers.  We had a lovely meal, nice simple Italian, with clean flavors and fresh ingredients.  

At the end of the meal our plates were cleared and two port glasses were put down in front of us and they filled them with complimentary delicious port.  We said we didn't want desert and decided to sit and enjoy our port and wait for the check to arrive.  When we asked for our check and the waiter said "No check, Porto!" and out came more port.  From that point onward every time we went to leave or pay the bill we were told no "Porto" instead.  The waiter said "It's taken you so long to get in, do you really think we're going to let you leave".  

We sat there soaking up the atmosphere and sipping port.  After many many more"Portos" the waiter presented me with a rose and we were payed our check and leave.  Three hours after we'd gone into the place we left and walked around the corner to our place finally understanding why the place is always full.
author: Claire m.

description:
I was just messaged by what I assume is someone affiliated with Allegro Romano (no friends, no reviews, 35 pictures of Allegro, guests, and food) who asked me to take down my "untrue" review (which gave it an average 3 stars). When I refused, he cordially informed me I was blacklisted.

Fine by me.
author: Amanda F.

description:
THANK YOU FOR ANOTHER AMAZING DINNER EXPERIENCE!! Allegro Romano is only a block away from our home but we always feel this place is sooo special that we are always looking forward to have dinner here.

We had a great time last night celebrating Valentine's weekend. Everytime we come in for dinner we always left feeling special, entertained and can't wait to come back...
I love love love the lobster raviolli, they kept pouring us port and our glasses were never empty. All the staff are always happy and they know how to make us feel so special.
The owner is always smiling and fun to chat with, the FOOD IS THE BEST!!!!!
And thank you for the rose!!!!!!!
author: Ty N.

description:
What makes Allegro Romano so unique:
1.) Every day is Valentine's Day. I'm talking rose petals scattered all over the tables and roses handed out to the ladies at the end of the meal. So, kinda awkward for the girl sitting next to me who was there with her dad.
2.) The owner, Lorenzo, can rock some loud plaid pants and busy silk shirts.
3.) On any given night, you might rub elbows with Mayor Newsom, Ashton Kutcher and Demi Moore, and Omar Vizquel.
4.) You feel like you're a guest in Lorenzo's home in Italy. Instead of ordering yourself, tell him you want to do family style, and he'll pick the wine and dishes for you.
5.) A cab waits for you outside after you're done. Well, we happened to be the last ones there, so I don't know if this is automatically done for every customer, but they'll definitely call one for you if you need one.

The pastas are delicious -- you can't go wrong with any one of them. If you're indecisive like me (I'm a true Libra), just leave it up to Lorenzo!
author: Connie C.

description:
I don't think that I ever even ate this good while traveling Italy. The servers were so friendly and funny, not to mention they almost predict what you need. The ambiance in the restaurant it amazing, it is pretty small but so intimate and quaint. 

I had the wild boar bolognese and it was amazing, the sauce was how bolognese sauce is meant to taste. My friend had the gnocchi in Gorgonzola pepper sauce and that was delicious as well. The prices I feel were completely reasonable for the quality of food and the service. I will be going back and would recommend it to anyone who wants a nice authentic Italian meal.
author: Anastasia T.

description:
I was in SF last year and was going to be gone for my anniversary, so I flew my wife out so we could have couple days together before I had to get to work.  We found Allegro Romano here on Yelp and thought it was the perfect place to go for our anniversary.  It was.  Unbelievable food, great ambiance, fantastic service.

Fast forward another year, I'm in SF again, going to miss my anniversary, so again I bring my wife out, and again we go here.  I think it was even better this time around.

The gnocchi are the best I've ever eaten, the second best is not even close.  They're even better than my grandmother's.  I will be coming here every time I'm in SF, you should too.
author: Michael G.

description:
Overrated.

If your idea of romantic is listening to a playlist of o-sole-mio and similar greatest hits of Italian opera while 5 different waiters fuss over you, then well...

With all the tables cramped so close together, as you look to your side you feel like you're in a feedlot.  Faces upon faces chewing in unison.  

The waitstaff was constantly hovering over us, twice reaching down to straighten my fork.  Why they bothered to do this I have no idea.  They also asked me for ID, which was weird.  And having finished my first drink halfway through, they took my glass without offering a refill.  Aren't you supposed to ask? 

And so rushed!  I thought a place like this would let you settle into your meal.  Not the case.  Stuff was coming out of the kitchen so fast that we were done with 3 courses in just over an hour.

We left with a rose that they plopped down with the check, much like a 2-for-1 coupon.  My heart sighed.
author: indojin i.

description: Loved this place.....came for a friends bday..... and our other friend knew the owner. He just kept the food and wine coming. This place is fab! We had just about everything on the menu and it was all delicious, I've been dying to go back. Nothing negative to say about this restaurant. It's really cute from the inside, the staff is great and the food is fab. I seriously can't wait to go back.
author: Irma R.

description: Didn't get a chance to eat here. My boyfriend and I called to make reservations here 5 times in one week for our 3 year anniversary. First time we kept getting the voice mail because apparently they never check their messages. So we sent an email not knowing what else to do. (Never got a response). We called again the next day and finally got through to the answering machine the 5 time so we left our contact info asking for a reservation. We called again 2 days later to make sure we had our reservation and when someone picked up they sat the phone down and nobody had come back for 10 minutes?!? Really? Well we decided to wing it and went anyways trying to be positive and sure enough the owner was standing outside and sent us away immediately saying they were full. When I explained our situation he gave us a "tough luck" and moved on to people who looked like regulars. I'm starting to think locals have priority seating. We had to walk around for an hour before another restaurant down the street was nice enough to squeeze us in despite the fact that they were also full.
author: A B.

description:
We had to go into the city on a weeknight, so decided to find an Italian restaurant close to our event.  Allegro Romano was perfect.  On a quiet corner in Russian Hill, the place only held about 16 to 20 tables, so we were glad to have made reservations.  After finding parking (always an issue in SF), we were seated right away.  We started with a carafe of chianti and some bruschetta...very flavorful, but just one piece for each of us.  My husband had the chicken piccata dish, which was fine but nothing exciting.  Mine was a veal scaloppini with porcini mushrooms, which I found delicious and satisfying.  Both meals were served with mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach, which really complimented the dish.
  We ordered dessert and coffee...tiramisu for hubby, and a chocolate truffle ice cream thingy (sorry, I blanked out on its real name, but it was fabulous!).  The next table over saw what I was having and ordered 3 of them.  The tiramisu was good, but mine was better!  
BTW, the service was wonderful!  Our meals arrived at our table not long after ordering, which made me think they may want our table for other patrons later..how wrong I was.  Not only were we not rushed to leave, we were brought complimentary glasses of port, then biscotti and strawberries, then more port. In fact, when we did try to get up to leave, our waiter poured us a 4th glass of port!  They made us feel so at home and welcomed to be there that it was hard to leave.  Our table turned out to be "Our Table" for the whole evening!  
When we finally got up to leave, there were handshakes to our waitstaff and the gift of a rose to me...a wonderful evening on a Wednesday night!
author: Luanne G.

description:
My only complaint has nothing to do with the outstanding food and service, but with the California State Legislature.  Was really looking forward to the fois gras appetizer. 
This small spot above the Broadway Tunnel was awesome.  The fettucine with white truffle cream sauce was superb.
author: M N.

description:
I'm always hesitant to walk into an Italian restaurant because I work at one. Why pay for something when I can stuff my face or free before my shift? I went into Allegro with some skepticism but I was blown away by the Gnocchi with Gorgonzola and walnuts. Best gnocchi I've ever had. My boyfriend had the rigatoni and couldn't stop raving about the sauce. We had the Tiramisu for dessert and the complementary biscotti won us over. 

I know a restaurant is good if I'm still craving for the food the next day and boyyy was I craving for that gnocchi.
author: Emahlee H.

description:
I'm hesitant to write this because I live really close to this place and really, really want it to be my fave neighborhood haunt.  And, like Mixt Greens, my three stars are sorta out of place on a page full of Allegro fans.  I wanted to love it so much that it took me a few visits (plus a trip to Milano) to figure out what it is that I don't like.  

I feel like I'm being nickel and dimed when I go to Allegro.  Yes, there is free bruschetta and port and, sometimes, biscotti.  But, aside from the bruschetta, I probably wouldn't order it anyhow, so it's not such a huge deal.  The thing is, I feel like they make up for it in other ways.  I went there once with a pal and we ordered a carafe of the house red, thinking we were doing dinner on the cheap (for lushes).  I don't remember if we didn't see the price on the menu or if it wasn't there but, when the bill came, it was $36 (just for the wine).  Really?  Seems a scoche high for a carafe, hm?  To be fair, the waitress discounted it when we asked about it, but it still seemed a bit strange.  Do they expect you to haggle?

Last night, I went with another pal and we ordered the caprese salad to share.  They served it on one plate and it was fine; nothing outstanding and the portion wasn't tinyor enourmous.  When the bill came, we realized they charged us for two salads.  It was $13.  Again, not outrageously high but...really?

Again, I feel so loyal to this place because it's in my hood and the wacky (but fab) owner always helps me find parking and, for sure, I'll keep going, but I'll be pretty sure to keep tabs on my wallet if I'm on a budget.
author: Pammy C.

description:
We came here with a group of 9. From entering the premises, the owner and staff greeted us very politely. Service levels were beyond expectations. Our glasses of water never went below the middle, our serviettes were continuously exchanged when it was dirty, we stayed for 3 hours and were not even rushed out, despite being a small place, and the owner had conversations with us. It's no wonder why movie stars visit this place frequently.

Besides service, the food was fantastic, desserts were delicious.  Highly recommeded!
author: Mike C.

description:
Yelp should make 5+++ stars available just for establishments like this one. I was here last night with a big birthday party, and we all had a phenomenal time. At first I was a little worried that our group would overpower the quaint restaurant. But with the gracious wait staff, Lorenzo dancing through the tables in his red and gold sneakers, rose petals and confetti adorning the tables, Sade's "No Ordinary Love" streaming through the speakers, and the parade of delicious food, Allegro Romano is a celebration all its own. By no means is any of this corny, rather you feel like you're having the best of times at a friend's dinner party in their comfortable Russian Hill home.

The food here is incredible. Simple Italian fare bursting with robust and memorable flavors. For appetizers, we had the beef and salmon carpaccio, fresh buffala mozzarella, and scallops risotto- all which tickled our palate and left us wanting more. And there was more, much much more. I had the fettuccine with lobster in a rustic tomato sauce. It was one of the specials of the night, and by lobster I don't mean a few petty clumps of meat scattered throughout your pasta. We're talking about half a lobster tail complete with a claw.  Some of the other favorites at the table were the gnocchi, home-made lobster and crab stuffed ravioli, salmon alla romano- actually forget it, everything that we ordered was fantastic.

Many restaurants spend too much time and energy in their food and not enough in the dining experience. At Allegro Romano, it is obvious that the front of the house works just as hard as the back. I can not praise enough the outstanding level of service that we received from Lorenzo, his wife (or at least I think she's his wife), and the staff that tended to our every request before we even had to ask. Our glasses were always filled with their signature Chianti, the bread basket was always full, and the dirty plates were whisked away and replaced with clean ones before anyone even noticed. They even turned off the lights when the birthday cake was brought out and everyone participated in the birthday song and dance. Even though we got the cake from Cheesecake Factory, they courteously sliced and plated it for us, even adding a personal touch by sprinkling powdered chocolate on each plate. 

There are many excellent restaurants in the City, but only a few who really put their heart into their food. Allegro Romano definitely has the soul that eludes so many of their competitors, not only because they play Sade and flatter you with roses at the end of the evening, but because it is very clear that they are truly passionate about Italian cooking and 100% committed to their clientele.
author: Alice P.

description:
Holy Hype Machine!  Good food, but could never live up to the hype especially here on yelp.  I would go with 3.5 stars overall... Here is an accurate review for the food. 
Brushetta-above average. Caparese-Above average, really liked the pesto oil served with this. Lobster Ravioli-Average at best.  Pasta didn't taste homemade, couldn't taste any lobster what so ever. Rigatoni all'Amatriciana was really good! The pancetta was almost smoky and a bit heavier than normal.  Really liked this dish. Finally, had the Tartufo and this was excellent as well.  Service is a bit fast, 8 different servers watching over you. Asked the first waiter for his favorites, 'everything is good' OK.... We called and got in with an early rez no problem same day.  I would compare this place to Trattoria Continda on Union. Free port after the meal is of course a nice touch along with the reasonable prices.  Glad we tried it but not a destination type place.
author: Tom W.

description:
WOW!!!!  We came here for my birthday and I have not had a better Italian dinner in the city.  When we sat down the owner greeted us and let us know the specials for the night.  He made a few recommendations off of the menu.  Which I always appreciate, because the menu can sometimes overwhelm me because it all looks so good.   

We split  the Carpaccio alla Romana and seasonal soup for appetizers, Fettuccine al Cinghiale e brodo di Porcini for the pasta course, and the Scaloppini con Porcini.  I can't pick just one, they were all fabulous!!!  Then to top it all off we had the tiramisu and their form of gelato.  When I tried both of these I thought I had died and gone to heaven or at least Italy.  In addition to all of this they gave us a free order of burschetta, port and rose at the end of the night.  I enjoy good food and good customer service. 

The best part about this place is the price.  Every dish is below $20, I would pay more but what keeps me coming back is the affordability of this place.    I will be back many times to come.
author: Kirsten C.
