description: This is the only restaurant review that I've ever written, but I was compelled to write it because of the quality of this fine establishment. Best Italian food I've ever eaten! Absolutely excellent service too. I've since eaten here serval times and never had bad food or service, so it definitely wasn't a fluke. Everything is top notch quality. These people know how to run a restaurant!
author: Antonio A.

description: I've been calling every 4-6 months to make a reservation. Every instance I call multiple times over a few days during peak and non-peak hours. Nobody has ever picked up the phone, I've never been called back after leaving a message, and all emails have gone unanswered.  Judging by my last attempt in which I received a 'memory' is full' automated reply from the voicemail, I guess I'm not the only one having issues. Very frustrating...
author: Casey A.

description:
I could never get a reservation here and i tried many times.  On top of that, they close on Sundays and Mondays.  Will I ever make it in here?

Flash back - walking home and decided to take Broadway up the hill.  Walked by this place - is this a restaurant?  Closed?  How is it possible that we never knew this place existed?  Note to self - look up in Yelp and come back to try.

Fast forward - enjoying a cold beer in North Beach at Boardroom one warm afternoon.  Started talking about restaurants and this was mentioned.  One of the patrons said it's a great place - I want to try but can never get in!  Turned to hubby and said "let's just go there now and see if we can get in."  Off we go.  

We were brave...we decided to go straight up on Broadway and endure the steep hill and the 161 steps!  We tell ourselves that we can eat anything we want after this work out.  

Upon reaching the top of the hill, the restaurant is right there across the street.  The owner in biking outfit was talking to two other bikers.  The place just opened up.  Hostess asked if we have reservation - no but we walked up 161 steps to come here!  Hostess asked owner and he said let them sit anywhere they want!

Walked in and I see what others described.  Candlelight and rose petals...so romantic.  We chose the corner table at the very end where there's a curtain you can pull to get a little more privacy.  Given we were the first table, we had GREAT service.  I told them how I was never successful getting a reservation but now know the trick...come early!

It has been a while and I can't find my receipt but I recall the appetizer that we shared had risotto...after the first bite, I was absolutely in love.  Perfectly cooked risotto!  Imagine a mouthful of buttery flavored rice that melts in the mouth - yeah, that's how good it was.  

For entree, I had the special of the day - risotto with lobster tail.  Need I say more?  Cloud nine.  Hubby had the lamb chop and it was very good - it was tasty with just the right gamey flavor to it, which we both love.  

The owner suggested a bottle of red and decanter it for us - very good.  Again, the service was superb.  Our glass was always filled whenever it got low and the staff was never in your face...did everything very stealthily.

A table of regular patrons came in and looked at our dishes.  They were especially interested in the lamb and ended up ordering it.  Friendly folks - thank us for recommending the dish to them.

We also had dessert but I forgot what.  As the night fell and the sky darkened, we can see a sliver of view from our seat...beautiful, it was truly a dreamy evening and one we'll happily repeat even if it means hiking up the 161 (owner claims 165) steps!

Of course, it wouldn't be the perfect evening without the perfect rose.  Thank you, it was definitely worth the wait, the hike and the hype!
author: Gloria H.

description: Called to make a reservation during business hours...3 times. Each time I got the voicemail. I left my name and number but never got a call back. If you're not on open table, and don't answer your phone and don't call back how can one make a reservation? Just say you don't take reservations then and save the frustration.
author: Lynn M.

description:
Wow is all I have to say.

PERFECT romantic date night. Kick off with a little romantic music, red roses on the table, candle light, and a cute date...

Caprese salad for two and the lobster/crab raviolis.

Bottle of red wine and extremely attentive staff. The host/owner/server was adorable. He moved us between salad and entrees to accommodate a large group coming in, but we were happy to switch booths.

Super small joint. Make reservations for a special occasion. I even left with a red rose.... I know I know. Sounds cheesy but this chick needs a little cheesy romance every once and awhile.
author: Nancy B.

description: From the menu and ambience this looks like its going to be an old school very average neighborhood Italian restaurant.  But the food is amazing.  Pasta cooked to perfection topped with shaved truffles at your table.  Snapper and scaloppini were also good.
author: Larry P.

description:
I just recently had my birthday dinner at Allegro Romano. Lorenzo was able to accommodate us on short notice and made it a wonderful night!

Here is my breakdown:

Service: 5 stars - Funny, helpful, non pretentious chefs. 
Food: 4.75 stars  - The scallops and risotto are the best I've ever had.
Ambiance: 5 stars - Intimate dining experience with great decor.
author: Wais M.

description:
This place is fantastic! It was recommended to me by the concierge at the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins hotel, she made a reservation for me and I headed over. I didn't really need the reservation, as I was the only one there for about 30 minutes. Then a couple came and then another party before I left. 
I am not sure if they really liked me, or they take care of people that get recommended by the concierge...but I got way more than what I paid for! I ordered a glass of wine, the ceaser salad and "Willie's Favorite" pasta dish. What i didn't order (but still got) was a piece of bruschetta, a glass of port (filled 3 times) and a custom dessert of watermelon, strawberries and a biscotti. They really took care of me and I felt very special.
The food was amazing, in L.A. to have Italian food this good you have to make reservations 2 weeks in advance and deal with silly celebrities. 
Also, I am always a fan of Italian restaurants that are owned by...wait for it..and ITALIAN! 
I highly recommend this place for dinner and will be going back.
author: Kristen S.

description:
The food is great but Lorenzo is a jerk.  If you read the other reviews, you will see that everyone either loves Lorenzo or hates him.  Put me in the latter camp.  It was our wedding anniversary and we had made a reservation.  When we arrived, we were told by our hostess that we would have to wait for 5 or 10 minutes for a table to free up (this is a Very Small Place and table management must be a nightmare).  After 20 minutes of waiting in the doorway, during which Lorenzo greeted and seated several of his buddies who showed up without reservations, we finally asked him how much longer it would be, pointing out that the hostess had told us that the wait would be short (remember, we had a reservation and had told Lorenzo on the phone that it was our anniversary).  Lorenzo shot back that the hostess was not in charge of seating but that he, Lorenzo, would decide when we could sit.  At that point we would have walked out, but there are no other restaurants, public transportation or taxis nearby, so we were stuck.  Finally, we were seated by the hostess 40 minutes after our reservation time.  Although he spent a lot of time chatting with his friends at another table, never during our dinner did Lorenzo stop by to apologize or wish us happy anniversary.  It's a shame that Lorenzo is such a jerk, because the food was really very good.  But Lorenzo put us in such a bad mood on our anniversary night that the experience was ruined.  If you are a friend of Lorenzo, I'm sure you enjoy this place.  But if you are from out of town, do not go here.  SF has lots of other places with good food and a host who is not such a jerk.

* * * * *
Post-script, August 2:  Well, apparently, like the other Yelpers who have given this place one star due to the owner's rudeness, I have been tracked down by the owner.  He sent me this email after I posted my initial review (this is cut-and-paste; I'm not making it up):

"From the reviews you seem very  miserable and unhappy with you and the world,based in all your reviews you wrote.I am from Co too living in SF,you may  eat and  review McDonalds when you visit SF and  not the upscale restaurants of SF."

You be the judge.  I suppose if I was the only person to have had a bad experience, you could discount my views.  But if you sort the Yelp reviews for this place by stars and read the one-star ratings, you will see a scary pattern of rudeness and aggression.  Not only does Lorenzo treat his customers badly when they dine, he then tracks down and berates them when they have the courage to share their experiences.  This guy is a nut.  Go to his restaurant at your peril.
author: Bob Y.

description:
I was going to be lazy and not write a review because everyone already KNOWS that Allegro Romano rocks my (and your) socks. But I had to give props, in writing, after what happened on Friday night.

As expected, the four of us (two couples) had a fantabulous meal there that reminded me of the wonderful and quaint restaurants from my trip to Rome. We shared the scallop w/ risotto, bruschetta and beef carpaccio apps (all highly, highly recommended, but if you could only have one, go with the carpaccio). I had the scallopino, fiance and friend had the Willie Brown rigatoni, and friend's wife had the special pesto tortellini. Again, all were delicious. 

And then the complementary biscotti w/ whip (which I know they give you even if you don't order dessert, although we did this time) and of course the complementary bottomless port.

But here's where it gets crazy, over-the-top, can you believe they actually did this part -- so we cab it back to our 'hood all the way in SOMA and friend's wife realizes that she left her clutch back at the restaurant. We knew they were closed by now since we were the last ones there but we tried calling anyway. And what did they do?

THE OWNER DROVE HIS PRIUS AND BROUGHT IT TO THE BAR WE WERE AT AROUND THE CORNER FROM OUR PAD. IN SOMA. 

(And keep in mind that it's not like we're "regulars" or that we acted like we were worthy of that type of awesome treatment, i.e., we didn't tip 50% or anything like that.)

So here's the deal -- 5 stars for the restaurant, which includes food, service, ambiance, etc. etc. Another 5 stars for the oh-no-they-didn't (but in a good way) hospitality. 

Now THAT is the epitome of going the extra mile. 

Okay, so just so I'm being fair, there are a couple items to note that have really nothing to do with the restaurant, but that you should know if you're thinking of going there. (1) No parking. Cab it. Bus it. Walk it. But do NOT drive it. Yes, the owner saves some spots in front of the restaurant for his patrons, but you don't want to chance that it'll be available. (2) Not on OpenTable. But then, if they were, it'd probably be harder to get a reservation than it is now. And if you leave a message with your reservation info, make sure to call back to confirm.

The End. Still giving the place TEN freaking stars.
author: Veronica S.

description:
I walked by this place with my boyfriend, and it looked bustling.  We read the yelp reviews and were so excited to try it.  It sounded like my type of place: unpretentious, hearty, tasty food, and a charming owner who seemed destined to become a close friend.  In the end, we were very disappointed, and both agreed we don't want to go back.

First, the owner would only give us a reservation at 6pm, he said that was the only table he had all night.  It was friday night so I took the reservation, but when we got there it was clear that this was not the only available table.  The restaurant was completely empty the entire time we were there (6-7:30), except for an elderly couple and a couple with a very loud baby. Needless to say the atmoshphere was not great: half staff meeting, half toddler daycare, but mostly just totally empty!!! (Really, we couldn't have come in at 6:30? 7?)

We found the owner to be pretty rude. When we first walked in, he yelled to the hostess from outside to stop (she was directing us to a corner booth), and had us stand in the middle of the restaurant while he came in and put us at the worst table, right by the entrance to the back.  Then he proceeded to comment and sort of complain to the staff about different parties and reservations they had for the night. After listening to the owner bitch, (so awkward)... he took our order, (literally we both felt nervous by that point) and then rudely asked for our IDs when we ordered wine, really bizarre.  

We ordered the ceaser salad with crab, beef carpaccio, the famous crab and lobster ravioli, and the scallopini. Uh, the beef carpaccio was really good, the salad was just OK, the crab tasted really fishy. The ravioli was totally ordinary (I prefer many of the pre-made ones you can get at TJs). I'm really confused as to what the reviews raved about. The scallopini was barely average too, with mashed potatoes and boring steamed vegetables.

On a positive note, the tables were creatively decorated, the chef sent out a free strawberry desert and the busboy gave me a pretty rose from the centerpiece.  Clearly, the staff takes care to make the restaurant a special place.  

However, the food was really average, the owner hostile (or maybe in a bad mood, or we somehow offended him?)....It definitely wasn't the special, delicious experience I expected. It was awkward and I couldn't wait to leave.
author: Sara A.

description:
Allegro personifies the perfect neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Tucked away on a residential block of Russian Hill, we were treated like royalty from the moment we walked in.  The evening started with complimentary bruschetta and ended with complimentary port (including a free refill!)  In between we enjoyed a fantastic asparagus appetizer (beating out my previous favorite at Tommaso's) and some of the tastiest pasta I've had in San Francisco.  
Be prepared for the manager (owner?) busting out a sing along version of "That's Amore!" that should have been cheesy but for some reason seemed to work.
author: phil h.

description:
This place is a nightmare. I live right around the corner and it would be so convenient to take out of town guests, but they are awful. Really, it's just the owner. The staff are nice, the food is decent but not worth the price, but the owner will make it a point to make you personally feel awful.

This is a place to see and be seen if you're famous, but if you're a regular person, avoid this place like the plague.

I even took time to talk to Lorenzo after our horrible experience with him and said, if you have a moment I'd like to discuss your customer service because I do live right nearby and would love to feel comfortable bringing out-of-town family here. He was a total jerk to me for about 10 full minutes before I could bow out.
author: Elianna G.

description:
It has been about 6 months since my last trip to Europe so I have certainly gotten out of shape in terms of lengthy European dining, but here at Allegro's it is going full force.  The service is excellent, but European which means you are not rushed, the server takes his time, your food isn't rushed out, you have time to digest and you need to ask for your bill when you are ready.

The food is great - I went with a group so I was able to try a lot of different things - the tomato soup is more like a past sauce with chunks of tomato in it rather than traditional tomato soup - it is good, just different.  The gnochi with gorgonzola is excellent but so rich - I only had a few bites and ended up with an upset stomach that night.  The BF had the whole thing as his entree and his stomach is still upset!  Willie Brown's favorite pasta was really good - it is rigatoni with a red sauce, - it was probably my favorite.  The lobster and crab ravioli was also good but too rich for me.  The veal scallopini - also good.  I got the risotto with scallops in a balsamic glaze which I thought was fantastic.  

Service was great - very friendly and chatty.  We asked for a sangiovesse wine and tried to order one of the menu but the owner insisted we try a special reserve sangiovesse which we all loved.  He also came around at the end of the meal to share some port with us and brought out a plate of biscotti on the house.  Truly great service and a cute little neighborhood gem.  All of this food - two apps, and a few salads for $45 per person including tip (great deal - and lots of food!).

Even though it is a teeny tiny restaurant, they can accommodate groups pretty well.  Ours was a group of 5, they had a group of 10-12 and another group of 8 while we were there.
author: Katie P.

description:
Fantastico! What a gem! Very small, very intimate restaurant with a vibrant feel. The owner and the service staff are very attentive and make you feel right at home.

We started with a carafe of the house Chianti, good, and the caprese salad, wonderful fresh flavor. I had the sea bass special and my husband had the scallopini, both great. We finished with the Tiramisu which was by far the best I have ever had! We were even treated to an extra dessert by our server. All our food was simple, fresh and flavorful.

At the end of your meal, the servers poured port for us. And they kept on pouring as long as we were drinking! At one point I literally covered my glass and they still were able to sneak a little more once I turned away! A true Italian experience - your glass will never be empty. Just watch out as it is easy to enjoy too much!

I would highly reccommend this place to anyone looking for a true memory.
author: Christina J.

description:
So on another Yelp recommendation, my friend and I decided to try Allegro Romano. 

When we started ordering, all the items we picked were not available. It was only 8pm but I guess there was a shortage on soup and crab cakes. The food that we finally ended up getting was very good. I had the Veal Scallopine and my friend had the lobster ravioli. We had the bruschetta and salads to start. To make up for the food shortage the owner presented us with a dessert platter to die for. 

My friend never liked Tiramisu but she loved Allegro's. It was so very good and it was a great way to end a delightful meal.
author: Mariver C.

description:
WONDERFUL SERVICE!

Came here for my boyfriend and I anniversary and the food was good-sized portions and tasty! The service was impeccable and we were treated as if we were the only couple there (it was a packed night too)! I got Willie Brown's favorite which was wonderful and my boyfriend got ravioli. The ravioli didn't impress me but it was tasty.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
This is my new favorite restaurant.  Ate here Friday night with out of town friends.  Called earlier in the day and was able to get an 8:30 reservation- other than that they were fully booked.  (Note:  at least for a weekend night you DO need a reservation.  While we were waiting for our table many walk-ins were turned away.)  

This is a small charming restaurant with wonderful food and amazing service.  I had the perfect green salad and the fettuccine with white truffle oil.  It was rich, but really wonderful.  My friends enjoyed their meals as well- the asparagus ravioli and the chicken with capers.  There were plenty of pasta options for vegetarians, which was nice.  The tiramisu is wonderful.  Cabs can be difficult to get after the meal, so ask them to call you one as you are getting ready to leave.  Otherwise it is a steep walk down to Polk St.- not fun if you are in heels and had plenty of wonderful well-priced Italian wine with your meal.

A great place to take parents to.  A great date place.  Generally a wonderful little place that is terrific value!
author: J O.

description: Amazing service.  Excellent Lobster Ravioli. Don't bother with corkage ($20) their wine is good and very reasonable
author: Chris R.

description:
Allegro Roman is an Italian restaurant in San Francisco, near Fisherman's Wharf and Van Ness side of town. It's a really small casual/ find dining (depends how you want to dress and it's really either/ or), and the owner is always around taking good care of you.

I went there with hubby on V-day, and it was the most economic v-day dinner we've ever had.  The food is not pricey at all, and it's very delicious. I think its pasta is the most popular dish. Before I went there, many of my friends were all raving about the pasta, and when I was there, I saw almost every table had at least 1 dish of pasta on top of the entre. And it's true, the pasta was GREAT!!  Especially its Fetuccini w/ white Truffle.... mmmmm..... ahhhhh... droooollllll....

I thought Allegro's meat entre was just so-so, but hubby said it was very special. He thought, many places have very tasty meat entres, but after a while, the entre becomes too greasy or, just too much. But Allegro's meat entre, in the beginning you might think it's not tasty enough, but the more you eat it, the more the taste gets in your mouth. He thought the sauce was especially great.

So, good food and more than reasonable price, what more can you ask for? 

Now, I have to give you the other side of this restaurant. The location is just awful. It is extremely hard to find parking, or maybe just b/c we went on the wrong day and time. The 1st time we went there, it was v-day but our reservation was @ 5:30pm, and it was a Wednesday. No one was home yet so there were plenty of parkings. The 2nd time we went, it was St. Paddy's day, and probably everyone was home getting drunk. OMG. We couldn't find parking for 2 frigging hours, hubby drove a manual and his left foot was cramping, and we were so hungry that we could eat our fists, so we gave up and had Chinese--com'on, fast always-- instead.  Man, you tell me that you won't give up after driving a manual in that hilly area in SF for 2 hours. And you know those cars aren't leaving b/c they are hella drunk in the house!!!

My suggestion is, you either go early on weekdays and weekends, or you take public transportation. You don't really need a reservation, but they do take it.
author: HsuMeow L.

description:
This fun little Russian Hill restaurant offers hearty, satisfying Italian food at a reasonable price.  As the other reviewers say, it's great option for dinner with parents, a date, or out of towners.  To find only three other Yelp reviews is really quite surprising.

Overall the food is good, with a few amazing items.  My favorite dish by far was the Carpaccio alla Romana (thinly sliced beef w/ shaved aged Parmesan cheese, arucola & truffle oil).  The different flavors and textures were incredible.  Other starters (Buffalo Mozzarella Caprese, Garbanzo Soup, and Bruschetta) were pleasing but did not reach that same "oh my god" status.

On to the mains, the fettuccine with the white truffle oil was the other big winner of the evening.  It was rich, creamy, and full of flavor.  I chose the lamb chops, one of the nightly specials.  The four nice-sized chops came cooked medium rare just as I like it - definitely a solid effort from the kitchen.  I also sampled the salmon, which arrived with spinach and mashed potatoes, as well as the halibut.  Again, both were solid but not spectacular.  

Dessert.  The tiramisu was nicely presented with four pieces of chocolate dipped biscotti.  A good way to end a good meal.                         

Service was engaging.  The owner complimented me for eating the lamb chops with my hands instead of struggling with a knife and fork as some suckers unfortunately do.  He also entertained questions from my mom and sister about the round mirror he purchased from Durano.  Make sure to look for it, it's a work of art.    

Almost four stars, but not quite.  Perhaps after the next visit.  I think four stars reviews are too easily given on Yelp, I too being guilty of this. 

3.5 Stars
author: Leon R.

description:
My love for this place lives beyond that of the guy who I discovered this little jewel with.

A small restaurant that's nestled at the top of the hill of the lower part of Russian Hill - just below the Broadway Tunnel - is literally stumbled upon by most new to the neighborhood. I discovered this place one late Friday night with a guy I was dating at the time. He'd gotten off work late, and while he was starving, I was good for dessert. As this place was just up the next block from my house, it made perfect sense to try. 

It was 9:30 p.m., and I figured we'd go in for a nice sherry and dessert. However, my companion needed more sustenance, so he ordered the LOBSTER AND CRAB RAVIOLIS. I was a little nervous to be ordering a main course so close to closing time, but the waiter (who turned out to be the owner) graciously accepted my date's order for his meal. Our dessert order for the Tiramisu (I'm such a HUGE fan) and Chocolate Truffle Ice Cream were placed at the same time. We also ordered a glass, each, of a nice Dry Sherry.

The raviolis came out first, and as they smelled so good, I could not help but steal a bite of one. So, delicious. Served in a lovely pink vodka sauce, it was a perfect pairing for the succulent lobster and crab. I must say, it's the BEST pink sauce I've ever tasted.

The desserts were lovely in presentation on clean white plates and accent sauces. The TIRAMISU was very good. (If you're looking for the BEST Tiramisu - check out E'Angello) The Chocolate Truffle Ice Cream was so nice and creamy. A lovely rich taste that also manages to be delicate.

The Sherry was FANTASTIC. The owner, serving us himself, brought out the bottle, and actually left it for us on the next table. It complimented the desserts quite well. I can't say I can take credit for the pairing, as we asked for a recommendation and the owner made a perfect decision.

So, having arrived near closing time (posted as 10:00 p.m.), I figured the owner or staff would give us hints and ques to hurry up. It was pleasant that they cleared tables around us, ate their group meal together - at the front of the restaurant and far from us, and finished up in the kitchen without so much as a glance in our direction. 

The staff left, and the owner approached our table at well past closing time. I figured we were to be asked to leave. To my incredible SUPRISE, we were handed a phone and informed to push TALK, then REDIAL to call his number. He lived upstairs and we were welcome to stay as long as we wanted!

WOW! Now that's service. About an hour later, we dialed our gracious host, who arrived a few minutes later to take care of the bill and let us out.

LOVELY experience. This person had no idea who we were, but treated us like old neighborhood friends. My only regret is not being able to go there more often.
author: Carrie S.

description: Such a cute & charming find! So glad we stumbled upon this a few years back. It has been our go-to place for special occasions and spontaneous stop-ins alike! Lorenzo is in charge and cares deeply for each and every guest that comes through the restaurant. This place feels like home!
author: Valentine S.

description:
I give these guys an A+ on enthusiasm, that is for sure. In this tiny little spot there is a fettuccine with white truffle sauce that is to die for, sweet Jesus and mother of God is it good.  
I will admit that I was a little freaked out when they had the entire restaurant belt out "That's Amore", but I guess that is what your Italian grandma would be into, and my friend Chloe. This place is perfect for a big group or a quiet dinner for two. Tante Grazies Giorgio!
author: Roxane S.

description: Went here last night for an anniversary dinner. The ambiance was romantic, our waiters were attentive and hilarious, the food was delicious, and I couldn't believe how reasonably priced it was. They convinced us to come back next weekend and we will. I was going to give the place 4 stars because at first I thought the host was a little saucy, but he ended up being great. He even convinced us all to dance in celebration of one party's birthday and another's anniversary. Can't wait to go back. You can only make a reservation for 6 or for 8 pm, we stayed the whole two hours and just loved it.
author: Gabriela A.

description:
Probably the best italian food in town.
If your looking for a small family run good food italian place to eat this is definitely the place.
they have great service and on top of that great food!!
i love the bruchetta and the lamb ragu ! OH and the gelato for desert is AMAZE
author: Ria J.

description:
The place had such promise - and I was SO excited to try it based on reviews and just passing by it for the past year and a half, but sadly some of the decisions that the management made ended up affecting my overall opinion - and let's be honest, the food is good - but it's not at all deserving of a five star or even four star on yelp.

First - ambience is AMAZING.  So fun, cute and everything.  Fun music, very attentive bussers, rose petals and confetti on the table - very fun.  At one point the owner even turned the music up and encouraged people to sing and dance - it was definitely fun to watch (though turning the lights completely out while we were trying to eat was definitely interesting).

So, onto the food.  First, they took forever to take our wine order.  Whatever, got over it, because we finally got it and it was for a friend's birthday so it was fine to have a leisurely italian meal.

Then, we were asked (after ordering our entrees) whether we wanted to order appetizers for the table.  We answered yes - thinking he would note how much we had all ordered as entrees and not overdo it on appetizers.  We were grossly mistaken - every single appetizer on his menu came out (aside from brsuchetta, which I would have liked...).  These were:

Asparagus w/ parmasen (OMG AMAZING you must try!)
Tomatoes with mozz and seasonings (definitely recommended)
Melon w/ proscuitto (ok - the melon was so sweet, i'm just not a fan of this dish)
Carpaccio (seemed good - not a huge fan of carpaccio)
Pate (didn't try)

Then we got entrees too.  The boyfriend and I shared the filet and the crab/lobster ravioli.  To be honest, the filet wasn't very good - stringy actually (which filets should not be) so clearly wasn't the best quality meat.  And the ravioli, though the pink sauce was excellent, was a little too fishy and therefore not fresh.

Last, and the main gripe I have about this place, is that, although it was my friend's birthday, it should ALWAYS be a restaurant's policy to check in w/ a table prior to sending non-comped desserts to the table.  ESPECIALLY if the desserts total $60!  Not impressed.  Bad business, and definitely won't be returning.
author: Jen L.

description:
Was looking for a new Italian spot in the hood' and came across this little gem. My love for food often blinds me to everything/everyone around me so I'm usually not one to rate a restaurant primarily based on service and ambiance, but this particular spot stood out for me in this case. 
Ordered: 
Carpaccio alla Romana- thinly sliced carpaccio w/shaved Parmesan cheese, arugula, and truffle oil...nice presentation and a good light starter 
Lobster Ravioli- lobster & crab stuffed ravioli in a delicious pink cream sauce...rich and creamy, yum!
Chocolate Truffle- a must for chocolate lovers
Atmosphere:
Although I wasn't a fan of the semi-cheesy celeb pics on the wall it's a nice small, cozy, dimly lit and romantic spot with scattered rose petals on tables...as much as I enjoyed the night out with dad I'm hoping to be there on a date the next time around :D
Service:
With the eccentric owner Lorenzo giving you his personal attention and the tradition of singing along to "That's amore" at the end of the night, it really makes you feel like you're having dinner at your favorite Italian uncle's house, love it!...it did make me sad to learn that I wasn't the only one to receive a rose upon leaving though, thank you Yelp for shattering my ego!!
author: Mahsa K.

description:
I really loved this place.
I went there awhile back for a going away party for my husband's best friend. It was a party of about 10 people.From what I remember the food was delicious. The service was excellent. The non-stop wine was delicious and though the place is a bit smushed, it is intimate, has rose petals, and great lighting.  The ambiance is so fabulous that we actually stayed until closing. 

Really nice.  
I did ask what kind of wine they were pouring but the waiter refused to answer my question. 

Eh! I'll be back, anyway.
author: Mira T.

description: Ok, I feel like a glutton! 3 courses were to much but everything was so good I couldn't stop. If you like truffles you will love this place. The special today was black truffle risotto which was so good. I could only finish half my New York steak because I filled up to fast. Staff was excellent too and the rose at the end was an amazing touch. I have a new favorite Italian in San Fran!
author: Sven G.

description:
I've been to Allegro Romano three times.  It's in my neighborhood so I almost felt obligated.  The service is somewhat uneven.  The owner is very genial (and an outlandish dresser) and greets almost everyone warmly.  The clientele seems to be primarily from the neighborhood (which makes sense given the location and lack of parking) which creates a nice ambiance.

The food was good but not amazing.  The sauces tend to be a little too thick, the flavors a little too bland and the presentation a little too disheveled to be great.  I don't want to sound too negative, though--there are some redeeming qualities.  Unusual specials for one as well as good sized portions.

Certainly a good option for Nob Hill dwellers but I wouldn't go too far out of the way to get there.
author: Matthew O.

description:
Allegro Romano is THE reason I joined Yelp. I wanted this restaurant to be my very first review.

I went here the middle of last year (I know, late review) with my girlfriend on a special occasion. We made reservations ahead of time because I saw how popular they are on Yelp. We were treated like VIPs and we  weren't rushed AT ALL to finish. It seemed like they wanted us to stay. My girlfriend got Willy Brown's Favorite which we thought was very good. 

A little off topic: we were the only non-Caucasians there besides the employees. Not really important but thought I'd mention it.
author: Jon D.

description:
I almost don't want to review this place so that this little gem of a place will not be revealed.

Lorenzo is AMAZING!  In the kitchen, serving wine, parking cars, singing and just being very hospitable.

I've come here several times to take clients out for dinner.  Never have I seen the menu but I'm sure one exists.  Come with a healthy appetite if you go for the tasting menu.

To Start.....  Capreses salad, salumi, beef carpaccio, melon wrapped prosciutto, salmon roe rolls, bruschetta, and asparagus w/ lots of parmesan.

Next....  Fresh tortellini pasta with alfredo sauce and truffle oil, sirloin with mashed potatoes and veggies, THEN....  sea bass a la picatta w/ garlic spinach

To finish.... tiramisu, cheesecake, key lime tart, chocolate espresso cake

All that washed down with 4 bottles of wine and Lorenzo still tops us off with a glass of port and leaves the bottle for us to free pour if we'd like some more.

I can't even begin with which one is my favorite.  Carpaccio, bruschetta, sea bass, tiramisu, key lime tart.  The entire meal was a great feast of good food, good wine, and good company.

Don't forget to sing That's Amore otherwise the song will not end.
author: Jessica C.

description: Allegro Romano is a solid, authentic Italian family restaurant. The restaurant has a strong homey, family feel. The rose pedals on the table were a little weird dining with my father, but that was my fault. Just be aware that it would be a potentially awkward choice for a business meal or otherwise non-romantic meal.
author: Geoff R.

description:
We had a group dinner here for my boyfriend's birthday and it was an absolutely lovely time. 4 stars for food, 5 stars for everything else.

We had the table in the front (note, it gets cold up front!), which was decorated with glitter and rose petals, which added to the "special occasion" feel.  The service was excellent!  Seriously, 5 stars for service.  The staff was attentive and friendly and even helped our friends find parking in the neighborhood!  I wish all restaurants did that.

On to the food -- the caprese salad was delicious and better than most places that I've been to.  The mozzarella just melts in your mouth.  We also ordered the melon and prosciutto (which was gorgeous), the bruschetta (very yum) and the salmon carpaccio (awesome -- you must order -- the salmon was basically cooked in the lemon juice and very flavorful).  Instead of oil and vinegar, they have this dipping paste -- not sure what it is, but it tastes a little of anchovies and is pretty addicting.

I started with the lobster bisque, which was rich and flavorful.  I doubled up on the lobster and ordered the special homemade fettucine with lobster, which was a bit on the salty side but otherwise, very tasty with good size chunks of lobster.  My boyfriend ordered the tortellini with white truffle oil and pesto.  I had a bite and it was also very good.

We were all stuffed so didn't order dessert, but they brought out some complimentary dessert and port for us for the birthday celebration, which I thought was a very nice touch.  

We ordered 3 bottles of wine off the menu, all of which were good and reasonably priced.

I really wish I lived in the neighborhood so I could come here more often.  The restaurant is super cute and cozy!  I would definitely recommend for a romantic night out or with a small group.
author: Mitzi C.

description:
San Francisco is a city filled with good restaurants, and this is one of the best. The food is incredible, the wine selection varied, and the complimentary additions absolutely wonderful. Also, the fettuccini in white truffle sauce should be labeled a controlled substance.

The kicker is that the food isn't the best part of going to Allegro. The service here is beyond gracious, to the point that Lorenzo went out of his way to help me find my date a parking spot. He even went so far as to move a car owned by one of the staff. Add to this the amazing dinner and the fact that every woman who walks out of Allegro leaves with a rose in hand, and you have the perfect place to go if you want to impress someone. Beyond that, it's almost cheating if you want a romantic dinner spot.
author: Ryan L.

description: Everything is so good! I had the pasta with black truffles! Delish!!!! Love this place!
author: Johanna W.

description:
Got to meet the owner! He came to the door himself at 8:30 to let me know that "he was sorry but it was a private party".   
The thing about private parties is... they like to sit together as if they know one and other. Also, You don't need to set all the tables then fill only a quarter of them. 
Nice try buddy, move your hack restaurant back down the hill where you can stay in business pissing off the tourists. There is too much good Italian in this neighborhood for that. (Frascati)
author: Brendan M.

description: Owner Lorenzo does not give a crap about his customers.  We made reservations a month in advance, then reconfirmed it a week prior to our dinner.  We took a taxi from our hotel (he dropped us off across the street of the restaurant) then walked to the front door only to find it was closed (Monday night).  Lorenzo did not bother to call us even though he had our phone number.  I called the following day and the same voice message was heard, we are closed on SUNDAYS, please leave a message for your reservation.  Apparently he decided to close for a holiday or for some other reason and didn't bother to tell his customers.  Idiota.
author: Lilikoikitchen M.

description:
It's a true shame that I haven't reviewed Allegro yet. I've been here at least three times -- most recently with my parents -- and have yet to be disappointed. It's a hidden gem.

Two caveats: We've sometimes had to wait outside, despite having a reservation (even on a weeknight) -- and the wine list is heavy on chiantis, which, tho I love Italian food, simply aren't my favorite wine.

The good news: Excellent food, good service and a great location, nestled in a non-commercial area at the near-top of Russian Hill. Try the gnocchi (like mac 'n cheese with tiny pasta pillows!), lobster ravioli or the ricotta and sage ravioli. Or, if you're in the mood for a hearty meal, try Willy Brown's favorite, the rigatoni with Italian bacon. And enjoy the cozy atmosphere:  Chef Lorenzo often shares a glass of wine and carries on conversations with the clientele.
author: Nob H.

description: It doesn't get any closer to a true Roman dining experience... Lorenzo makes you feel like like part of il familia and makes it more than another dinner out an exceptional San Francisco restaurant.  It's not hard to find a great Italian meal in SF -- dining here delivers exceptional quality food and an experience that you rarely find outside of Roma....  must try to Caesar salad (my version had fresh dungeness crab) and the truffle fettuccine, which basically had me liking the plate.  Yes, parking is next to impossible and the location is unassuming, but you're in for a treat if you make it here.... and be prepared for a three hour experience.
author: Greg B.

description: I came with my girlfriend from NYC. We've been to quite a few italian restaurants back East and this experience blows all of them away. From the ambiance to the service to the food itself, I could not have been happier. They do an incredible job here of really nailing all the components of an excellente restaurant experience and I can only agree with all the other reviews. If you are visiting from out of town, definitely check this place out!
author: jordan s.

description:
This place won me over as soon as we stepped inside.  It's a small and cozy (it holds about 50 people) restaurant at the top of Russian Hill.  The tables were candlelit with rose petals spread over them.  

The menu is small, but the food was excellent.  We started with the free bruschetta, normally I don't care for it, but this stuff was amazing.  From there we hit the asparagus appetizer which was wonderfully crisp in a buttery sauce.  I had the crab and lobster ravioli in red vodka sauce that was so good my mouth is still salivating the next day!  My boyfriend got the rigatoni (Willie Brown's Favorite) and the sauce was like nothing I've tasted before.  Truly delicious.  Our tiramisu was good, and we ended the meal with the free port.  Prices were reasonable too with appetizers around $12, pasta dishes ~$15, and meat/poultry dishes ~$23.  It was around $90 for two people including a carafe of wine.

The service was fantastic and extremely attentive.  The owner makes sure you're happy and that you're not left wanting anything.  They really make it a fantastic dining experience, and to add to that they're very generous.  The couple next to us had many many dishes and he comped their whole meal.

If you're looking for a charming, small and wonderful Italian restaurant off the beaten path then check out Allegro.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Jaime C.

description:
After the amazing reviews, I expected to be blown away.  I was genuinely hoping to discover my new favorite restaurant.  We love Italian, and it's in the 'hood.  

I have to say, Allegro Romano offers great value and outstanding food, but the overall experience was a B for me.  Service was just okay, and the tables were placed so close together that we may as well have been at dinner with both our neighbors.  I'm talking zero privacy.  

I'll definitely give it another try, because I was impressed with the food and prices.  I suspect that a week night dinner might offer an entirely different experience.  It seems like the owner is the only one that banters with guests, and he was just too busy to give us any love.  Perhaps during the week we'd get a bit more of his time and be able to enjoy the warmth this restaurant is known for.
author: nicole l.

description: I give this place great props for its service. For the first time, the service out did the food. Loved the owner/ host--not only did he take us as a walk in, but had a parking spot reserved so that we could park and dine. Anyone living in Russian Hill/ North Beach knows that this is hard to come by!  Food was pretty good-- but the hospitality was over the top... completed with more than 4 glasses of port and dessert on the house!  I would definitely go back for the fun peeps and typical italian 'mangia mangia' hospitality!
author: Nicole L.

description:
We used urban spoon iphone app to find this place. We wanted to eat Italian on Memorial Day and our local spot, Nob Hill Cafe, was closed. Urban Spoon said "94% like" which is a super high rating, so we gave it a shot.

Not only was the food amazing, I think this place has the best service and ambiance of any restaurant in the city. They were EXTREMELY attentive, warm and friendly, and our table was decorated with rose petals and confetti, making it a perfect romantic spot in a quiet part of Russian Hill. 

I had the pasta with wild boar sauce. My girlfriend had the lobster ravioli. Both dishes were super delicious. They recommended great red wines to go with both dishes. They also comped us desert and desert wine. We left a big tip as that was above and beyond the already top notch service.

Thank you Allegro Romano! Now we don't have to fly to Italy anymore :) We will be back soon!
author: Jane C.

description: I have to really hand it to Allegro Romano for helping me make one of the most special nights of my life even more perfect. I was in San Francisco for the weekend with my girlfriend and I was planning on proposing to her on Friday. At first, I planned on going up to Twin Peaks overlooking the city to actually propose, but once we got up there it was so freakin cold and windy I backed out. So I made an impromptu reservation at Allegro Romano based on some yelp reviews and when I got there I explained to the manager and waiters that I needed them to bring out the engagement ring when I requested dessert. After we had an awesome three course meal the sun finally set and the romantic vibe of the restaurant surely came to life. The rose petals and candles on the tables and the quaint cute vibe of the whole restaurant was just perfect. So, I finally requested dessert and when it was ready the waiter came to my table and said "the restroom is ready for you. Can you come with me" Ha..my gf was really confused... I get to the back where they had the ring set up on a plate surrounded by more rose petals, candle lights and some tiramisu....At that point and unexpectedly they turned off the lights to the entire restaurant, dinged a wine glass to get everyone's quiet attention and then it was my turn to walk out and ask for my girlfriend's hand in marriage in front of everyone on one knee.  Thank goodness she said "Yes" and the whole restaurant gave us quite the applause.. SO. THANK YOU ALLEGRO ROMANO for the wonderful food, the greatest waitstaff and helping me create the most perfect evening I could have ever asked for!!! This is how service should be done!
author: Andrew D.

description: This place is our new favorite when in SFO.  It's a tiny place, but so wonderful.  Service and food was top notch.  I couldn't decide on a pasta, so they gave me a little of the two dishes I was torn between and both were great!  Be sure to make reservations.   Husband had the special.  They know how to make great fish dishes as well.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Jennifer P.

description: This past Saturday a friend and I went to dinner to Allegro Romano!  I am amazed at the service, it is very family oriented, they truly made us feel welcome and they were super attentive to our needs!  Its a small place but I loved the decor and ambiance.  The food was fab, we had the "5 course meal" and I am obsessed with the food, specially the Sebass!  I certainly recomend this place, great for first dates, or seconds :)  What I am mostly impress about is the service!  Everyone there was warm & charming.
author: Gizzy S.

description: Amazingly warm service-the owner is a love, flavorful dishes & desserts that don't disappoint in a quaint Russian Hill neighborhood. Who could ask for more?
author: Eileen R.

description:
This was a great find.  My sister kept saying you must go and try it out so last week my husband and I went over for dinner.  The hostess was very nice and seated very fast and it seems like we hadn't sat down before we knew we had water on the table and rose petals.  How cute!
Small but very charming and cozy feeling.  Great date place!
author: kim m.

description: Fantastic!  A great meal in a small casual location with attentive service. None of us were disappointed in our selections.  From fresh fish to a variety of pasta dishes there is something for everyone.  I would recommend making a reservation as this place is definitely not a secret.
author: Tony M.

description: Checked this place out because of Yelpers! And it was wonderful, my husband and I will definitely go again. Service superb, food seasoned perfectly couldn't ask for a better dinner experience. We had early reservations (because I waited till Friday evening to make a Saturday reservation) 6pm. We were seated promptly and offered a choice of water. The menu had many wonderful choices and a the evening specials all sounded good. I chose from one of the evenings specials of Chilean Sea Bass served on mashed potatoes with spinach and capers with a lemon sauce. The fish was seared on the outside and moist and flaky on the inside, seasoned perfectly I didn't have to add any salt ( and I love salt) My husband had crab and lobster ravioli's in a pink vodka sauce that looked equally delectable. Oh and we had a bowl of Lobster bisque that was creamy smooth with light pieces of Lobster very tasty to start. Then we shared a piece of Tiramisu with very fresh biscotti, it was very light and finished our meal off perfectly! Our server was marvelous and I got a photo( check it out I'm the non famous one "Susan") with him, he looked stunning in his pink attire and made our evening very memorable. He also gave me a beautiful rose before I left. We also walked around the beautiful neighborhood with its breathtaking views. A really nice place to bring out of towners. The ambiance of the place was warm and inviting, its very small but cozy. If you called with enough notice there's a nice table in the window seat right in front. There's contemporary tasteful art on the walls and each table was lightly covered in the center with rose petals and confetti making it very festive. The bathroom was very clean and quite "art deco" with its mosaic mirrored walls! A overall very enjoyable experience.
author: Susan D.

description:
I met Lorenzo a few weeks ago at a function with some friends.  They all raved about him and his dining establishment. Well last night 4 of us (never been to Allegro Romano before) went at 6:30 for dinner and were very very happy when we left!
From the wine when we sat down to the dessert platter before we left, I was happy with everything that was brought to the table.
Friends, Food, Fun -- with a dose of humor thrown in by all.....
I will be back again and my friends will as well.
author: patrick d.

description:
Big points for ambiance, atmosphere.  It's in an isolated residential neighborhood so celebs can dine out on the DL.  Yes, the owner likes to work the room.

The food is average, the wine selection is very nice.  It's a pleasant, quiet experience in a crowded city.
author: Randy M.

description:
Ate at Allegro Romano this evening. WOW The food was superb the service was incredible. 
The gnocchi was as light as air and as tasty as it gets. I had the scalapini with mushrooms. Yummy. 
There were 4 of us and we got the desert sampler tray. I didn't want to do it (eat dessert) but I did. The chocolate ice cream style desert was to die for. The tirmisu was layered and looked light a cream filled brownie, until you put your fork into it. Looks can be deceiving. It was like a chocolate powder that just looked like a brownie on the top but had more flavor.
author: Josh B.

description: My friend Tim took me here because he says this place is the best Italian restaurant in SF.  After dining here I have to agree with him.  Loved the Rigatoni that is Willie's favorite.
author: Jim J.

description:
And the food kept coming...

Complimentary bruschetta to start, complimentary dessert plates (3 to be exact), and complimentary port to finish. I felt like I needed a wheelchair to roll me out of here after the obscene amount of food and wine that I consumed in my 2 hour dinner here. There was nothing special about our table of 4, but they made us feel like VIPs. 

If you know anything about Italians and their food, and more importantly the way in which they serve it, this place will make you feel like you're back in Italy. Top notch service with friendly Italian waiters. Great food and great wine.

And the best part of the night was when that got everyone in the room to sing Dean Martin's "That's Amore" at the top of their lungs as a tribute to all the mom's in the room (for Mother's Day). Didn't know that was a "Mother's Day song" but it worked. My mom was happy. Buon appetito!
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Party of four. No special occasion. 

We had the 58$ sampling menu.

Very delicious. Every course was refined and distinct. What you would have expected.

Everything was superb, the service was good.

Only thing that I will say is parking could be a bit tricky. (plan 15-30 mins for parking).
author: Joe Z.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant I have had the experience of attending in San Francisco.  I have been here twice and the food has been excellent on both occasions.  What sets this apart in my opinion is the staff and the service.  It is very small.  They are extremely polite and helpful.  

I was planning on writing a funny review, but decided that it would not be respectful of Allegro Romano.  Suffice to say that I think that this would be an excellent place to bring a girl on say a 3rd date when you are looking to impress her, you will.
author: Daniel R.

description:
For my 100th review, I wanted to review something fabulous, and my husband and my dining experience at Allegro Romano definitely fit the bill. I wish I could give this place 4.5 stars. Usually when this happens, I round up, because I just tend to be generous. But, we a hiccup with making reservations for this place, so I rounded down this time. We called early in the week to make reservations for the Saturday at 7:30. We left this on their answering machine as per the instructions recorded on the machine. We never heard back, so we called several times, hoping to get in touch with them to confirm the reservations, but no one answered. Finally, on Friday, I called again, and spoke with someone. He was really nice, but said they had no record of our reservations. Frustrating! Luckily, they had an opening at 8pm, which worked fine,  but it was not the smoothest reservation-making process. That being said... I see why this place has an overall rating of 4.5 stars. By the end of our meal, we didn't even remember the problem with the reservations!

We walked in and were allowed to pick a table from a choice of three--we chose one in the back corner, next to the window, so we were able to sit next to each other. Very romantic. The petals and sparkles on the table were a very sweet, Valentines-like touch. We brought a bottle of wine, and it was opened immediately (and poured into a decanter--wonderful!). The corkage was only $15. What a great price! We could not decide on an appetizer because we wanted to try everything truffle on the menu.  While we were deciding , they sent us out 2 pieces of bruschetta, compliments of the chef, which is always apprecaited! We settled on two appetizers--a beef carpaccio in truffle oil, which was unbelievably delicious, and the scallops with risotto with some truffle in there somewhere, which was also tastey... but we could not taste the truffle too much, which was a bit disappointing. Still, it was really yummy. 

For our entrees, we decided to split two dishes. We ordered fettuccine with truffle sauce, which honestly had the best sauce I have ever tasted ($18). I was a little concerned because it was only pasta with sauce--but the sauce was so rich and flavorful, I think adding anything else to the pasta would have taken away from this. It was so so good! We also got a special of tortellinis stuffed with white truffle in a basil pesto sauce ($18). I really enjoyed this dish, but it was difficult to taste the truffle. The pesto sauce was delicious, but overpowered the light truffle taste. Again, though, the dish was tastey. If I hadn't been expecting more truffle flavor, I would have loved it! Overall, the entrees were satisfying and SO filling! Typically, my husband can eat his own appetizer, an entree, whatever I don't finish of my entree, and dessert. This meal, somehow, filled us both up SO much. We did not even have room for dessert (which NEVER happens)!! 

After we declined dessert, they brought out the port--complimentary, of course. Uh oh, look out for the porto! My husband is not a huge fan of port, so drank his glass quickly. They immediately refilled it. I drank mine... and they refilled it. I drank some of my husband's so it would look like he was appreciating the free wine... and they refilled it. We, I kid you not, sat there for over an hour drinking porto. It was absolutely amazing, and it was so much fun. I have been to a lot of nice dinners, and cannot remember having more fun. They also brought us a complimentary dessert of strawberries and biscotti. We were so full... but somehow ate it :). 

The service was so incredible. The servers were all extremely attentive--our wine glasses and water glasses were never low or empty. They were so friendly and cheerful. Honestly, some of the best service I have experienced. The owner was also present and talkative--I really liked him. The bathroom is also nice, which is just important to note. 

Allegro Romano gave my husband and I one of the best dining experiences we have had in the city. I cannot WAIT to go back. Maybe this weekend...
author: Bridgette A.

description:
Great place, not for everyday but for that once in a while.  Price was not to bad sure a bit more then jack in the box but worth it.   Went with a small group, and of course tasted everyone's... delicious all the way around. 

Owner guy, was nice a bit rude at first once he  warmed up..was nice to deal with...  He made up for is attitude over the meal but did not feel he really was real... kinda got the euro want be, though was nice over all. 

Great for a date or when got the parents/in-laws in town... Totally a neighborhood place and will for sure be going there again.!!

Cute decorated bathroom!!
author: Danny B.

description:
How could you not love a place where every day is Valentine's Day? This place is hilarious, and such a gem! They have this classy decor that is slightly marred by rose petals and heart-shaped votives on every table, but yet it works! 

The host was wearing the most ridiculous red plaid pants , with a matching red sweater, but the service was amazing. After we finished our bottle of wine, they gave us free glasses of port, and then kept refilling them! I also think they gave the table next to us a free dessert, but maybe that was the wine talking. At one point, they gave all of the women roses as well. Too much - I loved it!

Let me not forget to comment on the food. I had sea bass, and it was scrumptious! My date had lamb, and he was very happy with it. 

Huge thumbs up for Allegro Romano!
author: Jamie C.

description: I've been to a lot of restaurants in SF. This place by far is the most welcoming and gives you the best service. Food is delicious and very reasonable. Ladies get a rose at the end of the night and a house port is complimentary. Will definitely be back - very impressed!
author: Lauren M.

description: Came here last night while my parents were in town. Everything was amazing from the rose petals on the table to the roses they gave us when we left. For the appetizer we shared the risotto with a ton of black truffels on top.  All of the entrees were amazing, but I particularly enjoyed the homemade ravioli with pesto and truffels.  The service was so friendly and the little extras they gave us really made a big impact. I will definitely be back again soon.
author: Emily M.

description:
Stellar.

This restaurant has everything that it takes to make an amazing dining experience. The pasta is incredible, fresh, and delicate like it should be, it is the best I've ever had in San Francisco. The gnocchi with Gorgonzola and the fettuccine Tartufo were the favorites of the evening. 
The restaurant is small and intimate at the top of Russian Hill. The Staff is on point our glasses were always full. I can't believe that this caliber of a restaurant lacks reviews? The owner is from Rome and flies back and forth between his family's restaurant Tre Scalini to SF. Do you know what this means? It means this is authentic food! Amazing.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
My best friend in the entire world decided that nursing school was more important than staying an economically struggling Hollister employee in San Francisco.

So to celebrate his leaving me and moving all the way to Philly we decided to get dolled up and go out to a nice Italian place with some of our closest chums.

This place was pricey (for recent Cal grads who mostly work in social services) but so great.  We were welcomed in, seated at a table festively decorated with rose-petals, and I was called 'Bella' by the stereotypically Italian waitstaff.  We opened up presents from my boy, and when mine turned out to be a pop-up book of sex, the waitstaff joined in our rowdiness.  I felt no airs of pretentiousness here, even though the price of the food could totally make this restaurant choose that type of atmosphere.

The quality of the food was good too.  For my entree I had the chicken saltimbocca, and it was grubbin.  Perfectly cooked, nicely presented.  The desserts here were also just great.

And to top it all off, they give all the ladies in the party a rose upon their departure.  (Much to the chagrin of my best friend who commented, "I am a homosexual, I should get a rose too.")
author: Becca B.

description:
Before I go into how yummy the food and great the ambiance is, two simple notes to those who will be new to the place:

1. they have a tendency to place non-comped food, not ordered by the table (like dessert) which can be quite expensive - $60!  So be sure to ask about how much it costs before you decide whether to dig in.  Saves the nasty surprise when the bill arrives.

2. Get a price on the house wine before ordering.  You would think that a carafe of house wine would be reasonably priced, but they can be pricey and it may be better to order the entire bottle of a nicer wine.

If the food were less fantastic, I would not eat here.  But truly the food is magnificent.  The best Italian I have ever had.  Perfectly al dente pasta, incredible sauces......all in all, exceptionally flavorful food.

It does have a cute ambiance with rose petals sprinkled on the white tablecloth.  And they have decent wine glasses.
author: Lev E.

description: What can I write that would give justice to what I experienced here? I had heard about this place from a friend who suggested that I check it out. He mentioned that the owner was very nice and took care of his patrons. We were a group of 6 girls celebrating another girlfriend's birthday. The place is great for a special date or a just a special dinner. The service is impeccable and the food is AMAZING. You will walk out of here simply amazed. The bruschetta and the mozzarella caprese is a great way to start the meal. I had the rigatoni (Willie Brown's favorite- yes, it was noted on the menu) which I enjoyed so much that I scarfed down the entire thing before anyone else finished their dishes. There was a moment where I looked around and wondered why I was almost done and everyone was still working. It was sinful. I also had the chance to sample the Fettuccine al Cinghiale e brodo di Porcini and the Lobster Ravioli. Both were also fantastic. You will get a great dish no matter what you get.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: A wonderful all around experience.  Delicious food and wine, great ambiance, excellent service.  Our server Oscar was delightful.  A tiny place, everyone was so friendly and helpful.  You HAVE to get the risotto-we shared it as an appetizer. It's a tough decision to choose the entree, but I don't think you can go wrong with any of them.
author: monica d.

description: Really cute, small restaurant and a nice Russian Hill location. The waitstaff is friendly and attentive. The food is fresh, well cooked and reasonably priced. The waiter brought my friend and I and extra brushcetta - so sweet!
author: Katie S.

description:
Simple, home-made Italian with very little flare (not including the owner and his outfits). Without a doubt, though, the fullest I have been upon leaving a restaurant since moving to San Francisco.
The hands-on approach of the owner and staff can be a little off-putting if you're not ready for it. By the end of the meal, however, you feel right at home (especially after they start giving out free desserts and drinks). 
May want to wear layers that you can lose as the tiny dining room is very warm- either by the owner's choice or from the combination of kitchen and body warmth. May also want to call in advance and make a reservation, especially on weekends, because of the forementioned small dining room, and the fact that a meal is a several hour affair here.
Worth trying at least once, but my preferred neighborhood Italian spot is still Ristorante Milano.
author: Justin M.

description: Finally got a chance to eat here this weekend. Overall 3-4 stars, but I'm feeling generous, so going with four. The risotto with truffle appetizer was the highlight of our meal. Generous portions, very cheesy and decadent. Tried the Bolognese and the Sole with Piccata sauce next. Overall these two were 3.5 stars - I found the fish to be a bit salty for my taste and the wild boar ragout with the Bolognese was a bit overcooked, otherwise decent. Tratufo for dessert was very good and their cappuccino at the end of the meal, along with the free port was a good close to the evening. Service was good, but felt rushed - prices were decent and the place has a nice ambience overall. It's not the best Italian meal I've had, but, overall I would certainly return
author: Anon Y.

description: Absolutely wonderful!  My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary with an over night in SF.  We had no reservations.  Just showed up at 9 p.m. and had the most delicious and memorable meal/experience.
author: kelly m.

description: Visited Italy in October, and Allegro Romano transported us right back to Rome!  Amazing food, amazing service - White Truffle Tortellini with Basil Pesto, Linguine with Fresh Halibut, Veal Scallopini with Porcini Mushrooms, and perfectly grilled sea bass with spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. Loved every bite - but the star of the meal was the special Risotto with Black Truffles that we shared as an appetizer. Mouth Watering!! Can't wait to go back!! Thanks Lorenzo and staff!
author: Mama D.

description:
It all about the experience.  Yes, the food is great but the service and hospitality is unmatched.  Lorenzo treats all of this guest like family.  When you dine at Allegro make sure you have time to take in the experience.....if you are expecting to eat and leave then you are missing half of the evening.  Sit back, relax and enjoy---this is about as close to perfection that SF has to offer when it comes to a true Italian Ristorante.

If you are with a large group order family style and enjoy a vast array of antipasto, pasta and succulent deserts and wines.
author: Solbiato S.

description:
Easily my favorite italian restaurant.  I love the taster menu, everything is amazing on it.  The atmosphere makes you feel like a regular. 

I suggest the carpaccio and the asparagas.  WOW!

Sadly it has become more widely known and becoming difficult to get a reservation for prime times.
author: Chris S.

description: I heard about this place some months (or maybe it was a year?) ago from non other than the owner himself. I won't get into the specifics of our chance (and slightly comical) meeting, I will say that I gave him a major side eye when he told me (with a thick Italian accent), "I run little Italian restaurant in San Francisco called Allegro. Allegro Romano. " Well, last night me and the girls decided to give his "little Italian restaurant" a try (and it is indeed little, hella little. Do make reservations). Suffice it to say, that major side eye I threw him so many months ago turned into a bug eye as I started off my meal with the Crepes al Caviar and Salmon. All I can say about them is that they are THEBOMB.COM! Everything we ordered was so dayum tasty. From the Rigatoni Pasta with Foie Gras (better get yours before the July 1st CA. foie gras ban) to the tiny biscotti that came with our homemade gelato; everything was a hit. Absolutely no misses. And we weren't the only ones who thought so. The man at the table next to us spent most of his meal moaning and panting about how good it was. The parking of course is a nightmare, the place overall is a bit cramped, and the pic of the owner with Brad Pitt taped on the front window is a bit tacky, but after you've parked and settled in, you will not be disappointed.
author: Mia H.

description: This place is magical.  I had an amazing birthday meal here with fabulous food and personable, excellent service.
author: Jason C.

description: Hands down one of the best places in the city! If you like good service, then you will like Allegro. Go figure out what you like about the menu on your own. There will be something on the menu that you like. If you don't like Allegro afterwards that is fine... but you will.... oh how you will.
author: Bruceroff U.

description: Allegro Romano is where we come for very special evenings (although we should come more often since it's close to where we live and reasonably priced). This time, we came to celebrate our 3 year dating anniversary and our wedding, which was this past weekend. As always, we had an amazing dining experience. The wait staff was so attentive and engaging, the food amazing and the ambiance very inviting. The staff has this uncanny ability to make each of their patrons feel like the most important person there (which I am a big fan of, by the way). I absolutely adore this place and encourage everyone to come here if you're looking for an exceptional dining experience. While on the romantic side, there were certainly non-couples there too. Lorenzo you are bellisimo!
author: Sadia J.

description: This place is a gem. Dined there with friends a few days ago and was totally blown away by fantastic experience. Kudos to the Chef and owner Lorenzo. He is quite a personality and very passionate about his restaurant. This is probably one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to outside Italy. The food, wine, ambience, service, even prices- everything was great. I rarely write rave reviews, but this one is totally worth it. They use freshest, mostly local ingredients, with some Italian imports. We had bruschetta, beef carpaccio, asparagus with pecorino and parmesan butter sauce, and caesar salad with Dungeness crab meat (a nod to Northern California cuisine) for starters- all very good. Carpaccio was just the right balance of paper thin Black Angus beef, fresh arugula, aged parmesan and olive with a dash of truffle. Ask for their special (not on the menu)- home made fettuccine with generously shaved fresh white Piedmont truffle, it was fabulous. I love truffles and this was a real deal. They shave it right in front of you, but you may not be able to get it every day (only when Lorenzo has fresh supply). It's more expensive than other pasta dishes, but is totally worth it. Also tried lobster ravioli with vodka pink sauce- very delicate flavor. House wines are decent quality Pinot Grigio (i think they have other varietals as well) and Chianti, served in a carafe. Leave some room for desserts, they are equally amazing. We had homemade tiramisu. Finished off with biscotti and port on the house, and espresso. Grazie mille, Lorenzo. We'll definitely be back.
author: Robert L.

description:
Their creamy pasta dish (forgot what it was called, i think it was fettuccine alfredo) was the best pasta I've had in a few years. I went to a friend's birthday party here and ever since, I've been looking for a spot in my calendar to go back. And yeah, the owner was very hospitable and colorful.

One thing I do want to mention, though, is that it gets a little hot in the restaurant in the event of a freak heat wave.
author: Joon L.

description:
Wow!  What can I say?  My daughters and I were in San Francisco for one night and selected Allegro Romano based on Yelp!  It was AWESOME and the staff were even better. Probably one of the best experiences I have had anywhere for dinner (that I can recall).  Oh yes, the food was superb on every level.  

I highly recommend this to anyone who wants good food and excellent staff service!

I will visit everytime I return to SF......  (please go!)
author: Sara D.

description: Awesome food. Small place but very fun. The food was great and so was the staff. I would go back any time. Best place in the city and great prices.
author: Peter P.

description: Can't say anything that others haven't already said a zillion times. I wish I could give this place six stars. They make everyone feel like a regular.
author: Josh O.

description:
I've tried this place 2 or 3 times in the last 2 and half years, and have to admit that I won't be a regular there. But I soooooo wanted to, since they look like such a cozy, charming neighborhood place! Despite my best intentions, I'd still have to say NOPE.

The food is simply not very good; not that it's bad, but just not good enough to draw one back since SF has so many great eateries. Last time I was there, everything was so salty, you'd think they bought too much salt coz it was on sale!

Would give them 2-star for the food alone, but since the waiting staff were genuinely nice, it's a 3, for me at least. But not going back there for sure.
author: j c.

description: The owner is a little bit schtick-y, but the food is *excellent*. The ambiance is a bit heavy on the "that's amore" type of italian schtick, but you cannot go wrong with the scallop polenta. Huge fan, will definitely go back.
author: Evan M.

description: Found this place via Yelp and couldn't resist all the 5 star ratings, so we booked dinner for two for our Anniversary dinner while we were in town visiting. Very cute place, although there's a definite cheesy factor. Rose petals strewn across the table with confetti pieces...Eh... The food was pretty good though, and the service was great. Not the best food by far, but worth checking out if you're in town and want a romantic atmosphere. If they did away with some of the cheesiness, it would be better! I guess being from New York originally, I can't compare many Italian restaurants to places there, so maybe I'm being a little harsh. The best part was definitely the dessert - Don't miss the Tartuffo, that was surely 5 stars! The manager (owner?) was nice, and he offered to get us a cab when leaving, but when we actually left, he was nowhere to be found and there were no cabs waiting. Oh well... We found one eventually, but I thought that was strange!
author: Kait B.

description:
I don't know what all of the 5 stars are about with this restaurant. The only reason I gave them one star is because I can't write a review with NO stars.  I gave this place several chances, with several different friends, and we all found the food GROSSLY mediocre.  Certainly NOTHING to rave about.  The last time, I had soggy Bruschetta, overcooked asparagus, and a rather tasteless Capesante Tartufate.
You would be FAR better off spending your money in North Beach, or even downtown at Perbacco's.
author: J S.

description:
I just ate here tonight after reading the reviews. It's my last night of visiting from out of town and I wanted something quaint and local that wasn't a tourist hot spot or a $7 grill. 

Allegro hit the spot in many ways. I called ahead and the owner said the place was full, but said okay when I mentioned I was just one. I showed up a tad early and had to wait 8-9 minutes for a table to open. Waiting is awkward because there is NO room in this place. It's literally a long living room turned into a restaurant. So I had to stand by the front door like an uninvited guest at a party for a little while. But I was a tad early after all and a table did open up so he kept his word about being busy, but being able to get me in.

After reading all the reviews I was a little paranoid that they would hover over me trying to stuff massive amounts of food down my throat. (I hate that)  It ended up not being the case for me. I was given all the little extras that people mention and it was nice, but these are small things and not over whelming by any means. I ordered the lobster & Crab Ravioli and the portion was perfect. Not too much, not too little. It was a great meal. The sauce and flavor were delicious. I cleaned my plate and started soaking up the sauce with the extra bread. 

The owner buzzed about the room just like everyone mentions. I thought it was charming and he didn't seem to be over bearing. I was nearly completely ignored by comparison to the other tables which I found interesting. I don't know if it was because I was a lone diner or maybe he doesn't like tall bald white guys :) I wouldn't have minded accept for the fact that it got a little ridiculous to where I was feeling like a ghost waiting for my check.

Overall, I would go back and I would recommend this place to others for sure. It's a unique find indeed.

I say again, this place is small. Don't try to come with more than 6. 2-4 is your best bet.
author: Matt T.

description:
We had a wonderful experience here. Parking was an issue initially so they arranged a parking place for us.  We got seated immediately upon arrival, consistent with our 6:00 reservation. The service was second to none. The owner actually played with our baby, showing her off to other guests, while we enjoyed our dinner. 

The food was amazing. We had the rigatoni and the risotto w/ scallops.   Both dishes were great but the risotto was outstanding.
