Also the lobster bisque and asparagus appetizers were very good.After dinner they brought out a complimentary dessert that was also very good and a rose for my wife. The servers and owner were all very kind and helpful. The whole experience was unique, intimate and enjoyable.   Such a perfect place for a special occasion or just a date night.  The restaurant is very small and intimate.  We will definitely go back!

Sidenote: I feel like we were a bit under dressed.   Business casual would be appropriate.
author: randy P.

description: Allegro Romano seemed kind of average at first, but by the end of the meal, I was totally impressed.  The service is amazing.  My water glass never reached the halfway point without the little water guy zooming over to refill it.  It seemed like we had five waiters with the attention to detail and how smoothly everything went.  We had a delicious salmon/caviar appetizer, and our entrees were both excellent.  In addition to the dessert we ordered, they give you strawberries and biscotti and port (like...all the port you can drink...) to go with it.  The music is nice, the lights are very low, and even though we were there for a long time, we never felt rushed or like we were waiting for anything.
author: Katie D.

description:
OK, so I just got home from this place, and I'm still a little tipsy from the free port they gave me with my dessert, but I'm pretty sure I'd be a fan of this place anyway, so I felt compelled to write this at once.

My girlfriend and I went and had a delightful meal as follows:
prosciutto e melone; caprese; lobster ravioli; wild boar ragu w/ fettucini; scallopini w/ porcini mushrooms; a bottle of wine to split; another glass of wine each; some port; a decaf cappuccino; and a tiramisu to split for good measure.  At no point did we feel rushed.  At no point were we pressured to order our next course.  At no point did we not thoroughly enjoy ourselves.  Add to that the fact that our entire bill came to $89/each, plus tip (which we decided should be at least 25%, rounded up) and I was starting to be seriously impressed.  We both rolled out for $114 each, or $30/hour, or $0.00035 per calorie - a bargain by any measure.  All of it was delicious, though for me the stand-out was the tiramisu.  Seriously not to be missed.  I'm not sure if it was the wine that preceded it, but I was just looking about the table wide-eyed throughout the dessert course, deciding whether my next move should be toward the tiramisu, cappuccino, or port.  (Spoiler alert: I was never unhappy with my decision, nor could I have been.)

But what really made me love this place wasn't the food, nor the value, nor the adorable waiter.  What made me love this place was that, for a little over 3 hours, I felt like I was in Italy again.  By American standards, the service is just so-so.  Don't expect to have your food cleared the second you're done, and don't expect the order for your next course to be taken the second you look up for a waiter (though for patrons who'd prefer it, the staff seemed to catch that vibe quickly).  By Italian standards, the service was perfect.

At the end of our meal, the owner helped me and my friend on with our coats, gave us 2 roses each (since we'd not been given one while still seated) and offered to hail us cabs.  Chivalry is not dead.  God bless America (and by that, I apparently mean Italy).
author: Emy D.

description:
Above and beyond!  This place is a teeny tiny lil spot with no pretension.  The food was totally delish, and the ambiance was just what I was after.  My lover and had never been here before, but were looking for a quaint and intimate place to celebrate our 4th wedding anniversary!!!  I came across Allegro randomly and could not have been happier with our evening.
  As I mentioned we were celebrating, but had not announced our anniversary to the restaurant in hopes of getting something for free or special treatment, yet ALL we got was special treatment.  The owner was dressed to impress and helped us a choose a phenomenal wine for dinner.  The service was impeccable with my water glass never empty,  and when my lover gave me his anniversary gift, our waiter discreetly leaned in to ask the occasion, and later surprised us with a complimentary desert, perfect glasses of port, and even a rose for me.  Could this place be any more precious??!?!?!?!?
  We plan on going back for sure, and not just for special occasions, this place does everything right, and I would highly recommend Allegro to anyone!!
author: Alicia Claire H.

description: Nice italian neighborhood spot, good food and great wait-staff!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Extremely rude maitre'd and over-wrought atmosphere...methinks not.
author: S J.

description:
My girlfriend had the fettuccini with white truffle sauce.  I'm glad she let me have a few bites, it was amazing.

I had the Scaloppini con porcini.  It wasn't as good as her fettuccini, but was STILL really good.  They gave us free biscotti and helped us find a cab.

Awesome.
author: Dan H.

description: We chose this restaurant because it was very close to where we were staying in Russian Hill during a recent visit to the city. While the staff could not have been more welcoming and friendly, the food  was disappointing.  To start, the bread was unimpressive and the suggested dipping oil should be avoided.   The spinach salad with bacon was heavy and overkill on the cheese.   We ordered the pasta alla amatriciana which was al dente but over-sauced.  This dish traditionally uses pancetta, but I suspect bacon was used instead and the pasta was drowned in sauce, American style.  Every dish was served with a heavy sprinkling of parsley, which was out of character for allegedly Roman-style Italian food. The scallopini was tough, thick, and tasted like cleanser.  It was unclear whether it was chicken or veal.  The menu is confused and offers a smattering of American favorites and does not offer any well-executed classic Roman dishes.  Save your money and go to Rome.
author: Erika T.

description:
so there we were.... wandering down Hyde street. we thought would probably just hit up Luella when..... the stars just suddenly aligned and fate stepped in.

there it was, just sitting there. the most charming place ever. Allegro Romano.

BTW, this is my new favorite restaurant. *be prepared for possible gushing*

you walk in and are immediately greeted by Lorenzo the owner who treats you like he's welcoming you into his home. he's a very funny and passionate italian man who bends over backwards to make sure your experience is perfection. 

its very tiny, cute and  pure coziness. fresh rose petals sprinkled on our table, frank Sinatra was playing and Lorenzo walked around talking to people and pouring wine. admittedly, at first i felt there was little cheesiness to the whole overly-romantic atmosphere, but then i later decided that's what i loved the most. 

the menu did not disappoint either. we started with the carpaccio and then both ordered the lobster/crab ravioli..... the ravioli had this amazing pink vodka sauce that was to die for. i'm not a fan of sweets and never get dessert but aaron ordered the chocolate truffle and insisted i try a bite. since i had drank a lot of wine i complied..... mmm

i could tell there were a lot of regulars in here because as if on cue, lorenzo then led (without anyone batting an eye) the entire restaurant in a group sing-a-long of That's Amore. being the queen of karaoke, i had no problem joining in. some people actually got up to dance, i'm not even kidding. totally hilarious.  

by this time the port came out.... and Lorenzo made sure everyone's glass was full. i started to feel a bit toasty from the port and judging by the loud volume of laughter in there so was everyone else. eventually the fun had to end though....  aaron and I had to get back to his house for a little party he was having. we didn't want to leave, it was difficult.
  
a hundred million stars for Lorenzo and his precious little place.... outstanding food and a great time! I don't think I've ever dined at a restaurant with so much personality in my entire life.

GUYS: if you're looking for a quiet, private dining experience this may not be the place to bring a date.... but otherwise exquisitely romantic in that fun, cheesy way. trust me.
author: Michelle I.

description:
Had my birthday dinner at Allegro Romano last night.   The reviews on Yelp were glowing, and I was excited about having a wonderful celebratory dinner with my sweetheart.  First off, Lorenzo is terrific.  After circling the restaurant (desperately looking for parking), we pulled into the next-door neighbor's driveway to let the restaurant know we were searching for a parking space.  The neighbor graciously let us park in her driveway and Lorenzo volunteered to move our car when the neighbor needed to get into their garage.  What service!  I was amazed and thrilled at this kind of attention.  Yes, Lorenzo is a master in front of the house.  Unfortunately, I wish he had spent time in the back of the house....
We started off with their classc ceasar salad with dungeness crab meat.  The salad was served too cold, masking the taste of the crab and the dressing.  We had high hopes for the Scaloppini con Porcini, which contrary to the menu description, was not "a piece of heaven".  The sauce was salty, the mushrooms rubbery, and the veal tough.   Tiramisu for dessert was forgettable, 'though I must say the gratis after-dinner port was a nice touch.
So, all in all, I wish the food would have matched  Lorenzo's enthusiasm.
author: Dennis S.

description: Food is decent, would warrant a 3 star rating if the owner didn't stalk and harass anyone who doesn't provide a glowing review.
author: Justin O.

description:
My wife and I were in San Francisco to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. We have had bad luck with Italian restaurants for months but decided to try Allegro Romano based on some friends recommendation. 

We had an 8 o'clock reservation but got there extremely early. I expected to wait especially after seeing how small this place was (11 or 12 tables). Lorenzo, whom despite reading some negative reviews on here after the fact, was very nice and sat us right away. The menu is not very large but they appear to make everything very well. 

For appetizer I ordered the Cesar salad with Dungeness Crab which was very good. The crab was fresh and the salad was very enjoyable. If I had any recommendation would be to add slightly more dressing to the salad. This is my only "negative" comment. 

My entree was homemade tortellini with a pesto sauce and truffle oil. Amazingly good! There is no replacement for homemade pasta and the sauce was incredible. 

For dessert I ordered Tiramisu which was so light and refreshing. Incredible! 

I am a very picky person when it comes to food and eating out. Not only does the food have to be enjoyable, but the service has to be great as well. I don't mind mistakes as long as they are acknowledged and taken care of. Luckily there were no mistakes and we received plenty of attention. Only 12 tables in the place and 5 people working those tables. 

After the meal the waiter brought over some port for my wife and I. After that glass, came another glass, and another, and another. You get the idea. I stopped at 7 glasses and they would have given me more if I didn't stop them. All of this was on the house. Also included was another dessert which was homemade biscotti's with strawberries and cream. After I informed the crew of my pleasant experience and informed them it was our anniversary, out came another dessert. 

Anytime I have a great time from top to bottom, I have to write about it.
author: Raymond S.

description:
allegro romano is a very small restaurant with lots of charm.  i just went here with a large party to celebrate a significant event, and the service of the wait staff was fantastic.  the pastas and apps were all delicious, and all in all, it was a good experience.

only bummer was the owner.  he tried to rush us out to accomodate the next party, but our server allowed us to enjoy a leisurely meal.  it's strange that the servers understand customer service better than the owner.  

lots of photos of celebrities adorn the walls, which is a little cheesy.  it's a good thing they have good food.
author: jon p.

description: I would hardly call this place romantic, we were packed in there like sardines, they even had to move the tables to let folks in and out.  First and last time at this place the food so so nothing to write home about.   The decor much to be desired, needs some help that is for sure.  The Caesar salad with BROWN crab meat?
author: Debbie M.

description: My wife and I had a spectacular dinner here. The restaurant has about 13 tables so you will need reservations. The food is extremely fresh. Not hidden in deep strong sauces but an awesome blend of mild fresh flavours that work excellent together. The service is amazing as well. I used to work in fine dining restaurants and it is refreshing to see some folks still understand how to deliver excellent service.
author: Roger N.

description: Visited in October from New Orleans.  Fairmont Nob Hill recommended this place for us.  When we go out of town it is really hard to find places to eat that can stand up to what we are used too.  Owner and the waiters made sure we were comfortable.  Sat in window table.   Pasta with Lobster tails was delicious!!!!!!!  Will definitely return!
author: Gina R.

description: Lorenzo won't let you ride his motorcycles (he seems to have at least a dozen in assorted colors). Other than that, he can do no wrong! Everything about his restaurant, Allegro Romano, is wonderful. Great for dates, business dinners, you name it; you can't go wide of the mark! The food is stellar, service flawless, ambiance romantic yet sophisticated, Go, enjoy, and return many times.
author: Joe M.

description:
I very seldom write reviews; however, I wanted to share Allegro Romano. I found this restaurant on Yelp and we really loved it.  My wife and I are not gourmets but my wife is very particular, knows what she likes and tends to be a bit critical. There are not many restaurants that she states emphatically that she would definitely come back. Allegro Romano is now on that short list for sure. Our first two courses were spectacular. The Caesar salad with crabmeat was outstanding. Generous amount of crab, crisp lettuce. Very tasty. The appetizer size risoto with black truffles was beyond belief. I have walked throughout Umbria and eaten the local truffle dishes in Norcia. This was better. As I said, I am no gourmet but the richness of this dish was incomparable. If we stopped here it would be 5 star all the way. For our four friends it was. They had the Branzino, red snapper and Dover sole. My wife and I had the veal. I had veal scalopini which was tasty but the veal was just a tiny bit tough. I do not blame the chef because the price was very fair for this veal. It did not chew as a top cut (but it was not priced as such).  The flavor was good. My wife had the veal with the porcini mushrooms. She did not comment on the texture but she did say the sauce was not very distinctive; it lacked a little character.   She felt it needed something more to enhance the veal.  There was a very nice wine list but our group was not real drinkers so we had a modest bottle of pinot grigio which was fine.  Next time, more serious wines.

Now about the ambience and staff.   The restaurant is located in a residential area.  It is cozy and probably seats about 35 people.  It is a welcoming place and even when full is not overly noisy.  The staff was wonderful; gracious and very accommodating.  We had this wonderful table in the front window. The table decor with the rose pedals was a lovely touch. The intimacy of the restaurant was a big plus and the bathroom was different and fun (as bathrooms go). Again, wonderful staff; wonderful ambience; good to great food.  Well priced.  We will be back.
author: Alan P.

description: Fantastic place!!!  Went with a group and it was still a great experience.  Didn't feel cramped (it is a smaller restaurant) even with the endless appetizer platters that kept coming out.  The service was great and food was good too.  You do feel like you're in some smaller restaurant in Italy.  Very neighborhoody.  I totally recommend this place.  I'm coming back with my parents!
author: Kirsten M.

description: Small, very intimate, dim lit restaurant with great food. Nothing I ate was mediocre or just OK. All of it was awesome. Service is superb. My water glass and wine glass was never empty. They pay close attention to you. Guys, if you're looking to impress the lady friend (or boyfriend, whatever your preference is) with a great dinner, come to this place.  Try the Carpaccio alla Romana for a quick appetizer. All women leave with a rose from the restaurant.  Five stars all the way.
author: Carlos P.

description: A good place for groups like a bday party.  The staff here is very friendly and boisterous.  Things here are served family style for sharing.  Apple is a firm believer in family style sharing when it comes to eating.  Why eat something if everyone can't enjoy it?  There are many dishes here like pasta and fish.  Everything is very rich so come prepared to indulge.
author: apple r.

description: We dined at Allegro Romano on Thursday night, May 31st. A celebration for a family birthday and August wedding. Wonderful service, food and ambiance made our evening a memory that we will remember for years to come. Perfection on all counts. Thank you, Thank you! Terry F, Grass Valley, Ca
author: Terry F.

description: I happen to go here after a recommended restaurant from the fairmont hotel and what a disappointment especially after reading all these good reviews!!!!!!!!! First off my friends and i walk in and its superrrrrrrrrrrr tiny its ridiculous! All the waiters and waitresses were on top of our shoulders not allowing us to breathe or move without feeling like they were watching and judging our every single move!!!!! And this lorenzo guy is absolutely horrible!!!! NOt only did he not welcome us into the restaurant but he was very rude, giving dirty looks, huffing and puffing at us and demanding our children to sit with major attitude!!! he was whispering and pointing at us like he just wanted us to get the hell out of his restauarant because we were a party of 7! and when the food came it was alllrrriiighhhht nothing spectacular at all!! it was also very obvious they were trying to clean the table so quick and refill our drinks so fast and inclduing themselves in our conversations it was just the worst experience i have had thus far in san francisco! And get this when we asked for the check the waitress literally shoved the check right under my face before i even finished asking for it!!!!!!!! I was shocked i just wanted to get the hell out of there! So as we are getting off the table to leave the coke spilled on the table and came on to my helmut lang pants!! I then started wiping and all i hear is LORENZO the sleezeball laughing and pointing with this waiters saying ahhahahahah me gusta me gusta! Honestly this place was so bad from the moment we walked and not being greeted or even a simple smile to the moment we were pretty much kicked out of the door! I was so humiliated and so scared they even might of put stuff in our food! save yourself the discomfort and embarrassment and DO not go to this "authentic" JOKE of a restauarant!
author: Nessy N.

description:
Along with Kevin S. and Amanda F. (see their reviews) I've been getting harassing emails from the owner - bizarre, unprofessional ones at that! So that you can see what he's really like, I'm posting them here.  (I'd almost be insulted about his "McDonald's" line if it didn't make me  laugh so much!)

(Update: Looks like Kevin S.'s review was taken down - apparently the owner succeeded in getting Yelp to filter their reviews!)

First email:
They aer the best ,and they dont have unhappy (MCDONALDS)ppl like u as clients.
Take off your review pls.

Second email:
I am happy u are not comming @ Allegro because we dont like mad and unhappy ppl,like u write in your riview
author: P P.

description:
This place is extremely adorable and located away from the cities hustle and bustle. My cousin frequents this place and highly recommended that my friends and I go here when we visit SF. We made reservations and were pleasantly surprised but the quaintness of the place. The waitstaff was beyond accommodating. I ordered the Lobster and Crab Ravioli with butter sage sauce of sorts. I was in Love! This dish had so much flavor. I did taste my friends dishes and they were also very very good. They have a small menu, but I feel that is so they can focus and make the ones on the menu perfect. We ordered dessert and I usually do not care for Tiramisu, but we got it and I devoured it. I was in shock that I even took the 2nd bite. It was so light and fluffy and full of many flavors that I could not help myself. 
After that meal, I was completely satisfied and cannot wait to go back! The roses at the end is always a nice touch. Also, they ask if we need a cab back to the city and will call it for you as well. So you are not trying to flag one down.
author: Rona D.

description: My friend and I live a couple blocks away and wanted to celebrate our birthdays. She left a message three days before asking for a 7.00 pm reservation. She then called the day before to confirm, but was told there was only an 8.00 pm slot. No problem for us, so we show up. I was a bit suspicious when I saw all the photos of famous people who have eaten there, but thought, well the owner probably likes to bask in the reflected glory of the celebrities. We show up, and there is no reservation. There was no "sorry, we will see what we can do", or anything of the sort. Some guy in a t-shirt with a shaved head (kind of Mission wannabe) seemed to be in charge, and completely ignored us. The poor hostess was out of her league, dealing with such a jerk. We finally left and went to Rue St Jacques at Taylor and Jackson. it was excellent - warm greeting, great food (try the beef!) and a small bet very well chosen wine list with several good choices at moderate prices. Initially I was very disappointed with Allegro Romano, but Rue St. Jacques more than made up for it.  Also in the neighborhood is Venticello, a fun Northern Italian place, and the Nob Hill Cafe, consistently good food in a casual setting. ONE WEEK LATER - This guy is a complete crackpot! Today he sent me an illegible email ranting, dropping names (misspelled) of people who have never eaten there or heard of him. I talked to a couple of people in our neighborhood who basically said "Oh yeah, that's how it can be there - why didn't you ask us before you went?". Lesson learned. SEPTEMBER 29 - Now he is calling my co-workers and leaving unintelligible messages. Jeez, man, just leave it alone.
author: Charles S.

description:
I can not say enough great things about Allegro. What a neighborhood gem!! Lorenzo really goes above & beyond. He makes you feel welcomed immediately, as if it's his home. The service is spectacular and the food is fabulous!! Brought me right back to Italy on my honeymoon:) He told us his family owns a restaurant in Rome, and I'm sure that many of his recipes come straight from there. 

I really can't wait until I can go back!! Great, great, great restaurant!!!
author: Valentine S.

description: This *itty bitty* neighborhood spot boasts huge hospitality and flavor.  A Russian Hill gem that does a good job remaining a secret. The menu is full of simple Italian fare that is prepared with attention to detail.  My salmon had a yummy seared crust that gave way to buttery fish cooked to perfection.  The Tiramisu that is supposed to be one of the best in SF would be hard to rival.  The dining room is an intimate setting - I felt like I had been invited over to dinner at someone's house.  If you're looking for romantic - the white table cloths with randomly scattered rose petals will do the trick.  Fusae is a sweet host who genuinely wants her guests to feel welcomed and satisfied with great food.
author: Laura S.

description: First off I want to say the service was awesome. The waiters were attentive and friendly. So my bf and I went here for his birthday dinner. I loved that it was walking distance from his house. I called for reservations a couple days before, but a few hours before the reservation had to push it back an hour. We arrived around 7:30 and  seated down immediately. The waiter gave us the specials which were artichoke and fish, but unfortunately my bf is allergic to fish. We ordered the artichoke, beef carpaccio alla Romana (13.50), lobster ravioli (18.50), Fettuccine with Wild Boar Bolognese and Porcini Mushrooms(15), gelato covered with chocholate chips, and tiramisu. Also we had two glasses of wine. I really enjoyed the thinly slices of beef because it just melted in your mouth. I liked the lobster ravioli, but I don't think I would get it again. My bf really liked his boar pasta dish and said he was craving it later that night. Overall we loved this quaint little restaurant and cannot wait to try some of their other dishes. Oh! to top off the night they gave us some free dessert wine and a rose.
author: Stephanie L.

description: This cozy Italian restaurant features a small menu of pastas and entrees. I had the rigatoni that was billed as "Willie Brown's favorite." The sauce was better than the pasta itself. Much better was the gnocchi that my girlfriend ordered. It was perfect, the best in the City, she claimed. The restaurant featured service that might have reminded me of my Italian grandmother, except I don't have an Italian grandmother. I did have a waiter who couldn't stop refilling my port glass after the meal. All the port you can drink is a novel concept, but one glass really does the trick.
author: Timothy O.

description: This is, hands down, the best place I have ever been to!  The owner is wonderful, always knows what wine we want.  He makes me feel like a VIP even though we've only been there twice.  I will continue to go here.  The food is so delicious, the staff is very helpful and attentive.  Try it, you'll like it.  Oh, and the outfits!  So wonderful!
author: Meghan B.

description: Lorenzo is the best proprietor and a great neighbor. Dinner is always a treat and very intimate.
author: Henry F.

description: This is a very quaint and intimate restaurant. The service staff is friendly and quite good. The menu is somewhat extensive and caters to most everyone's palette. They do something I like: they tell you the specials as they hand you the menu. This way you are able to weigh all your options equally without the possibility of having to later revise your decision. It's not as dressy as professed by the ad.  With all that, they did fall short on one thing: they failed to check whether we indeed did want dessert. They told us what they had on hand, walked away and the next thing we know we were handed the check. No "have you decided what you'd like for dessert?" or anything of the sort. Other than that, the experience was lovely and hope next time, we'll get to try their dessert.  Oh, every lady patron received a rose as they left, which is a very nice touch.
author: Matt G.

description: Allegro Romano has always been one of my all time favorites in San Francisco. I used to live  1/2 a block away and was spoiled by not having to look for street parking - which can be a hassle. Lorenzo is a great host and their white truffle fettuccini is to die for. The only room for improvement would be to give the customers a bit more breathing room as the tables are closely set and it's easy to feel like your intimate party of two has grown to include the couple on your left and party of four on your right. On the flip side, if it means I will be seated sooner I guess I can live with it...
author: J P.

description: We were very lucky to score a last-minute reservation for 3 people at 7pm on a warm weeknight.  After Lorenzo seated us (and we figured out that you only need to interact with Lorenzo -- not the other staff) we tucked into one of the best Italian meals I've enjoyed in SF.  Lorenzo is the real thing -- hailing from Rome, where his twin brother still runs a restaurant -- he is a former chef and current all-around great guy.  As a manager, he is attentive, helpful and honest about his food and wine.  A great place -- just make your reservation well in advance and bring your appetite.
author: Paul L.

description: I really want to give 3.5 stars for this place,but cant really give it a 4.  This place is really teenie, but that is definitely part of the charm.  Gotta be honest, I am easily swayed by free stuff ie brushetta to begin.  That was a bonus in my book!  However, I purchased the mixed greens which tasted pretty horrible, and I'm not really sure how you make mixed greens taste horrible.  My husband had the filet, which was good..I enjoyed it, I had the lobster/crab ravioli which was great, but gotta be honest, didn't really taste much lobster or crab.  I loved it, but it tasted more like just regular ravioli.  At the end we were given some more free food, biscotti, and that made me happy again.  SO, free foods makes u forget about some of the not the greatest food.  Still good, and since its in the hood ill prolly go back, but do not feel a HUGE desire.
author: Jaime C.

description:
ate there last night.  YUMMY!  liked the ravioli with pink vodka sauce and the risotto with scallops.  We brought our own wine: $15 corkage.  nice ambiance - perfect for a date, plus the entrees are definitely affordable.
ps - Bob Saget was there.
author: Susie G.

description: Hidden in a quiet neighborhood in Russian Hill, this quaint little restaurant is one of the city's best Italian restaurants!!!  Lorenzo the owner is quite a character.  You'll know what I mean if you decide to go there.  Their food is absolutely amazing ... spaghetti in carbonara and white truffle sauce is to die for!  Try their tasting menu: asparagus with parmesan, bruchetta, spaghetti with white truffle sauce, scaloppino with mushrooms, port, etc.... I'll definitely go back for more.
author: TK W.

description: Yes, yes, and yes! Visiting from San Diego (where there's no such thing as service) I went to Yelp for help in selecting a great dining experience. Yelp came through again! Allegro's not only boasts good food, fun and great service, but its an exceptional value. They included bruschetta, dessert and port as well with our dinner! The owner had (no Cavalli...True Religion tonight) the place singing, drinking and in great spirits. Apparently Sade dined there a few weeks prior..the owner was on a Sade kick.I do recommend making reservations as its a cozy place.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I've heard so many good things about Allegro, a group of us decided to have a friend's birthday dinner there. First off the place is in the Russian Hill neighborhood, and had I not heard about it thru a friend, would probably never have passed it or eaten here. The dining area is small and may seat only about 40 or so people, but the atmosphere is very quaint and cozy. The service was outstanding. The minute a plate is empty it is immediately taken off your table. It's like they had one waiter assigned to each table, and the owner, Lorenzo, is always walking around making sure everything is up to standard. 
Our party ordered several of every appetizer on the menu, and none of them were a disappointment. The beef carpaccio is the best I've ever had, and we also had a homemade mortadella and salami which were flavored to perfection. The asparagus was delicious also... 
For the main entree, I had the Rigatoni alla Amatriciana (Willy Brown's favorite, haha) which was perfectly cooked and flavored. I also tasted the Ravioli di Aragosta in Salsa Rosa which was the homemade stuffed lobster and crab ravioli in a vodka creme sauce...HOLY MOLY...I don't even like crab, but this ravioli was to my palette's delight! The wild boar fettuccine with porcini reduction was also perfectly flavored. Allegro knows their Italian, and is probably the best tasting I've had in the city to date. You have to get a reservation tho, as the place fills up quick (even on a Monday night), and the only thing I would like to see is maybe a bit of a bigger dining area so everything doesn't feel quite as cramped.
author: C R.

description: Had dinner there the other night, haven't been in a while. Excellent food, even better service. Lorenzo makes you feel like you're family. Great spot for a weeknight out (if you can get in) or an intimate evening.
author: Arthur S.

description: I admit I have a strong weakness for restaurants that give you complimentary things- but a restaurant that gives you free bruschetta and 3 glasses of port AND a long-stem red rose? I'm in love. The food itself is superb- my fettuccine with lobster was amazing- a homemade pasta with a lobster tail on the side- what else do you need? Its wonderful.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Good food but rich. Its very charming as its a little place hidden in an all residential neighborhood.
author: Anna S.

description: Love love love! This is the BEST italian food. The place is so tiny and homey. You'll know the owner in no time as you down wine and salmon carpaccio. Don't even look at the menu, just tell Lorenzo to bring you whatever he thinks is good. Especially though, the fettucine with white sauce and the asparagus in truffel oil and parm. Mmmm.
author: Lisa M.

description: I LOVE this place.  I have been here several times over the past few years and every visit is a great experience.  You are made to feel like a honored regular guest every time you go.  The food is fantastic and you really get the opportunity to enjoy your meal as courses come slow and service is never rushed.  It is very reminiscent of a tiny restaurant in Italy where you could stay for hours enjoying great food and company.
author: Katie M.

description: it's the Italian restaurant I always dreamed of in San Francisco!  I was here with a group of about 8 on Friday night.  It was served family style and I didn't see a menu (I think because one of the couples eats there a few times a week, can't be sure) and there was the most decadent fettucine alfredo made with truffle oil that I could have ever dreamed of.  I can't come up with a single suggestion.  it's just that good.  The best Italian restaurant this Jersey Italian has tried in the 7 years she's been here.
author: Beth V.

description: This restaurant is amazing.  Romantic setting, excellent wine selection, and unbelievable food and service.  It is a perfect neighborhood restaurant that is hidden away from all the busy turist spots.  A little secret that needs to be shared with the world.
author: Jose C.

description: I had a great meal here...it's like it's always valentine's day. The owner passes out roses to the women when they leave and turns up the Sinatra and makes everyone sing along. It's kitchy, but it's cute and the food is delicious. Weird location, but kind of nice that it's out of the way and not everyone knows about it yet.
author: Shelley M.

description: Allegro Romano serves authentic Italian food that is absolutely delicious. We had an appetizer of risotto with fresh shaved black truffle garnished at table side as a first course that was delicious. My pasta dish was equally as good and the service was impeccable. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Mitch K.

description: I wasn't sure what to expect of this place.  To my surprise, the restaurant has such a warm feeling.  Almost thought I was back in Italy... very romantic with lots of great food and pairing wine recommended from Lorenzo himself.   I give this place a thumbs up in Russian Hill.
author: Evangeline C.

description: came here around valentines day..........small quaint neighborhood restaurant with nice touches of rose petals on candle lit tables & was given a rose when we left.  hub got a steak plate & i got their gorgonzola gnocchi, don't remember our appetizer........not memorable, just remembered that we both didn't care for our dishes.  also got fake greeting vibe, so we won't back.   we prefer amarena, that's our spot.
author: Cindi N.

description:
Our family friends have lived in Russian Hill for many years. So when they recommended Allegro Romano, I hoped their advice was based on the fact that the restaurant has good food and service, and not just because it's the closest restaurant to their apartment.  Well, they were right, and last night was one of the best dining experiences I've had in San Francisco --- and I've lived in the Bay Area almost my entire life.

Our reservation was on the early side and so when we first arrived, the place was fairly empty.  The host Lorenzo let us choose which table covered in rose petals we wanted for our own.  My brother's rigatoni and bacon dish, "Willie Brown's favorite,"  was my favorite as well.  Not only was the food authentic Italian, but so was the host. Lorenzo let us stay at our table for 3 hours without bringing the bill until we asked.  He brought out roses for my mom and me, three rounds of dessert, and kept our wine glasses full- all for no extra charge.  And no one in my family liked tiramisu before last night, but after eating Allegro's chocolate version, we are all converts.
author: Sarah F.

description: This is a wonderful restaurant. Found it on Yelp, thought we'd give it a try for a special occasion last weekend. When you walk in the door, you're in the hostess stand, and you're treated like family from that point on. We had bruschetta and Buffalo Mozzarella for appetizers, and Pacific Halibut and Salmon for entrees. The food was excellent, perfectly paced, and served with a friendliness that was just the right touch. Note of caution - they don't have a lot or valet parking, so think about a cab. We drove in from San Mateo and they helped us find parking, but we were there very early in the evening.
author: John C.

description: This neighborhood restaurant always rolls out the welcome mat for it's customers, and is wonderful about making you feel like you've come home to family! The food and the ambience are wonderful, and the service is fantastic!
author: Trip C.

description: This place was fantastic. I've lived around the corner for 3 years but never tried it. The food was so good - esspecially the pasta with white truffle sauce - amazing! Inexpensive too! I'll definitely go back soon.
author: Kelly C.

description: My folks came out for a visit last month and happened to be here for their anniversary. My dad mentioned he wanted Italian food, so thanks to you Yelpers and your recommendation, I took them here. All the food was amazing right down to the desserts. Of the entrees we tried, you couldn't go wrong with any of them (the Rigatoni alla Amatriciana, the Ravioli di Aragosta in Salsa Rosa, and the ravioli special of the evening). And the desserts were amazing as well. Only con is the parking in the neighborhood but the owner was nice enough to let us park in front of the fire hydrant saying, "don't worry, the cops always ask me before they tow a car."
author: Derek B.

description: I had high expectations given the great reviews, but they exceeded them.  The food was great, but the service is what sets this restaurant apart. Our watier was friendly, highly attentive, and more importantly--let the patrons stay about an hour after paying the check continually going between tables refilling everyones dessert Port wine glasses for free.  Definitely going back
author: Kristopher B.

description: My husband and I came here for our anniversary its a very romantic restaurant the tables are adorned with rose petals. The customer service is A+ they're very attentive and make sure they tend to your needs. One of the many reasons we wanted to come here was to try their tartufo which is world famous it is an Italian ice cream that was invented by the family of the person who owns Allegro Romano and he has incorporated it in his menu, the reason I didn't give them five stars was because I actually had a better tartufo in New York I don't know how that was possible but the day i visited the tartufo tasted a bit like Hagan Dazs Ice Cream. The food however is amazing It is a four course menu like all Italian restaurants so make sure you come prepared to spend a big amount. We had brushetta, crepes filled with salmon topped with caviar and a very delicious truffle sauce and the beef carpaccio as our appetizers for our pasta course we had scallops with the squid ink risotto the squid ink adds a very distinct taste but makes it that much better for the secondi course we had the salmon with capers and mashed potatoes the salmon was medium rare and very juicy the capers tied in make the taste very special, the veal topped with the prosciutto and bathed in white wine was delicious. another desert I ordered was the chocolate mousse cake which was a lot tastier than the tartufo at the end when we were about to leave the owner handed me a rose which was a very sweet gesture that they do for they're customers I can say that I will be coming here again.
author: Juliette P.

description:
Lorenzo was so helpful in picking wine and making sure we did not over/under order. 

The food was very tasty.

They gave my wife a rose at the end of the night an dI think that is pretty regular thing.

I'll go back soon
author: Kwesi E.

description: Lorenzo makes you feel at home! We had a wonderful dinner here and we are looking forward to going back. The service was amazing. We loved the romantic Italian music playing in the background. Definitely  a more memorable dinning experience
author: Shannon H.

description:
The glitter and rose petals on the tables may have been a little bit much, but our experience was otherwise amazing. We dined family style, which is what a friend recommended. The food came quickly, there was lots of it, and it was SPECTACULAR. I highly recommend the tortellini with pesto and truffle oil. The wine list was great, and they had no problem decanting the two bottles of red that we brought. The atmosphere was cozy, Italian and very warm. The waiters were diligent and always at your elbow to fill wine glasses, remove empty plates and make suggestions. One of the highlights of the evening was our interaction with the owner. He took orders, passed out plates and helped pour the wine without hesitation. There was an impromptu sing along with Dean Martin's Mambo Italiano part way through the meal, roses handed out after dessert and glasses of his personal Chardonnay served as a treat. 

I will definitely be returning to this restaurant, it was a truly great experience.
author: Caity S.

description:
Good local place, outside of the touristy areas.  Great Italian food at a reasonable price.  Holds large parties although it is a quaint, romanitc little restaurant at the top of Russian Hill.

This is one of those "finds" on Yelp, although I think the place is getting discovered...I called Friday afternoon for reservations for 2 Friday night to find the place was booked through TUESDAY...so make reservations, and enjoy!
author: C K.

description: The food is wonderful. My favorite dish is the gnocci. Delicious! Lorenzo is a fabulous host. I like how he always knows what we want to eat. I go there all the time, to entertain clients, with friends for special occasions, and even with my children. This is a hidden gem in Russian Hill.
author: Lily M.

description:
love the location,
no fucking tourists,
simple food, affordable wines,
great , a bit cheesy, atmosphere.
Lorenzo the owner always make me feel so welcome,
I always leave a bit drunk...fall down on the way out...I feel right at home!
love that little place.
author: verstonku a.

description:
I have to agree with many of the other positive reviews - we had a really nice time here.  The host/owner? is most definitely someone who wants to be remembered but you soon realize that what he'll be remembered for is his warm hospitality as opposed to the color spectrum of his wardrobe. 

They are definitely on the generous side with their assortment of amuse bouche...from the bruschetta to the biscottis and  strawberries to the port - a very nice touch.

We started with the asparagus which was delicious but how can you go wrong with good olive oil and cheese?  I had "Willie Brown's favorite" which was quite flavorful.  Hubby had the bolognese  and while the pasta itself was good - I didn't care for the sauce.

The service is most attentive without being intrusive.  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and will be back.
author: L F.

description:
This restaurant is cheesy in every way you'd expect from a cliche italian romantic dinner- from the voice mail message when you call for a reservation (you'll be alarmed by the booming "Bonjourno!" (pardon sp.), to the italian opera music, rose pedals scattered on the table, long-stem red roses given to the women, to the oh-so-euro sweater vest of the host.  But, the cheesiness is endearing and particularly after a glass of their house red (phenomenal - just like ordering the house red in Italy) it actually becomes rather charming.

As for the food, it's solid Italian.  Although I thought their bruscetta could have been improved if the bread was still warm, the tomatoes were fresh and perfectly seasoned.  My hubby ordered the caprese which is difficult to mess up but also hard to stand out - although the pesto olive oil drizzle did make it more unique than others I've had in the city.

For the main course I had the Lobster Fetticini special in a roasted tomato sauce.  They were generous with the lobster and the fetticini was house-made.   Although I don't think the pasta itself was quite as good as Milano's, the dish was satisfying and tasted exactly like you'd expect - in a good way.

My husband ordered the steak which he gushed over, I think even claimed was the best italian steak he's ever had.  From this dish alone, he'd give the restaurant 5 stars.  I'm not a steak girl, but the bite I was able to negotiate off his plate was juicy and full of flavor - and not surprising it was so small.  

The chocolate tiramisu was absolutely amazing - a must order.  Perfectly traditional in execution, with the extra flare of chocolate powder on top.  

All in all - quirky and cozy with traditional and well executed Italian fare.  Great for a romantic date, as long as you don't take yourself too seriously.
author: Casey M.

description:
And that is a strong four.

I ventured to Allegro for a birthday dinner with a friend of mine. It wasn't supposed to be a rushed dinner, but our original intentions were by no means to stay for 3 1/2 hours! And yet we did. 

The small space of Allegro makes every meal feel intimate and fun. Lorenzo (The owner) is almost always there, and is probably the hardest working person in there as well. That was very impressive to me. 

I ordered a mixed green salad, and for my main course I had tortelinis in a pesto, white truffle sauce. It was phenomenal! Everyone I was with truly enjoyed their meals as well. The others ordered:
A simple pasta with a meat ragu sauce, which was highly enjoyed.
Lamb chops (apparently cooked to perfection) with a side of Lobster Bisque 
Lobster ravioli in a pink cream sauce.

After dinner was finished we capped off our meal with tiramisu and some Port wine. I wouldn't recommend the tiramisu to be honest. The port however, is a different story. At this point we had been eating for around 2 hours. The final hour and 1/2 was spent sipping the complimentary bottomless port they provided us with. Along with the port, they also brought out a second round of complimentary dessert.

The evening was one of the best dinning experiences I have yet had here in San Francisco. Comparable to an authentic Italian dinner experience. Fantastic food, unbeatable company, an excess of time, and free port.
author: Kelli T.

description: My boyfriend and I were exploring the city before moving out here. We really wanted to eat at a quaint restaurant and we definitely found it at Allegro Romano! The food was wonderful but the service is really what stood out. We had a very attentive waiter who kept surprising us with extra dishes! We'll definitely return when we settle in!
author: Lindsey C.

description: Have the asparagus soup with white truffle oil and the filet mignon.  The meat does not even need a knife to cut it.  The port reduction sauce?  Oh yeah, baby!  We also had the cappucchino mousse for dessert.  Yummy stuff.  A little overpriced for the portion sizes, but we did not go away hungry, either.  Service was excellent.  They had almost more wait staff than guests; and the owner, dressed in torquouse top-to-bottom, was very attentive.  We fould ourselves the next evening wanting to stop by to see in what color he would be dressed that night!  Good place, do go.
author: Donalyn D.

description:
The food here is really fantastic.  Our table had lamb chops and gnochi with white truffle sauce and both were outstanding.  We also had lemon cake which was really good.  The only reason this is not five stars was the service.  The two guys who were there were fantastic but the owner has to take the order and draw up the bill?  Were these guys not trusted to do it?

Anyway, when we got there there was only one other table but the owner was so busy shmoozing we waited at least 10 minutes to order.  And at the end of the night, the poor waiters had to tell us about 3 times that the bill was coming after we asked for it.

I don't mind not being shmoozed, but at least let your other waitstaff take care of us!  I'll try to go again when I'm not so tired and just wanting to get out of there and go to sleep.
author: Sarah B.

description:
As college students about to graduate (read: near broke), my friends and I wanted to experience at least one amazing meal in San Francisco for our goodbye celebration. We chose Allegro Romano based on its previous reviews, and it did not disappoint. 

Immediately after walking in, we were greeting with warmth by the owner Lorenzo and his staff. The restaurant is small and the walls have pictures of famous people who have frequented the establishment. Lorenzo is a good host who can make everyone in the room have a good time. By the end of the night we had celebrated not just our own graduation party, but also the pregnancy of his sister and an engagement of another couple. 

Everything we ate was delicious. I especially enjoyed the Rigatoni alla Amatriciana and the tiramisu dessert, and would definitely recommend others to try them. 

Each table was sprinkled lightly with rose petals and we received roses at the end of our meal. 

The whole experience was so much fun!
author: Teresa C.

description: The food is wondeful and Lorenzo is a gracious host.  This is an excellent local, neighborhood place!
author: karen R.

description: This used to be a real favorite of ours--excellent food and ambiance.  However, on our last visit, that opinion was changed by Lorenzo, the owner.   While the waitstaff was very good, we got this distinct feeling from the beginning of being rushed.  This included three attempts to clear our plates before we were finished, and taking the check holder before we'd even figured out the bill.  We'd arrived at 6:20 pm., and at 7:50 (exactly 90 minutes later), Lorenzo came to our table and said, "you have to go, there are people waiting outside".  If we'd been there for two hours, or maybe if he'd at least said something like, "gee, I'm really sorry, but there is a party waiting for your table", it might have been not so bad, but he was rude, apparently booking the tables at 90 minutes back-to-back.  There are so many great restaurants in the City, I don't need to go back to a restaurant where I was told "you have to go".
author: Jim H.

description: I came here for a dinner a few months back and am just getting to the review.  The couple we ate with knew Lorenzo (the owner) pretty well.  He made it a point to go out of his way and welcome me as it was my first time dining there.  We ate family style and I can honestly say I never want to eat another way.  All in all we had about 8 different dishes.  Some of them weren't on the menu.  The truffle oil infused tortellini was to die for.  By far my favorite dish in this entire city.  If you see it on their menu I suggest going to try it.  Perfect location and great atmosphere.  Service alone warrants 5 stars.
author: Stace G.

description: I'm a sucker for quaint neighborhood restaurants, especially when they're Italian! Needless to say, this fit the bill. I love the location, away from the hustle and bustle and parking seemed decent (at least when I was there) on a Friday night. The decor is nice, though I must admit a bit cheesy, almost North Beach-y, with rose pedals on the table. It has sort of a "Valentine's Day everyday" feel but I was able to move past that when the food arrived. Bruschetta, good but nothing to write home about...on to the main course. It must be said, I'm a sucker for pasta, but I'm a HUGE sucker for truffle oil and if you share my love, then this is most definitely the place to go, as several dishes are prepared with it. I decided to try the Fettuccine with White Truffle Sauce- to die for! Fabulous! I also managed to sneak a bite of the Lobster and Crab Ravioli with Vodka sauce from my fellow diner's plate- also very good, though it could have used another ravioli or two. We finished off the night with the Chocolate Tiramisu. I'm generally not a big fan of tiramisu but this was great! It came on a huge platter which led me to believe they'd somehow mistaken and served us the whole dessert tray, but no, it was just the tiramisu with warm chocolate sauce and a very generous display of strawberries surrounding it. Mmmm! Wonderful. Service, however, also failed in my book. The owner (well, what I assume was the owner) completely ignored us and spent our entire dining experience talking to a large group towards the front. The server didn't appear to speak much English (or maybe he just didn't speak up), and didn't seem very knowledgeable; especially when it came to the wines. Bottom line, location is fantastic, decor somewhat cheesy, service quite lacking, but food is A++!
author: Kelly H.

description: Like Amanda F., I too received a message from Allegro Romano (l.l.) asking me to take down my negative review because it was "false."  His behavior was petty and absurd.  My stomach turns and I grow nauseous every time I walk by this establishment.
author: J P.

description:
My fiance and I were in town for a couple of nights and had just gotten engaged and Allegro was recommended to us by  the concierge at our hotel. We were very excited to go out and celebrate our engagement at this very romantic spot. The reviews on Yelp were terrific. We arrived a little early due to our stroll being cut short on a count of rain. We were seated promptly in the corner by the kitchen and treated poorly the entire evening. While I was looking at the wine list the owner asked if I was having wine, when I replied not yet, he told the server to take our glasses away because we weren't drinking. We ordered the gnocchi and tortellini special, which were amazing. The best I have ever had, the gnocchi melted in your mouth. But as we were savoring the last bites, the owner removed our plates without asking if we were finished! Then as he prepared the table next to us for another party, he dumped the rose petals from that table on to ours while he set their table. We were rushed the entire time, in and out of the place in 40 mins. The service not only ruined some wonderful food, it put a huge damper on our engagement dinner. 
I have never felt so angry after such a delicious meal.
Food great, service awful.
author: Kefah C.

description: My boyfriend and I discovered this place on a walk back from North Beach after having mediocre Italian food.  This restaurant looked so adorable, all lit up with candles and overflowing with flowers and Italian décor.   We vowed to go back and try it sometime.  But when we looked on yelp at the review, we were skeptical since it showed $$$ signs for pricing.   We finally went to eat there last night, and we were surprised by how less expensive it was then originally thought to be.  The most expensive thing on the menu was $24.  Most dishes were between $10 and $20 which is more than reasonable.  The dining experience we encountered was one of the best so far.  My bf and I are somewhat of gnocchi connoisseurs and we try it at every Italian restaurant.  Theirs was delightful, very light and fluffy, with a great gorgonzola sauce.  We also had the tiramisu, which was absolutely amazing.  They gave us three glasses of port each to go with our dessert, all of which ended up being on the house.  To top of my night I received a red rose when we left, talk about a great date with Allegro Romano.
author: kira I.

description: Not sure why everyone is crazy about this restaurant. It felt pretty touristy to me. We were interrupted constantly during our meal by about 5 different servers which made me feel like the dining experience was really about their "show" and not so much about reading the needs of the customer. I have had amazing experiences in our wide array of San Francisco restaurants with waitstaff who can serve you beautifully and humorously without constant interruption.  If you see that your diners want to talk and catch up, please stop asking them questions every three minutes. It was mind boggling to me. The starters were not so great -  the bruschetta amuse-bouche had probably been sitting around awhile (mushy bread soaked all the way through) and the tomatoes in the caprese didn't taste fresh/were of poor quality. But... the pasta was good and everyone enjoyed their main course. The head person there was unbelievably hard working,  kind and accommodating, which is the only reason I gave this place 3 stars instead of two.  If you're a local, this is probably not the place for you.
author: Win S.

description: I thought this whole time that I had already written this review but I guess I forgot. The so and I went here and I was so ridiculously excited after reading all the other reviews. The place wasn't full because it was early so we were excited about a quasi-romantic night. I was actually really looking forward to some embarrassing singing, some rose petals and some really friendly service. None of that happened. The ID check was really brusque, which pretty much summed up the whole experience. Since I basically only eat Italian food and I rarely stray from the city, I'm used to either bubbly, overdone super-friendly service or quiet, welcoming, formal dining service. This was more like I'd-like-to-get-you-people-out-of-here service, which actually really can damper an evening when I bought a dress and spent way too much on the food they were serving. The bussers were incredibly friendly, so I chatted with them. It's not that I expect the wait staff to have time  to sit down and talk philosophy, but when I tried my few words of Italian and laughed, the guy looked at me like I was dressed in rags. Food was good, but pricey, and since I can't remember it, seemingly not that notable. Bummer.
author: Katie T.

description: major disappointment.  too noisy and food oversalted.  steaks floating in a sea of gravy and tough meat also. would definitely avoid this place!!  6 of us and all of us thought the same.
author: bruce s.

description: This place was highly recommended by a friend.  I reserved a table on Friday, the 28th of November. Took a car from the hotel only to find the place competely dark and closed. Perhaps the food is great - I'll never know as we ended up eating someplace else that night.
author: Lawrence W.

description: Last night was the third time I have eaten at Allegro Romano, and I will never go back.  The food has never been great, but the personality of the place made up for it.  Last night, we arrived on time for our 5:30 dinner reservation and were seated right away.  So far, so good.  The problems began when the waiter came to our table.  He studiously avoided looking at my dinner companion, only looking at me when telling us about the specials and the wine list. He then mistook my question about an entree as an order and then asked my dinner partner for his entree order.  He turned quickly to leave without asking if we would like an appetizer.  Before we were finished with our meals, he told us to give him 10-15 minutes to order our cab.  We definitely felt rushed and unwelcome.  When we left, I did not receive a rose, which I received the other two times upon leaving.   I know that Willie Brown's favorite dish is served at this restaurant, but I left wondering if the poor service and the rush job were because my dining companion was African-American. I honestly can't think of any other reason that my experience last night was so different from my previous experiences and from the experiences of the people seated at the two tables next to us.
author: Jan L.

description: we love going to Allegro Romano.  It's always our go-to place when we have guests in town.  Lorenzo is the best in the business.  It is a special experience- great service and ambiance.
author: Erin L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Everything about this place is amazing!  I love everything from the intimate and fun interior decor to the owner's crazy Roberto Cavalli pants. They play Andrea Boceli and the owner sings out loud every once in a while to the opera music playing in the background. In fact, one time during a birthday dinner, the owner and his wife started singing "That's Amore." Very precious and totally not cheesy.  Both the food and the service are exceptional. On my last visit, I ordered the Fettuccine with wild boar ragu & porcini redaction which was delicious. I also recommend the Rigatoni pasta as well as the the lobster and crab stuffed ravioli in vodka pink sauce. I tried the tortellini with pesto and white truffle sauce but it was a little too heavy for me. During my last visit, we were also treated to complimentary bruschetta and tiramisu. I also recommend getting the family style option if you are dining with a group. You get to taste a variety of things thoughtfully selected from the menu. I can't get enough of this place. I am coming back again and again.
author: Annie Y.

description: Lorenzo and his staff are tops!! and the food is amazing!! even if you aren't on the wall of movie stars and celebs who have eaten there... you feel like it! I am going to make this place a weekly stop!! Happy fifth anniversary!! Much love and happiness!! Big Spence and Big Steve (the twins or two of the triplets) of course Yevette too!!
author: spencer j.

description: I have lived in San Francisco for over 2 years, and have been to a number of "highly-rated" restautants during that time. Although Allegro does not receive ratings as high as other pricier Italian restaurants (which will remain nameless, only to spare them my not-so-favorable comments) in the city, the combination of quality dishes and extraordinary service make this my favorite "special occasion" spot. Surrounded by families young and old, single men and women in their 20s and 30s, Allegro attracts people of all ages for its warm and dedicated staff, and its high-quality food. The bruschetta has a powerful flavor, served with wonderfully ripe tomatoes, although sometimes drenced in too much olive oil. I would recommend the Lobster Bisque or Mixed Greens to start, depending on your taste buds that night, the latter of course being much lighter. When I asked for a wine recommendation, one of the owners brought out a bottle of chardonnay that he always drinks, and we loved it! It also was NOT the most expensive one, which is often the case when owners want to "recommend" something. While I do not eat boar, a friend proclaimed twice, "this is still the highest-quality, best-tasting boar I've ever had." Yes, he is a boar-aficianado. I have ordered the red snapper twice, and they prepare it two different ways, one with a red sauce drizzled with olives and garlic, one with a light wine sauce. In all honesty, while the food truly is some of the best Italian I've had in the city, I love Allegro more for its genuinely friendly and unpretentious staff. I feel like I'm in someone's living room when I'm there, and I chat with the staff. This place is hands-down, my favorite spot to be on a special night..
author: Spice O.

description: This little spot is fantastic. Romantic. Authentic. Beautiful decor and a very friendly staff. Its a great place for a date or to bring your family when they are in from out of town. There's a really nice charm to it, especially from the host if catch him on one of the all plaid outfit nights. I brough a group of 5 friends here one night and as we left- the hostess gave all the ladies red roses. I highly recommend their lobster ravioli if it's still on the menu.
author: Anika F.

description: We live in the neighborhood so its easy for us to go here for dinner.   We went on a Friday night.  The ambiance is very romantic, and they do not rush you through the meal which is nice.  The menu changes daily.   Food was very good.  The tomato/mozzaralla soup was delicious.  Call ahead for reservations.
author: Deb W.

description: Lobster and Crab Ravioli are SOOOOOOOOO GOOD! Fun atmosphere, great date location and awesome free bottomless port!
author: Luba R.

description: Totally agree with Phil H.  Allegro embodies (can a restaurant embody?) the perfect Italian restaurant experience.  Our server was so so kind.  The vegetables and the pasta were absolutely fresh.  And the wine pairings were perfect.  Honestly, it does not get any better than this.  LOVED it.
author: Jane M.

description: Outstanding!  I had read some of the reviews on yelp and was skeptical of all of the amazing reviews.  Well this place lives up to every 5 star review it receives.  They really do make you feel like you are a VIP guest.  The service was outstanding.  The food was outstanding.  Thank you for a wonderful night Allegro.
author: Aaron P.

description: I feel badly writing this review since everyone else had such nice things to say, but I had such a horrible experience here that I am still confused by it. This is my first review ever. I have eaten at this restaurant twice. It is 3 blocks from house and so it seemed like an ideal neighborhood restaurant to eat at on a regular basis. The first time I went there, my review would be similar to everyone else's. We had an amazing time, they gave us free port after our meal which they kept refilling, the food was amazing. But then we went back shortly after to celebrate some good news I had just received and they were very rude. The owner kept staring at us and rushed our meal. We felt very uncomfortable. They did not give us any port and and everyone else around us had some. We were there to celebrate and it was a really awkward meal. We had a full meal with wine, appetizers, salad, entrees and dessert and the owner seemed like he just wanted us out of there. It made for a very awkward experience. My boyfriend asked for some port (he was going to pay for it) and the owner stared at us liking we were being obtrusive in his restaurant. He brought us out some and there was barely a sip in each glass. We were going to pay for it, but he didn't end up charging us. I guess we thought it was expected since he had done it the first time and literally every table but ours had some. Maybe he shouldn't set the precedent. Anyways it was a totally strange experience where we almost felt like pariahs! Which is really a bummer b/c we would have loved it to be our new spot. We are definitely never going back.
author: E G.

description: We had a wonderful dinner for my birthday at Allegro Romano last week.  This was our first time dining here, but we have been wanting to go for months because we heard great things.  It did not disappoint!  We had a hard time finding a parking spot so when hubby dropped me off to continue searching, the owner Lorenzo personally loaned us one of his spots right in front!  We snuggled into our corner table and were instantly greeted with glasses of champagne and bruschetta on the house.  We tried two of the specials of the night - steamed mussels and homemade linguini with lobster tails.  The lobster was cooked perfectly.  We also had their caesar with fresh crab meat and lobster raviolis.  Absolutely decadent!  After dinner we were given numerous glasses of porto and two desserts (yes two!).  A plate with tiramisu, fresh berries and biscotti came first, followed by a rich chocolate gelato.  What a way to end the perfect meal!  Lorenzo was such a delight and we had a great time chatting with him about Italy.  Hubby is first generation Italian - he knows great pasta and great hospitality.  If that's what you're looking for, look no further.  We can't wait to go back to our little slice of Italy!
author: Kate G.

description: good food pero esta en la vecindad incorrecta.
author: Manny C.
